title: Good location, great staff
text:
Nice hotel with good location. Staff is fantastic although  the rooftop bar maybe needs better management. The bellhop, Josh, is fantastic! Always around and so helpful.

Just FYI- Times Square like much of the city REEKS of pot. No moral problems with it,  but definitely a strike on the city. And be prepared because NYC is DIRTY. Used to live there, and this was probably this most disappointing part of my experience.

title: Best hotel staff!
text: I booked the wrong hotel location and got to the reception desk at Times Square to be relocated because my meetings were two blocks away but they were so out! I walked out and called a cab and Raheen ran to me right before I left and told me he’s going to figure it out so I should come back inside. He took my ID and credit card and booked the room for me for 2 nights and told me he was going to get me a good room and met all my requests- wow. I have never experienced such warmth, kindness and accommodation from a hotel staff and didn’t expect him to care as much as he did. The best part is, he told me he will call the other hotel for me so I didn’t have to and get them to cancel my reservation without a charge, he came through! I got refunded and he sent me a text when I got to my room that it was handled. Idk how he did it but I’m beyond grateful and I want to recognize him for such phenomenal service! He gave me his email to reach out for assistance in the future so I know where I’ll be back for my meetings! Everyone here is so kind! I am grateful

title: Magical family holiday
text: Great base for our intensive sightseeing tour of New York. Josh, our concierge, was a fantastic host and nothing was too much trouble. This location is close to the action and about 50 yards from the subway entrance which is a great way to travel.

title: Peace and space in the TOP rooms
text:
Very positive experience especially regarding the room: without carpet, new furnishings, very comfortable bed and, last but not least (indeed), perfectly soundproofed. Yes, because despite being just a few hundred meters from Times Square, the quality of sleep is very high.
I appreciated the cleaning carried out every 2 days as a choice both because it was communicated immediately during check-in and because, although it was not daily, when it was carried out it was done very well.

The friendly and professional staff both during check in and check out.

Another note of merit is the fitness room, which is decidedly large and well equipped.

The only flaw is that although the location is excellent for getting around, the area, especially in the evening, is not the best if you are alone.

Recommended structure

title: Great staff
text:
I forgot what turn out to be half my luggage, including my passport. Staff was great to work with to get it all back in a timely manner.

Gym is small but well equipped. Bar and restaurant on the property are okay. Good views from the rooftop. Would come back

title: We will be coming back!
text: The staff was amazing and very attentive. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The location cannot be beat! There is a subway nearby but is also walking distance to Broadway shows and tons of restaurants. Josh was incredibly helpful to us in navigating transportation and getting around the city! We will definitely back!

title: Excellent location with friendly staff!
text: This hotel is great!  This was our second time visiting, and we will be back.  The hotel is in a convenient location to Times Square.  There is a subway station within walking distance.  A Starbucks is across the street.  Joshua was extremely helpful and always a smiling face!

title: Amazing service can make any hotel feel 5 stars
text: Adequate hotel as most AC’s are but the reason I have to to give it 5 stars is Josh the Bellman. He is an absolute legend. He definitely went above and beyond to make it feel like a Forbes 5 Star experience. If I end back in the area if Josh is still there I will be coming back.

title: Met all expectations
text: Met all expectations which were clean, safe facility with clean rooms in a great location.  The front desk staff are *superior.* Friendly, helpful, lively.  Nice towels, bedding, lobby.   Attached restaurant Boqueria is fantatsic.  Good food, fun drinks, and great staff. Very pleased with our 6 night stay.

title: Phenomenal Customer Service
text:
The staff members were amazing. Front desk, bell captain, housekeeping, all hotel personnel truly wowed us. My friend and I are still raving about the superb customer service. We felt like royalty. I wish we could thank everyone by name. Joshua was so attentive, helpful and informative. All around, we could not have had a better customer experience. 

The property was very nice. The space truly over delivered considering the cost. 

Clean, spacious, renovated. Great shower.

title: Great hotel and Ricardo is the best!
text:
This hotel is in a great location, is very clean and rooms a great! But, the best part of this hotel is how great the staff are! The best of the best! Welcome you every morning and welcome you back at night! 
By far the best employee at the hotel is Ricardo! He was so helpful and gave excellent recommendations! He helped you with anything and everything needed. Thank you for a great stay!

title: Thank you Raheen!!!
text: Sierra Goldson- I had a very unfortunate mishap where my reservation was canceled. My flight and everything was already booked and by this time the hotel prices in New York City had skyrocketed. I was so devastated and did not know what I was going to do. I spoke with the front desk Raheen who was Heaven sent. He went above and beyond to speak with the appropriate department to get my reservation reinstated. After having some issues with representatives before him, letting me know that it was out of their control and they did not have the power to reinstate it,  I prayed all night and my prayers were answered the following day when I got Raheen as my receptionist. He did not have to go above and beyond and show so much empathy and customer service skills. I am a Marriott Bon Voy member, and because of his customer service I will always stay at this hotel whenever I stay in New York City. Thank you 1 million times Raheen!!!!

title: Great NY experience
text:
Great stay in NYC!

I’ve been to NY before and my hotel experiences previously have been drastically different.  This hotel was clean, spacious, accommodating and had a great staff!  Notably Josh and Ricardo at the front were super helpful with making our experience 5 star.  Recommendations, care of our luggage to advise during our stay was welcomed and honest.  
It would be easy to recommend or stay here again with our experience.

title: a comfortable stay at a Marriott!
text: On a recent trip into New York City, I followed a friend's recommendation and stayed at the AC Hotel in Times Square South. I liked the fact that it was centrally located and near major transit hubs. There are two restaurants on the premises, one is Boqueria, a tapas bar and the other is Castell, a rooftop lounge. My room was very comfortable featuring a large double bed with a widescreen TV and blackout curtains. A nice option about the TV was that you could access Netflix, Pandora, or Your tube provided you had a subscription. There was ample place to hang up you clothes and two drawers for smaller items. There was also a small refrigerator and a safe. The refrigerator is not a minibar. There is also an ironing board and an iron. The floor is wood throughout. There was a nice desk and chair with adequate outlets and USB ports. A coffee and tea service is provided. You can adjust the temperature of the room easily to your liking. The lobby is a nice size and there is also a place adjacent to the front desk where you can purchase snacks and have them credited to your room. The bathroom is large, very comfortable with a handheld and raindrop shower with good water pressure and hot water! The restaurants do serve breakfast at your expense but there are plenty of places in the area and on 9th Avenue for breakfast.  I would recommend and return.

title: Raheen, Thank you.
text: The thing that stood out to me the most was how attentive and compassionate Raheen from the front office is. We had a whole conversation about how much I love coffee even though he does not like it but helped with great coffee recommendations for me and he remembered 2 days after during my stay that when I was in the seating area getting ready for my daily meeting, he stopped his own work to ask if he could get me some coffee while I work- I cannot express my gratitude to this young man, so much like my grandson.  And I share the same name as his mom so that’s a plus!  He made my stay feel like home and I know where to stay the next time I visit NYC and will be sure to recommend this hotel to my colleagues the next time we come for meetings. The entire staff is friendly and great! Doorman is always welcoming. A few minor issues here with housekeeping but I can appreciate the front office staff paying attention to detail and taking care of me whenever I needed them. Thank you, Raheen and thank you to everyone that helped me throughout my stay.

title: 24hrs in Ac Hotel
text:
Joshua was very helpful and attentive to our needs he order us a taxi to take us to the airport and he made sure to take our bags to the taxi and help the driver putting inside.the restaurant boqueria, the food and the drink were delicious. 
And the Ac hotel was beautiful, loved staying in there , next time I will definitely book a room with more days to enjoy.
Thank to all the staff but specially to Joshua .

title: Great service and location
text:
The service here is fantastic.  They really go above and beyond.  Thanks Antonio and Tatiana!
We were here to see a couple shows, great location.  They really seem like they care!

Would recommend to anyone in town for experience around Broadway and ofc times square.

title: Amazing
text: This is my go to Hotel while in NYC I’m from the west coast and frequent NYC often.  The staff is absolutely amazing !  Joshua always goes above and beyond with a simple greeting when he sees you to reminding you of amenities and even assisting with their car service.  I truly felt like he gave me the total treatment this time around.  Thank you Joshua for over exceeding my expectations! I truly appreciate your hospitality! Book your stay here and it won’t regret it.

title: Worst hotel
text: I had an incredibly disappointing stay due to the heating not functioning properly. Despite being "graciously" compensated with a $30 credit, I was unable to utilize it. I strongly advise avoiding this hotel, as it is situated in what I  thought not the best area and the hotel systems are malfunctioning. The heating issues forced me to choose between setting the temperature at 77 degrees and feeling suffocated, or enduring freezing conditions below this temperature, as the system only produced cold air. Although attempts were made to rectify the situation, they were unsuccessful.

title: Celebrate in NYC at the AC Times Square
text:
Nothing like a trip to NYC to celebrate a birthday, anniversary, graduation or special event! And a weekend at the AC Times Square is the perfect spot to call home while there. Convenient to all the shows, great restaurants, Times Square, shopping & the best delis & affordable! New contemporary decor. And the Castel rooftop bar offered a perfect spot to relax while enjoying the view whether enjoying outside seating (heated) or cozying up to the fireplace or sitting at the high top tables! AC Times Square Staff was outstanding from Antonio at reception, to Eric the manager of Castel to Josh the doorman! 
Thank you all for a great weekend!

title: Great staff, great location!
text: AC hotels are the best choice for business trips which I have chosen for the longest while now. I love how things are not too crowded and everything feels so clean. The rooftop bar was closed for a private event which was disappointing but Raheen was of such great service giving other recommendations of similar rooftop bars close by so I could do a quick meet with my colleagues. He was very accommodating and I love that he didn’t make me feel like ‘just another guest for the day’ I know what that feels like as a frequent traveler on business. His aura is definitely one of the best I’ve experienced from a front desk staff and I commend him for his service. I am not one to usually write reviews but he made me feel like a friend than a stranger and I will hold on to that from any other experience at other hotels.

Fantastic stay had here highly recommend. Room was perfect very spacious and comfortable bed. Great location and close to the subway so getting to places was super easy.  Also special mention to staff member Josh who couldn’t have been more welcoming and helpful. Overall 10/10 experience.

title: Yes to this Hotel
text: This stay was nothing short of amazing for my family and I, first time in NYC! Rooms were cleaned everyday but for some reason the bed wasn’t made and we had to call to refill soaps after, not sure if that is normal but that was not too much of a problem because it was an easy fix and overlooked when the great service overpowers the bad. The rooftop bar has such great drinks, a bit pricey but expected for Times Square. The front desk staff especially Raheen who is usually at the desk in the morning when we leave out with the warmest smile and checking to see if we need anything every time we pass by the desk he always remembers us. Overall a great stay 👍🏾

title: Awesome customer experience, thanks to Shamel!
text:
Great hotel, perfectly situated near time square. From check in to concierge, everything was outstanding. The rooms are very spacious for NY standards.  One of my best experiences was meeting Shamel  from the front desk team, who was super welcoming and helpful.

Thanks
Sebastian

title: THANK YOU RAHEEN AND TEAM!!!
text:
On behalf of myself, mum and sisters, we want to say THANK YOU to Raheen for making my birthday at a hotel feel so special.
My sisters told me how he personally bought the number 25 balloons for me and how excited he was to decorate the room and he NEVER met us before. And to Simone for helping with the decorations and his manager Nick that approved the credit for me to get a birthday drink. He wrote a note mentioning how everyone at the desk tried to make it a great birthday for me and they all made me feel so special. My sisters got 1 of our rooms way before check in so we could get ready to go out and I did not get to meet him myself but he certainly did leave a perfect impression. He called to check on us before we got there to see if we wanted anything so he could take care of it before he left work and he was so bubbly and excited for something we did not even ask for… my mum just told him we were celebrating a birthday and he did all that. He can be our brother anytime if he wants. If we ever visit again I know where me and my family will be staying. “Sparky” mum said he will get the joke LOL

title: Amazing Hotel on Every Level
text:
Excellent experience on every level.  Had the privilege to spend a week at the AC Hotel NYC Times Square during the NRF Trade Show last week.  We used every aspect of the hotel and was supported by all staff members.  Following are just a few examples of their support:  #1 - We shipped over nine boxes to the hotel and they stored them and delivered them to our meeting room.  #2 - They allowed us to shift our meeting room hours from 9AM to 5PM to 2PM till midnight.  #3 - They provided us extra water bottles when every needed.  #4 - We held many of breakfast/dinner meetings at their amazing Tapas restaurant (Boqueria).  Having such a great restaurant allowed us not to freeze and go offsite  #5 - Castell Rooftop Lounge - We held an amazing cocktail reception and enjoyed the great appetizers and amazing drinks (together with some of the best views of NYC).  #6 - Great Location - The location allowed us to walk to Javits Center and also be an arms length from the craziness of Times Square.

The AC Hotel Times Square gets a 10 out of 10 in my book on every level and is my choice for business and pleasure stays while on the Right Coast.

title: Great location!
text: Service here is top notch! It have been at many Marriotts before with my fiancée and we have not had such a smooth experience. I had to make sure to give credit to Raheen for his initial email before I even arrived asking if I had any special requests so he could take care of it before I arrived. Never had this happen before and it is a perfect touch. Everything was perfect, he gave us a really early check in at 9am, late checkout for 3pm and we don’t have the status for it haha and did all this with the most genuine smile ever. He has such good energy we stopped by the desk and chit chat a bit each time before we left and felt so comfortable. The front desk staff is super friendly and helpful! And all the best on training for Antonio? Seem pretty quiet but he’s helpful. Rooms are clean and really spacious especially for New York. Hopefully we catch the snow next time. What a location! My fiancée and I will definitely be back. Thanks AC Marriott!

title: Great and comfortable stay!
text: We stopped to stay the night and the room was clean and the staff was friendly and approachable. Joshua helped secure a car for our trip to the airport and was organized and friendly with helping ensure all our bags were accounted for. Overall wonderful experience and steps from loads of activities and sights.

title: Nice hotel and even better hospitality
text: My sister and I had a great stay at AC Hotel in Times Square. We both live in Florida and it was my first time in the Big Apple. Joshua was super helpful and gave us directions on how to use the subway. He also recommended some restaurants to checkout. We were very thankful for him and his hospitality.

title: Fantastic Customer Service
text: I recently stayed at the AC Marriott Time Square and was impressed from the start. Joshua at reception gave a warm welcome and offered helpful tips for the area. The room was clean, modern, and surprisingly quiet for its central Manhattan location. I'm looking forward to staying here again on my next visit. Highly recommended.

title: Lousy service
text: Four nights stay without any cleaning of the room or change of lining, even with specific requests, at reception, in two of the days of the stays. Ay check in, you are obliged to choose cleaning once every two days or no cleaning at all. We chose the first, although there was no such notice at the time of booking. At the end, we got nothing.

title: Christmas Trip to NYC
text:
We enjoyed our first New York Christmas Trip in the AC Mariott Times Square. The room was gery clean, stuff friendly, specially Josh, thank you! 
Everything was perfect for us from the beginning to the check - out. If we will return to NYC we wil choose AC again.

title: Thank you Joshua for an outstanding stay!
text: Fabulous weekend trip to NYC! We enjoyed our stay at AC Hotel. Joshua is an outstanding employee. He was welcoming, efficient and helpful. We arrived early and checked out in the late afternoon. Joshua took care of our luggage and shopping bags in a friendly manner. We asked several questions regarding the area and Joshua was extremely helpful. He guided us in restaurant, attractions and neighborhoods (my daughter is looking for an apartment). Thank you Joshua for the amazing service and outstanding suggestions! We will be back!

title: No disappoints here
text: Very cute hotel i had my eye on for a while. Finally managed to book a room here and i was not disappointed. When i checked in i was greeted by Shamel and his beautiful smile, who also managed to get me checked in before my actual check in time. The rooms were not very spacious but it’s expected within NYC. Hotel is very clean, staff is friendly, location is accessible to many anttractions and the food at both restaurants was superb. Definitely will stay again. Hopefully i can grab a balcony room next visit and I’ll be sure to bring Shamel an orange redbull lol

title: Terrible experience - Worst Marriott Hotel property I have ever stayed
text: I stayed at the AC Hotel New York Times Square last month and it was the worst experience I have ever stayed at Marriott hotel property. The staff at the desk provided terrible customer and were rude.  The first night we were put in a room that was not safe where I slip in the shower as the floor was poorly cleaned and maintained.  Mario, one of the staff members at the desk was rude and aggressive towards me and my wife when we brought up the issue on not have accessing to our PAID room as the card access was not working. When my wife was talking to Mario and he turned his back on her and went away. His actions was beyond disguising and he got very confrontation with me. My son got very scared and still to this day brings up that situation. He is 5 years old and no kid should feel uncomfortable like that and pay a high amount of money to stay at hotel to receive. The last night of our stay, I went to the rooftop restaurant and I ordered a beverage at the bar and the manager came up to me call my last name only as if did something wrong. Told me that I have a bill to pay as the manager named Wilson told me that I had no credit card on my room. That was not true and I had a credit card on file and swiped it multiple times at the front desk during my stay. The way he spoke to me and his tone and he accused me of doing something wrong and unethical. Just the way he looked and talked me especially just saying my last name, i was being discriminated by him because of me being hispanic. I explained the situation to the supervisor Nicholas and he tried to downplayed it and saying that I was not discriminated. He diminished my feelings and promised me that I would followed up with the Manager Glenda to get full refund of my stay. That never happened and I was misled by Nicholas and his staff. Also, I never received a survey from hotel. I always received a hotel survey from the hotel after I checkout from a Marriott hotel through email and I never received a survey.  I will never go back to this hotel again!

title: Amazing Customer Service / Location
text: I ended up having to do a last minute stay overnight in NYC on my way back to Boston MA and had stayed at this hotel before a couple years back and I arrived with no prior booking or anything and Shamel and Ocean were very kind and efficient! Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice and friendly stay in NYC!

title: NY!  We love YOU!
text:
Oh my!!!! What fabulous service!
IO and Ocean went above and beyond to meet our every need!
Our location could not be better!
Our room was clean and perfect for your needs. 
We are former NY resident's and love returning to our old stomping grounds!

title: Thanks Ocean & Io!
text:
We had a great time at the AC hotel. Location was great and Ocean & Io took awesome care of us. Thanks for holding our bags while we spent our final day in the City!

The room was clean and cozy. We stayed for 2 nights, 3 days and had a wonderful time.

title: Perfect location, excellent service.
text: Excellent, reasonably  priced hotel in the perfect area. We arrived so incredibly late and assistance provided by Ocean was wonderful. Cute, clean rooms. The restaurant on site was also very tasty. This was a great place to stay in the heart of the city.

title: PHENOMENAL!!!!
text: Omg! Giving this place and its staff a review still isn’t enough! Beyond clean, and friendly.  Ocean and Shamel were phenomenal! My fiancé and I booked at a hotel that turned out to be far from what was advertised.  These gentlemen made our check in effortless.  Ocean went above and beyond to make sure we were more than well taken care of.  Gratitude to you both.  Prayerfully, AC New York will recognize you two for a job exceptionally done!  We will definitely return!

title: Good location, street noise
text:
Met 2 friends in NYC for a long weekend. We were thankful that they were able to check us in early-11am. BUT… our room was right outside the elevator. Very loud!! At least we could chill out before we ventured out. We also faced the street from the 4th floor. Also loud but we brought ear plugs. Floor to ceiling windows but has black out screens. 

Not much room for luggage but rooms are renovated and clean. No microwave but has a fridge. Complimentary water bottles at the front desk. We were able to have a drink at the rooftop bar. Very classy bar with a view. 

Location was great. We walked to Bryant Park, Rockefeller for ice skating. All of NYC has homeless people but didn’t see many hanging around the hotel. Close to Times Square. 

Taxi/Uber from LaGuardia $60-70.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Amazing see ice. Io  was very accommodating and extremely helpful with my booking. She was very locally intelligent with recommendations and helping with my stay. Restaurant locations were very helpful.

title: Kind front desk staff
text:
I had such an amazing stay with AC. I felt so at home and a part of the family. The staff was wonderful. 
One staff member in particular, Genesis, was extremely kind and always had a smile on her face when I saw her. She recommended really yummy places to eat and places to visit! Definitely will return!

title: Loved it, can't wait to go back
text: Trendy, fun, interesting and perfectly placed.  Service was attentive except for one person at the front desk who was so rude about calling a taxi.  We ended up calling an  Uber on our own.  Room was clean and functional. Next door Boqueria restaurant was great.  We were the oldest guests by at least 20 years but we felt very comfortable.  Only complaint is that shower floor is way too slippery but that is easily solved by placing two wash cloths, one for each foot, on the shower floor.

title: Avoid
text: Avoid.  Rooms are SMALL!  There are literally 12 inches of hanging space and two draws which are minute but thank god we had room for a microwave right!?  Wrong!  We were there for 5 nights and could not unpack.  There is no space to leave cases open.  Beds were comfortable but pillows awful.  Shower was good.  Room was clean but dark.  Roof top bar unusable on several nights as private parties which disturbed our sleep until nearly 2am.  Internet connectivity sporadic at best. Again avoid, NY has to offer better.........

title: Great Location
text: Nice hotel great location. The hotel was clean and safe. The hotel staff is friendly. There are two great restaurants in the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square, the theater district, subway stations, and more. The rooms are small but it’s New York. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Birthday trip for son..Great stay made even better by Ricardo!
text: Here for a birthday trip for my 10 y/o son. Very central location, the city view room is cozy and bright with a full wall of windows. Ricardo downstairs at the desk/lobby was absolutely amazing! Always smiling, helpful,  and made my son feel extra special for his birthday. Thank you, Ricardo! Will definitely stay again

title: Terrible experience - worst Marriott I’ve ever stayed in !
text: Internet didn’t work, noise level horrendous! Roof top bar unusable as constant private functions, no wardrobes in rooms so loved out of suitcase - the list is endless! Wouldn’t recommend and would never stay here again as so many better hotels in area that are better value for money

title: Shamel & Ocean made my stay wonderful.
text:
The team members at this hotel are consistently quality people. 

During this stay, Shamel & Ocean greeted me at 8:00am after a long red-eye flight. They were welcoming, sincere, and helpful. They accommodated my requests with genuine care.  Their kindness made my stay comfortable.

The time prior to this stay, I was helped by Genesis and Simone. Those ladies went above and beyond to ensure I felt welcome and cared for. I returned to this hotel because of them. I will return again because of the ongoing quality provided by Shamel and Ocean too.

title: Ok for a night
text:
The hotel itself is clearly new (newly renovated).   The room was a fair size for NYC standards. Our particular room was next to the elevators and you could hear them all night long. Not the best. 
The bigger issue is the neighborhood. While Times Square is always busy, this hotel is a block away from Port Authority. So definitely not the best area. It was fine for a night. But we would have switched hotels if we were staying in the city longer.

title: Expérience mitigée
text:
J’ai choisi cet hôtel pour un séjour avec ma mère et mon fils pour son anniversaire de 14 ans. Nous venons de très loin. On a retenu cet hôtel pour son rooftop particulièrement. Premier jour on apprend que les mineurs sont interdits au rooftop même ceux qui séjournent à l’hôtel. 2ème jour le rooftop est privatisé. Et 3ème jour privatisé aussi. Quelle déception. Sans parler du fait que le ménage n’est fait qu’un jour sur deux. 

Les points très positifs: bouteilles d’eau, café et thé à volonté dans la chambre et l’emplacement.

J’ai trouvé les espaces communs et surtout la réception bien moins beaux que sur les photos.  Lumière assez terne. Je m’attendais à beaucoup mieux à ce prix.

Personnel pas très agréable à part quelques exceptions (quelques dames vraiment super gentilles). Surtout l’équipe du soir on a vraiment l’impression de les déranger.

title: Great staff and the perfect location
text: We had an amazing trip to NY and this hotel was the perfect location and very clean. The staff was always pleasant and available to answer question. Josh especially stood out to us. He gave us the background on what “AC” stands for and helped us arrange transportation to the airport, as well as pleasant conversation while waiting for our car. We will absolutely be staying at this property when we come back to NY.

title: Poor experience. Bad room.
text:
Well this rating is way over rated. The rooms are tiny which I guess is the norm in Manhattan, but it’s just so dark and sleepy and the rooms are mediocre. The bed was very uncomfortable and I just really did not enjoy staying here. I chose the location bc my friend was staying nearby but this place was just dark and loud with no privacy. The hallways were very scary with really gross carpet. None of the ice machines in the entire hotel worked. My room had the worst chemical smells from whatever cleaning supplies they used and it made me nauseated all night long and they would not move me to a different room, even with decently high status in their Bonvoy system. 

I would not stay here again. 

Marriott really needs to get their act together. Their proprieties are just really running down because it seems like they aren’t investing in updates

title: Very good service
text:
A nice and comfortable hotel. The concierge Josh was extremely helpful with every request. 
The location is however very busy, in a close proximity to Times Square, so it depends on preferences :)
The service is superb so highly recommend!

title: Enjoyable stay
text: Very nice hotel with an excellent location.  Comfortable, quiet and very clean rooms and only a few minutes to Times Square. Very close to Subway and good restaurants. Staff very friendly and helpful especially Ocean on the front desk.

title: I’m sure room placement will give you a better experience
text:
I have been wanting to write my review about our experience at the AC Marriott in Times Square for such a long time.  I feel bad about the delay because of one young man in particular, Josh. Josh was the best, he was the second person to greet us and say hello, and was the first person to go above & beyond to make sure our stay at the AC Marriott was as good as it could be. It was not Josh’s fault at our room placement. We chose this hotel because of some of the great reviews we read and the opportunity to get a nice photo on their rooftop. We came to New York to celebrate our daughters 21st Birthday. Unfortunately our room was facing the street so if you go out in the city that never sleeps, don’t think you are going to get any sleep if your room is facing the street, you will hear the traffic going by on that street and unfortunately for us there was construction on the street that started very early the jackhammers were busy & loud. I was told the Hotel was sold out, we had made our reservations early, I thought there was an option on the type of view when I made the reservation, nevertheless I wasn’t happy at all about the jackhammers in the morning & all I got from the front desk was, “ we can’t control the outside construction, or the noise”  I was then informed that the hotel was sold out, we could not switch rooms. Two days into our trip I’m downstairs on my way up, I stopped by the desk, this hotel offers complimentary water, & I hear a nice young lady at the desk talking to a customer saying, “ Well let me help find you a room”  I asked the nice young lady if the hotel was sold out, she answered no,  my wife convinced me to just relax and enjoy what we could, we were on vacation ,  I just do not like it when you are not told the truth, one night we could not access the rooftop bar it was booked for a private event. 
The location of this hotel is great for experiences for broadway or Times Square you really are walking distances to both locations, you will be able to walk to many stores for shopping. And of course the staff at this hotel will help you navigate the subway system with expertise, helping you get to your locations you want to explore in New York. An Uber or Lyft ride leaving this hotel can be a challenge depending on what time you get a ride share. 
Back to Josh, out of all the hotels we’ve been to, we have never received service as good at as attentive to the service we received from Josh, Josh helped us with everything he was able to, he explained the services offered to get back to the airport, asking us to research first other options based on price. We scheduled with Josh when we arrived at the hotel , we researched price options Josh is an honest man the service he suggested was just about as good as any other service and it was one thing less to worry about. 
The service from Josh the highest 10 you can give.
The stay at the hotel a good 6 . I never read about the rooms facing the street on how noisy they could be, I never would have agreed to stay at this hotel had I known about the street noise, & not to high of a score about honesty. It seems like only Josh was the honest person we encountered with while we were there, I’m sure others might also have great characteristics but nobody working at the AC Martial Hotel In Times Square was  as good as Josh, we watched him help many guests , giving his best effort in making sure every guest he helped had a good experience at that hotel. Peacefully, Joey Crcchini

title: Pure Excellence
text:
It was such a pleasure to work with Vincent,who ensured a Women's group from the south felt safe and received hospitality from start to finish. 

As the travel agent for the group and also a member of this great women's group, I was impressed and grateful they could accommodate our needs. The host was satisfied, and everyone enjoyed their stay.

 Also, special thanks Jacdeline who made sure everything ran smoothly at the front desk. Thank you for those who worked during our stay especially Mario and the young man with the Station 1 Vanderbilt restaurant recommendation. 
Also, the kind personal touch of delivery a handwritten note and a thank you gift for the group staying there was the cherry on the cake.  Pure Excellence! 
Travel Advisor 
BlushingACTravels
Blushllc23@gmail.com

title: Great location, staff & service
text: Just returned from a trip to NYC and stayed at the AC Hotel in Times Square, a Marriott property.  Kudos to GM Glenda Gomez who has assembled a great staff at this location. Front desk staff member Ricardo and 17th Fl housekeepers were both truly exceptional!! The entire stay there was clean, cozy and friendly.  Mimi in the adjoining restaurant provided great service too.  Location of the property works for getting around all of NYC.  Times Square station is one block away.

title: Reservations
text: Nick is AMAZING! He was very helpful and considerate of my situation. Great conversation/customer service!! He assisted with hotel accommodations instead of brushing me off. He is definitely an asset to AC Hotel!!

title: Will stay here again.
text: This was the perfect location for our New York City adventure. Easy walk to the Broadway shows. Clean, comfortable and quiet. Helpful, friendly staff. Ricardo was especially accommodating. Appreciated that we could leave our bags until our flight time.

title: Excellent Hotel with Friendly and Helpful Staff
text: Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Shoutout to Joshua for all the helpful tips and for making sure we found our way back to the airport on time. Everything is well-kept and clean. Perfectly located close to popular venues like the Al Hirschfeld Theatre and the Birdland Jazz Club.

title: Very nice hotel. The staff at the front desk is unhelpful.
text: Nice hotel. I didn’t have time to try the eateries but everything was very nice except the staff at the front desk don’t seem to care at all about guests. They won’t answer any questions about even paid upgrades and won’t provide loyalty benefits. They are sarcastic and hurtful. It’s kinda weird that they’d put their energy into that kind of thing.

title: Ricardo made this a 5 star visit to NYC
text: This hotel is in a great location.  The restaurant and bar were delightful experiences. But…. the customer service provided by Ricardo (front desk support) was what made our visit a 5 star experience. He was so happy to help answer any questions we had, and his advice was consistently right on target. He is the reason I will choose this hotel again next time I am in town.

title: Close to Time Square
text: Never being to NY before,  I chose this hotel bc we were attending the US Open and wanted a hotel close to the 7 train line.  It was easy to get to the hotel from Penn Station and even easier to get to and from the Open.  Close to Time Square, subway stations, restaurants, Broadway and many other places.  Staff was helpful,  friendly and accommodating.  Hotel was clean and beds were comfortable. Would highly recommend staying here.

title: NYC experience
text: Excellent staff! Hotel was beautiful and centrally located to all things NYC touristy! Parking was done through a garage nearby. Only complaint was that NYC is loud at night and the giant windows allowed some noise in but not to be unexpected!

title: Great Experience
text: Great experience from the mime my we arrived at the hotel. Front desk and gentleman who helped with the luggage  were extremely friendly and eager to make our stay as easy as possible. Also good location. The bagel place next to the hotel is delicious. We used restaurant for breakfast and it was delicious even though service wasn’t the best.

title: Great location and Service
text: Had a lovely stay with the family.  The location is just perfect as its close to all the main attractions and opposite a Starbucks so the area always feels lively and safe.  The staff were very welcoming especially Joshua who helped with guidance on places to visit and a young man with braides (sorry forgot the name) who was more than willing to help me understand the subway and the routes I could take.

title: Joshua made our day!
text: My daughter and I loved it! The location was perfect for us to walk to and from Times Square and other nyc hotspots. Very nice lobby and lots of space in the room. Joshua helped us with our luggage and got us transportation to the airport on our last day. Amazing service!!

title: Quick but great stay
text: Great hotel, vert clean and spacious. Quite new. Amazing service, especially Joshua the doorman always helpful, smiling and great recommendations ! I recommend, and will come again if I ever end up in New York City again.

title: NO
text: We just got home from a 4 night stay at AC Hotel Times Square, I paid extra for a nice room and this is what I got😡 also housekeeping only came one day, which is fine, but they took my soap and toilet paper and didn't replace it? Luckily the cart was left out and I  replaced it myself, the rooftop bar is as expected, way overpriced, but to get warm beer and cucumber in my Gin and Tonic was 🤢. The street in front of the hotel made us very uncomfortable at night with homeless and drunk beggars constant harassment. I reached out to Marriott and they said sorry, We hope your future stays will be much better...well No Next time for me! I had reservations for the Cloudveil resort in Jackson Hole for December, but after their reply it has been changed to a different resort.

title: Very pleasant experience
text: It was a wonderful stay . Ira was so helpful , friendly and pleasant. Room was very comfortable and clean . Everyone were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends!!

title: Great location, amazing service!
text: AC Hotel is very accommodating and in a great location. A girl named Genesis who works there made my stay seamless and recommended some great places near the hotel for food and drinks! Very attentive, will make sure to get the same hotel when visiting the city again.

title: Great hotel in midtown
text: I really liked this hotel and am eager to return. The location was perfect for work in midtown. The room was quiet and clean. The shower was huge. Nick at the front desk was kind and super helpful in helping me find a bite to eat before my meetings. AC hotels are quickly becoming one of my favorite brands.

title: Great service!! Wonderful time
text: I stayed at the ac Times Square and had a really fun time in NYC. We went to Castell and had amazing tres leches. Genesis checked us in and she was so helpful and friendly!! Will definitely want to stay here again

title: Amazing staff!
text: Exceeded our expectations! While the room was nice and clean, the staff made our trip a memorable experience. From the minute we entered, the delightful man from Trinidad (wish I remembered his name) welcomed our kiddos as ‘VIPs’, chatted with us and them throughout our stay, and treated them to snacks for the trip home when we checked out’. Raheen made check in a breeze. The location is fantastic - close to the subway,  restaurants (BTS a few storefronts down has great bagels!), Times Square, and Rockefeller Center. Valet parking would have been nice but it was easy enough to unload out front and park in the nearby garage. Highly recommend. Tons of options for hotel stays in NYC but this one won us back for future trips.

title: Could be better
text:
I just got back from a 2 night stay.  I am my mom’s caregiver and this is only time I got away this year.  I thought I would try AC hotel this time.  Will be my last. Will go back to Marriott. 
Pro:  staff are very nice; convenient to Penn Station, rooms are clean
Con: towels and sheets are very rough-definitely of the Marriott standard I am used too. Pillows are horrible.  Very lumpy foam.  I asked for feather and never received it- there was one in my room but smelled like a sweaty BO- ick.  A/C very loud.  “City view” room not worth the extra cost but balcony was nice. 
So did not get the restful sleep I needed. I guess AC is not the same standard as main Marriott.  The linen issue was huge disappointment

title: Beautiful Hotel with Helpful Staff
text: Hello! I stayed at the hotel this July. I had a great experience. The hotel is so beautiful, super easy to find. I had a very easy check-in, the staff is amazing. Ira at the front desk was super helpful, I went to the restaurant she recommended and I loved it! My room was perfect. Super clean, super relaxing. I enjoyed my stay very much. Thanks for making my first stay in New York super comfortable!

title: Beautiful hotel + exceptional customer service
text:
I stayed here for 2 nights when I was in NYC for pride and loved staying here so much. I would have definitely extended my stay for another week if rooms were available!

Location: This is one of the best locations to stay if you’re a tourist - it’s roughly halfway between the Flatiron building and Central Park so all the main tourist attractions are less than a 20 min walk away. It’s about a few mins away from times square so there’s no noise and crowds. There were so many great places to eat nearby and it felt like a safe area. 

Room : The rooms are extremely clean and nice and seemed fairly new. This hotel was far nicer than some of the more expensive hotels I’ve stayed in NYC. 

Customer service: All staff are so friendly and helpful - definitely one of the best I’ve ever experienced when it comes to customer service at hotels and what made this hotel stand out. 

Value: I feel very fortunate that I was able to stay here. I was lucky to get a good deal because it was a last minute booking but when I tried to book another stay here for my next trip in September the price was more than double 😱 otherwise I 100% would stay here again. There’s also complimentary water and no destination fee like other hotels which is great. 

I was especially impressed that I booked my room at 1pm and by the time I walked over, within about ten minutes, they had a room ready for me and allowed me to check in straight away. 

The hotel is LGBTQ friendly and I felt very safe staying here.

title: New, Modern Hotel in Great Central Location
text:
My husband took me to NYC for my birthday, and we opted to try the AC Hotel in Times Square. We'd stayed in an AC Hotel in Mainz, Germany, and liked it, and we wanted to be in a pretty central location in NYC so that everything was in walking or cheap Uber riding distance.

The hotel is beautiful, new, modern, open -- a good impression upon arrival. The staff at check-in were really friendly. Our room wasn't available yet, and it was pouring down rain outside, so we opted to go to the bar on the main level to have a light lunch and a few birthday drinks. The food and drinks were phenomenal, but I was disappointed to find out when we were leaving that it was happy hour, and the bartenders didn't tell us. It's not posted on any sign or on the menu -- you literally have to ask them if it's happy hour and THEN they'll break out the happy hour options. That's how we found out -- we heard another customer ask. That's not typical of where I'm from, so I wouldn't have thought to ask.

My husband had asked for an upgraded room because he's a Marriott Bonvoy member,and at this hotel, an upgraded room is an accessible room--one for people with disabilities --- because these are the more spacious rooms and ones with balconies. They also have open closets, the open showers, lower countertops, etc. So if you don't like being in an accessible room, keep that in mind. It didn't bother us, and I liked having the open air balcony for the views and for some great Instagrammable photos/videos.

The room has a very comfie bed, lots of pillows, shelving/open closet, lots of drawers, a spacious bathroom with lots of counter space, great shower, good toiletries, hair dryer, big screen TV, a safe, coffee/tea station, etc. I really liked the clean, modern lines of the room and minimalist decor. (I don't think there was a fridge -- I can't recall there being one.)

Other than that, all the staff is great, they give you free bottled water at the front desk for your room (which is much appreciated). There is a Starbucks immediately across the street from the hotel. I never noticed any street noise in the room and we slept comfortably each night.

The hotel was in walking distance of Times Square, loads of restaurants and bars, Rockefellar Square, etc. We took an Uber to Central Park, to the NYC Comedy Club, and a few other spots that were a bit further away, but usually an Uber would "be arriving in 1 minute" or "has arrived" the second we ordered one. There are so many that you never have to wait!

We took the Vamoose Bus from Bethesda, MD, to NYC, and the dropoff/pickup point is just a 3 or 4 block walk to the hotel, so that was also very convenient. 

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the AC Hotel. If you want to be in the center of the action near Times Square, this is a great place to stay.

title: A home away from home!
text: This place feels like a home away from home because of Raheen. Traveling on business can feel exhausting, but he makes it feel like a home away from home and really values treating people well. Raheen makes the experience the best I can ever hope for! I keep coming back here because it’s such a friendly place. Truly a home away from home!

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Great hotel in a very convenient location. Clean and comfy rooms. Very spacious bathroom with great amenities. Room size is pretty good for NYC standards. Friendly bellman that always greeted us with a smile.  Rooftop terrace was delightful and the food was great there.

title: What home feels like
text: Ocean was super hospitable. He made me feel right at home with how welcoming he was. Very professional and helpful. Also very patient and  informative. I asked about restaurant recommendations and he suggested Yard house. I appreciated his food recommendation.

title: Simply The Best!
text: Arrived in NYC with lots of luggage/supplies for business meetings this week and had the good fortune of reserving at The AC Hotel.  A very kind gentleman at the front desk (Raheen) helped me unload my car, watched my things as I went to park, checked me in, and helped me bring everything to my room.  I could not have asked for a greater customer experience from a hotel point of view — he really turned a trip I was dreading into something quite pleasant.  What an amazing start to my week.  Thank you Raheen, and thank you AC Hotel/Marriott for hiring him.  It’s people like him that people like me remember when we book our next trip to NYC.

title: Had a blast
text: Raheen got me checked in early and recommended this great restaurant for dinner.  Best lamb I have had in the city.  Love how close everything is to this place. I will be staying here for my future visit.Thanks

title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL
text:
***STAY AWAY - UNPROFESSIONAL***
0⭐️ DESERVED!!!!
The “professionals” that represent your hotel are Rude, profane, confrontational, UNPROFESSIONAL!!!
Your hotel image/brand has been forever tarnished thanks to the actions of your front desk employees

title: Front desk staff.
text: The front desk staff where very rude, cursing at members of the public We where shocked to see this kind of behavior. Disgusting staff sad to see they are employed by the Hotel, I would suggest you hire staff with self respect and will hold the Hotels name high.

title: Friendly, clean, comfortable find in Times Square.
text:
We arrived a little before posted check-in time but Ms. Iolanthe (eye-o-LAN-tee) and Ms. Simone were very welcoming, friendly, accommodating and pleasant to chat with. The hotel was clean, the elevators all worked. We liked the room Ms. Iolanthe assigned us.  However, nothing is perfect, we didn't like the lack of ice in the 3-4 ice machines in the hotel.  Timesaver:  take the ice bag/bucket from your room and go to the restaurant/coffee/bar off the lobby. 
You might be hungry, but skip that place and head up to the rooftop bar/lounge.  We chilled with a couple of good cocktails and enjoyed the late afternoon setting sun.
In the morning we set our sights on some coffee. Remembering the coffee in the lobby place, we walked in and ordered a strong americano and a cappuccino. We got translucent, carmel-colored liquid that was hot and weak with little flavor. So there's that.
Overall it was a friendly, clean, and comfortable find in Times Square.

title: A+
text:
Everyone at the front desk was so nice and helpful. The young ladies when we checked in and the gentleman working late last night were very helpful with recommendations, and Joshua (I think) helping us with bags and making us feel welcome every time we saw him. 
Well done and thank you.

title: Ocean is the greatest
text: Ocean was very helpful and attentive. He was very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and able to make accommodations on the fly. Although i was coming for business would definitely book again! The surrounding area is also pretty decent to look around

title: I love the AC Times Square!
text:
This is my 4th or 5th stay at the AC Hotel in Times Square, and I just had to write a review because there are so many great things about this property! 

First: The Staff - customer service is great! Check in was smooth with Ocean and Shamel. This was really a big thing for me during this recent visit since my 2-hour delayed flight from CA landed at 2 am & I didn’t arrive at the hotel until 3 am.

Second: The location - I really like this property because it is convenient to multiple subway stations and walking distance to many great restaurants (such as the Bagel Mart and Dim Sum Sam are my go-to quick spots)! The restaurant at the lobby level is Boqueria, which is a Spanish tapas style restaurant that has a nice happy hour menu.

Third: Ambiance - the signature thing I love about AC hotel is their Lavender cart thats set up in the evening at the lobby for their customers to grab for a relaxing stay. Their rooms are modern and bathrooms are super clean!

title: Great location and helpful people
text: Nice hotel at a great location. They do not make your room unless you request it, but when you do it’s no problem. Great and helpful people, specially Joshua. The location is in the centre of almost everything.

title: Great Stay!
text: Ocean and IO at the front desk are Awesome! Th AC hotel is a great location close to time square! One of the warmest NY welcomes I have had :).  Lots of good food and entertainment all with in a short walk!

title: Excellent Service
text: I’d like to thank Ocean the desk manager who helped with a room switch due to noise on the street outside.  Having an early meeting in the morning it was excellent to have such great service, especially getting in after a late flight. Thanks Ocean!

title: Oasis in in the madness
text: Room was quiet and clean.  View was amazing.  It is not Disney, so I the streets you will see garbage and cockroaches.  However, the hotel was respite from the days’ activities.  Elevators were kind of shaky, but they did the job.  Close to everything

title: Amazing experience and great location
text:
Ocean was great help for me to check in and location is amazing. It is close by from all the great restaurants and food trucks. Rooftop bar has really great views and vibes. Room was great too, good space. 
Time square is just few blocks away from this hotel.

title: True Marriott values , amazing stay!!!
text: As a former Marriott employee, I just love to see people so dedicated to do their job. The staff was always so attentive and ready to make you have the best stay ever. I’m really bad with names yet, I do want to point out a few people who truly embrace the Marriott values, Devonte at front desk, thank you for the chat and the service. A co-native young guy , all I remember is he is from Nagua, Dominican Republic, and to all the guys at front desk, thank you for checking on us every day and for even taking care of our ride to the airport. Thank you!!!!

title: Top Notch Service
text: OMG the customer service was so AMAZING!!!!! Ocean treated us like royalty. We will definitely come back to this hotel!!!!!!! This is was my family first time in New York and staying at this hotel. I am pleased!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you so much

title: Amazing Service!
text: Ocean was very accommodating with all our needs! He showed us amazing service hospitality while here. He kept us entertained while we waited for service and kept a smile on his face. We will be coming back to vacation and see Ocean!

title: Best Hotel
text: AC Hotel NY Times Square is my favorite hotel to stay at every time I come to NY! Ocean has been great! Awesome customer service as always. Also, Davon is also great as well! When I first arrived to the hotel my family was greeted with so much love!

title: Birthday trip
text:
From the moment my fiancé and I walked in the hotel, Ocean went about and beyond to make our stay comfortable and amazing. He was truly the best and we won’t go anywhere else in the city! 

Thank you Ocean!!! :)

title: Amazing Experience and Location
text: This is the third time at this hotel, and each time has been awesome.  It’s clean, convenient, and with a great gym.  But most importantly, the staff is unbelievable.  Special kudos to Genesis, Simone, Nicholas, and especially Ricardo.  They have set the bar extremely high as now my children think all hotels are like this.  They made my kids feel like real VIPs, and Ricardo feels like family!

title: Mostly Good Experience
text: The check-in experience wasn’t the best as receptionist seemed to have an attitude towards me. I wasn’t inclined to go back there to ask for any recommendations. The room, however, was very nice and clean. I’m not so sure I’ll return though due to the lack of hospitality.

title: Great location, excellent hotel
text:
Good, clean hotel, well-positioned for Broadway and Newark airport (via Lincoln tunnel).  The food on rooftop restaurant was excellent, service got our order wrong, remedied it.  After a late show, we got into the Spanish tapas bar at the bottom floor just before closing, food was outstanding and they accommodated our late arrival.

Rooms were new, clean, I would have liked a small sitting chair  in the corner by the window, there just was enough room.

Desk Staff was nice to help my wife with plastic utensils as she left Amazon marketplace across the street with a salad and no utensils.

title: Excellent customer service!
text: Wonderful check-in and greeting with Ocean. There was a problem with a bathroom door being locked. He came up immediately and moved me to another room. Most helpful and accommodating. Outstanding customer service!

title: Not for more than a night
text: Disappointing Marriott experience. Hotel has no lounge , did not provide titanium status upgrade for the room, gym very sad, rooms cleaned every other day, room supplied with bare minimum. Takes a very long time to check in as front desk is alway busy.

title: Clean and great customer service
text:
Very clean rooms with a nice full size gym , filter water, towels, threadmills and clean.

Room is very clean. I don’t stay at hotels with carpets due to allergies and some have a bad scent like mildew.

The rooftop is so pretty and good food. Service is great. Alia my waitress was on point.

Ricardo the front desk attendant and the maintenance guys all very helpful.

NYC original resident here.

title: Decent Hotel, Avoid Times Square
text: As frequent visitors to NYC, my husband and I usually stay in other neighborhoods. But, because of Marriott points, we stayed at the AC Times Square. That was a big mistake, especially because we know better than to spend too much time in/near Times Square. Too dirty, too many people, reeks of weed 24/7, and too much traffic. Setting that aside, the hotel staff were friendly and the room was clean. However, even as a Bonvoy member, we were given a room at the noisy elevator bank, we were charged $75 to check in early (even though the room was already ready and we had checked in online without mention of a fee), and one side of the bed did not have a nightstand. It wasn’t the worst stay, but it was a lesson learned to stay at our regular spots next time.

title: Great Hotel
text:
This hotel is awesome!!!

Our bell boy Ricardo was very nice and helpful, he was really nice to the kids and deserves a hats off. 
The front desk was very kind to us and we really enjoyed our stay. We hope come back here again. Way to go AC Hotel!!!

Regards, 
Sharad

title: Great experience Memorial Day weekend!
text: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel! The hotel team over Memorial Day weekend were incredible. They were professional and so helpful with their recommendations for meals! I believe it was Johnathan, Davon and a very nice woman who were working with us over the weekend so special shout out to them!! The roof top bar at night was a lot of fun. The restaurant in the hotel had amazing food and drinks. Thanks for making our weekend in NYC the best!

title: No upgrade or even higher floor for platinum
text: I am staying at this hotel currently and we are here for 5 nights. When I checked in on Friday, I was given a room on the 4th floor near the elevator and overlooking 40th. I am Bonvoy platinum and when I asked for a higher floor at check in (there are 20 floors in this hotel), I was told the hotel was sold out and no other room was available (we are in a 2 double bed room).  I am also 2 rooms from the elevator, when my profile specifically requests a room “away from the elevator.” I looked at the hotel website today and there are double rooms available for $139 tonight! In addition, the noise from 40th is very loud on this low floor, and I had to call security at 1:00 AM this morning due to people loudly partying in the room next door. And at night, our room occasionally smells like pot, which is not coming from us. To say that I have not been treated as a loyal Bonvoy platinum member is a major understatement and I’ve never had this experience at any other Marriott/AC hotel. Such a disappointment!

title: Conveniently Located and Priced with Excellent Staff!
text: This great Marriott property is an excellent option for travelers looking for a mid-priced hotel in a great location! It is near enough to Times Square that you can get everywhere you need, but not on a street where you exit to a crowd of tourists each day. It is across the street from a Starbucks and Dunkin in a few doors down, plus very conveniently located to the subway.  The staff very present, friendly and accommodating. We were running late for our lunch reservation upon arrival from the airport and they quickly stored our luggage without even making us check in so that we could make our reservation. They have complimentary bottled water at the front desk, which is awesome. The beds are comfy and we did not hear any street noise. All this and a rooftop bar! I have stayed once with my family and once on a girl's trip and both visits were great!

title: Excellent over all
text:
5 stars ⭐️ over all.
Great location. Nice staff and very helpful. Spacious and very clean room. Trendy rooftop and restaurant in the hotel. We stayed with our teenage girl. She was over the moon.
We Will absolutely come back.

title: Awesome Visit to NYC, due to your staff and facility
text:
Our Stay started on Wednesday, May 17th to 21st, 2023Upon our arrival we were greeted at the front entrance by Ricardo, He got our group all settled in, within a few minutes. Everyday he would greet us, either as we’re departing or arriving from our daily schedule.Everyday, we had a few questions in regards to recommended places to eat, or best way to get to different areas of the city. His directions / information were Spot On everytime. If we’re waiting the lobby for a bit, we watched on how him and his other desk staff would interact with arriving or departing visitors, Ricardo and (his co-worker, I think his name was Devin, and the rest of the day crew and early evening. I forgot to get all their names).  it was interesting watching a few times as they would process the Air Crews from Cathay Pacific, with such efficiency.  It was a pleasure staying at your facility, as you have a great crew of staff there, especially Richado, who seemed to have whole operation running really smooth. Great Representation, Great Teamwork ! Will be back,  

Keith / Anne Nelson
Chester, NH

title: Always a Great Experience
text: Always stay at the AC Times Square when we visit New York City. Staff is incredibly professional and friendly and we always have a wonderful experience. Joshua was fantastic as always in assisting us with our luggage and transportation. Great experience and look forward to our next day.

title: Great hotel and great staff! Especially Joshua!
text: Great place to stay. Centrally located. Close to access to lots of cabs. Staff is the nicest and so helpful! Joshua was great. Got us a car to airport immediately. Rooms are great and clean. Gym is nice.

title: Excellent NYC hotel
text: This is an extremely well run hotel. From the minute you arrive, the hotel team makes you feel welcome. They have an excellent sense of hospitality and you can sense the teamwork. The housekeeping staff deserves high praise as well. The room was immaculate. Hotel is right next to a subway stop and a perfect launching pad for our trips.

title: Much better alternative than Times AC !
text: Average Business Hotel in Times Square - much better alternatives to choose from. The rooms are average size and neatly designed but a lot of the rooms face dark dingy workshop. Rooms are not cleaned well - I have seen hairs in the shower stall multiple times and have had stained bath towels in the room. They do room cleaning on alternative days - which for me is personally a big sticking point to pay $400 a night and not come to a cleaned room. I have stayed here now more than 5 times and despite being a Marriott Platinum have not even been upgraded once.  Even the daily credit as Platinum members are not applied - you need to remind them multiple times.

title: Excelente ✅
text:
Amazing Customer Service from all the staff,
Thank you Joshua for your service and kindness.
All the the staff deserve a rise 🆙
We were able to checking beforehand which was pretty helpful & also they let us storage our bags after checking out from the hotel, that way we could enjoy our last hours in the city before heading to the airport ✈️

title: Great hotel, Joshua was a legend !
text:
Fantastic hotel, great location. Joshua really made it a great experience for our Frist trip to New York. I'd highly recommend staying here. 
Nothing was too much trouble, He helped with directions and sorting airport transfers which made it much easier,.even when it was pooring with rain and the lobby was very busy he always had time for us.  The transfer was the same price as a yellow cab, only with nicer cars and more comfortable.
Over all this was the perfect hotel choice

title: Will definitely recommend
text: We live on the same block as an AC Hotel in Madrid, Spain and it's lovely. We were hoping this NY hotel would be equivalent and it didn't disappoint. I was trepidatious to book a hotel in this particular neighborhood because after living in NYC for many years, I have learned to avoid Times Square whenever possible due to the crowds. Fortunately, from the moment we stepped into the lobby, we felt at peace with our decision. Very appealing decor, check-in was easy and efficient and our room was modern, comfortable and clean. Bathrooms were well-stocked, workout room was well-equiped,  and my husband used the business center later which was large and private. Josh helped us with our luggage (among other things) and he truly turned a good stay into a *great* stay. He was professional, kind and full of helpful information.  Thank you, Josh, for being so wonderful and, thank you, AC Hotel Times Square for such a pleasant stay.

title: Amazing location, spotless room, and friendly front desk.
text: Amazing location, a short walk to Times Square and several subway lines. Despite being so close to Times Square, quieter street. The windows are great at blocking out street noise and noise from the hallway was minimal even with us being near the elevators. The bed was comfy for me but too soft for my wife. Shower took a minute to figure out. Everything was spotless and in working order except our window shade was broken - it still worked but had a huge tear in it along with it not being on its track when rolled up. The hallway was also missing some molding on the bottom. Mario at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Every time we left the hotel or came back, we were greeted by someone at the front desk. For the location, the price was spot on and affordable. We will stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

title: You'll love this hotel!
text: I really loved this hotel! Clean, modern, and great light. The staff were kind and accommodating- I felt very comfortable here. The location is great, and the subway (ACE line) is very close. I would highly recommend it.

title: Clean; Modern; Friendly
text: The rooms are incredibly spacious (by NYC standards), very clean and well appointed.  I appreciate the tiled floors (so less dust than the old, worn carpeting of a lot of hotels).  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The location is perfect if you need to be near Broadway/Times Square.

title: A 3.5 star hotel that acts like a 5 star one...and is succeeding.
text: This hotel is very clean with a very nice staff. Ricardo, the concierge, was beyond helpful and really sincere about wanting to help. The car service used by the hotel was top notch and always precisely on time. I felt confident and safe with this car service. I also felt safe inside and outside the hotel. It is in a great location with plenty of restaurants and attractions within walking distance. A few drawbacks were the tinted door to the bathroom, the poor lighting, and the limited closet space; thus, the 3.5 star rating is appropriate.  But there’s plenty of room to put your suitcases on a counter and retrieve items from there. The ironing board also converted to useful surface space. There were more than sufficient outlets for charging whatever you have. The window shades in the room, however, were installed upside down in my opinion. They need to open from the top for the light, not from bottom so you are visible from across the street.

title: 5+ STARS ⭐️💖
text: After checking out of the Manhattan Hotel (should be 1 star), we walked to the AC hotel. Upon check-in, we were greeted by Ira. She had the most beautiful welcoming smile. We were immediately assured that their rooms were clean and comfortable. Ira went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. Upon entering the room, we experienced a wave of happiness because the room was everything she said it would be. We will never take a chance at staying anywhere but a Marriott branch again. Thank you AC Hotel and Ira for the awesome hospitality!

title: The best experience in NYC!
text: We are Hilton Honors Gold members and always stay with Hilton for 15+ years, but wanted to give Marriott a try on our recent vacation to NYC. We have not had a vacation since before the pandemic and really wanted to have a great experience. We chose this hotel because we had tickets to see Wicked and the location was perfect. From the moment we arrived in the lobby, we were greeted by Davon from the front desk in such a warm and welcoming way, we felt like we arrived at home. He was awesome! He recommended the Boqueria restaurant in the hotel, which we immediately went to after going to our outstanding room. We loved the modern decor and the floor to ceiling windows, rainfall shower head in the walk in shower, open closet area with glass-door fridge, the padded bench for our suitcases, plenty of wonderful lighting and the awesome TV with all of our streaming services on it. We got the city view room and loved looking at the lights and sights. We had never had tapas before and we absolutely loved the food at Boqueria and the service was outstanding. We could walk to see Broadway shows of course, perfect location. We also ate at the Castell rooftop lounge and had an awesome experience there as well. We reserved all our dining on the open table app. We also ordered online and picked up food. We used their limo service to get back to LaGuardia and they also helped us get cabs from the desk. Our entire stay was outstanding and we want to thank Davon and the entire staff for making it the best trip ever to NYC. If this hotel and staff are an indication of how Marriott is, we are definitely new Marriott fans, we will be back again to the AC for SURE.

title: Exceptional hotel stay
text:
Great location! Clean rooms. And most of all best customer service. You will not regret your stay here. IO has been the best hotel host. If you’re lucky enough to meet her, she will by far exceed your expectations and treat you like family. We will definitely be staying here again.

Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone

title: AC NY TS Experience
text:
The hotel has such great reviews... I choose it based on all the positive reviews AND the fact that it had 2 beds (oddly hard to find in NYC) in my price range.
PROS: awesome front staff, friendly and helpful... no waiting at front with questions etc. Hotel was clean and modern, but basic. We had a coffee maker! Location, very near the action but not in it, so easy to have uber pull up or walk to corner for subway.  We went to 4 shows in 7 nights, walked every time.  Onsite restaurant was good for evening drink or bar snack, didn't eat any meals there.  

CONS: I have nothing to compare this to in NYC but I was surprised by so many positive reviews, the room was ok, crazy small (that's NYC) and 2 beds no extra seating and no tub (which I really wish we'd had)  Cleaning was every other day and they missed a day so it was our first 4 days before room was clean.  Our hallway (floor 5) needed refurb, baseboard was missing.  I double checked we had late check out 2x when checking in and on last day, a hotel worker still walked into our room at 11:30am the morning we checked out.  One person told us we had until 2pm one 4pm so, I'm not sure.

The nice thing is that it is across from a low building so if you're on the city facing side even on the 5th floor we got sunlight streaming into our window, bad part we had no window sheer, so we had to use the blackout curtain or wave at the NY Times workers across the way.  If you're not in your room much this is a great place to sleep and location to be a tourist from.  

In general I would choose the next level of hotel in the future, for the cost this was very basic, limited lobby seating, no door man, small rooms.  One time a homeless person came into the hotel while I was in the lobby, the staff handled it well but they had to handle it.  The block it is on is also a little sketchy, we never had a problem but it was the only one in the Times Square area where we saw active drug dealing (at the corner McDonalds) and more panhandling.  It must have been outside of TS enough that I only saw 1 NYPD patrol in 7 days, we saw tons of them in other areas on other blocks, maybe AC could request more presence.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text:
This was our first time in NYC, and my niece who stayed here numerous times recommended this hotel.  It was a sisters / cousins / nieces trip.  My daughter and I arrived at 10:00 am, and was greeted by Ricardo and Davon.  We needed two rooms, and asked if they could be next to each other AND if one could be ready for us to check in at that time.  Davon worked his magic and found us two rooms on the eighth floor, we were so appreciative after a 3:00 am wake up to get there.  Ricardo greeted us with his mega watt smile, and told us whatever we needed just to ask.  We asked about local attractions.  Davon and Ricardo both chimed in with many great suggestions.  At check out Joshua and Sonia were equally as kind.  Joshua asked how we were getting to the airport, and suggested a service.  Truly the BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE I have encountered at a hotel in a very long time.  Each time we came into the hotel out from a day of exploring, we were greeted as if by an old friend.  They asked what we did, how our day was, and asked if we needed anything, then gave us a water bottle.
The hotel was centrally located.  We went to see Moulin Rouge at the Al Hirshfield theatre, and it was a close walk.  It is in close proximity to Times Square, and there are tons of great restaurants around.
The room was very modern, very clean, and by NYC standards, quite spacious.  If I ever plan on going to NYC again, I will stay here!
Thank you for the perfect stay.

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
The Times Square AC is my favorite hotel in the city for two reasons- the balcony room and the staff. I’ve stayed here before, stayed again last week, and will stay again in the future!

First of all, the balcony room. Literally incredible. Not only is the room well-appointed, but the balcony… it literally takes my breath away every time. Just stunning, especially at night.

If the balcony wasn’t enough, the staff at this hotel has to be one of the best teams of Marriott employees I have ever encountered, and I usually stay 50+ nights a year. First of all, Tatiana. I believe Tatiana is the manager. She went above and beyond to help my best friend and I locate an item we wanted to use. Second, Davon. So hospitable and quite possibly the best customer service this side of the Mississippi. Third, Mario. I really enjoyed talking to him. And fourth, the bell person for bringing my luggage up to the room. I didn’t catch his name but he was great.

Overall another outstanding experience. The balcony room is incredible and the staff made me feel so welcome every time.

title: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful!
text: Excellent hotel! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The hotel was extremely clean! My room was clean! I really enjoyed the rooftop restaurant! The good and drinks were good! The atmosphere was every welcoming!

title: Time Square Goodie
text: Nice hotel located in a great area. Walking distance to Bryant Park and Summit One Vanderbilt. Bed was very comfy and we were able to check in early due to an early flight. My room has a microwave and refrigerator. My friends rooms did not. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location and very friendly staff
text: Nice hotel in a good location. Staff are friendly and helpful . Rooms are well furnished albeit a little compact. Would definitely stay again. The only gripe and it’s not really specifically aimed at this hotel as all US hotels seem to be doing this is the housekeeping policy I.e. since Covid most hotels will only clean and restock room after two nights.  I think this is a lazy option and life has moved on. If hotels continue to do this they should really pass on their cost savings to the guest.  Overall an enjoyable stay

title: Most helpful concierge in NYC
text: My wife and I loved our time at the AC Hotel Times Square. Joshua was the friendliest concierge I’ve ever experienced. He helped with directions, finding local spots and made sure to always call us by our first names when he saw us. He really made our stay!

title: Recommend
text: Great location easy to get around. Excellent customer services every staff we met was super friendly and welcoming especially Joshua! Rooms are a bit small but that’s NYC for you. Overall recommend it if you looking for stays around midtown.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Great stay in this hotel, I can only recommend it.
Spacious, clean and practical rooms. Service of great quality with personnel with small cares. 

Joshua personally took care of us and is a very invested person and of a great kindness.

title: Great hotel location and friendly staff
