text: This hotel was a great choice for a few days in NYC!  I took my college age daughter and roomates for a few days during spring break.  Ricardo was extremely helpful with some suggestions of places to eat and fun things to do!  It was great to be so close to the theaters and Bryant Park, Grand Central Station and 5th avenue shopping!  Will definitely stay here again!  Rooftop bar was also fun!

title: good stay
text: Came with my girlfriend for our anniversary. Great place  clean rooms lovely staff. The receptionist Ira was very nice and polite and helped us check in really easy.  Would come again. There’s a lot of good food around the hotel

title: Ellis saved the day
text:
There was a problem with the TV but the engineer Ellis was very good and dedicated to fixing it quickly. I also appreciated how friendly and respectful he was. 
I didn't give a 5 star review of my stay due to the toilet hadn't been cleaned properly before I checked in and also there were coffee stains splashed over the wall art the desk which hadn't been cleaned off

title: Head Coach \ LTU
text: Mario was very helpful and welcoming second time visit in the wonderful city of New York. We will be back at least twice a year next time for my birthday. warmer weather. and great places to eat. Thank you.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER
text: The AC Times Square… just remember this name for the best hotel in New York. I have stayed for a few days for work at this hotel. Stepping through the lobby, I was immediately struck by the beautiful and friendly reception area. Light, airy and very spacious...very welcoming atmosphere. Ira, showed me a brief tour of the hotel and common areas. Throughout the remainder of the hotel, the staff was very professional, friendly and extremely helpful. Ira was always greeting and smiling making sure I was satisfied with my stay. The location of the hotel is great. The room was very spacious and well equipped with all essentials and fantastic view. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to the tourists who want to go to New York/Times Square. Will be back to this place soon..!!!

title: Best Birthday Getaway!
text: You could not ask for a more hospitable and comforting experience than the one I had over my birthday at the AC Times Square. Between beautiful views, incredibly hospitable service and intentional recommendations it was the stay of my dreams.

title: Only Hotel We're Using for NYC Trips Moving Forward
text:
We were greeted immediately upon entry and offered candy. The front desk was amazing for our check in (thank you io and Simone!). It was only a 5 minute walk to our theatre and a 10 minute walk to Time Square. We were able to walk to and from Penn Station for our train. Davon was really the best employee we crossed paths with during our stay. We had a scheduling issue and he helped us remedy our issues flawlessly. The whole staff was always in great spirits and the highlight of our day when we left or came back. Kiss my Slice is right next door, easy late night delicious and affordable pizza. Kung Fu Kitchen right around the corner for also affordable dim sum. Just a 10/10 location.

Only two complaints (and they aren't even a deal breaker) is the elevator situation was pretty rough. Constantly waiting and jerkiness of the elevator. That being said, they did have signs up saying there would only be one elevator starting March 6 for maintenance of the other two, so maybe it'll be better after. Second thing, I wouldn't recommend paying for the City View. It's not what you're picturing and we kept the blinds down most of the visit anyway since we didn't want to watch people working at their desks. But we would totally stay in one of their simpler rooms hands down. You're missing out by not staying here.

title: AMAZING STAFF
text: Great rooms - clean and spacious for NYC. Great rooftop bar and AMAZING front desk staff. Devon, Ricardo & Mario always had a smile on their faces and went above a beyond to help us with whatever we needed.

title: Great hotel and best front desk staff ever!!
text: We stayed at the AC New York Times Square and it was great.  Personal shout out to Ricardo, Mario and Davon who were absolutely awesome. They made our stay absolutely flawless and so much fun.  We will absolutely be recommending this hotel to any of our friends that are traveling to NYC.

title: The staff make this hotel top notch
text: The staff at this hotel were all so amazing. From IO who checked us in to Davon who always made sure to chat us up and a third gentleman who’s name I did not get (tall, African American man with longer hair) who always made sure to check in with us, every encounter with them left me and my daughter smiling. The hotel is in a great location, not too much street noise, but easy walk to everything. The elevators were a tad scary with all their creaks and groans, but we survived, ha ha. The room was plenty spacious for the 2 of us and all our things. The only complaint was the lighting. The room was so dark even with all lights on, and the bathroom lighting was terrible for trying to do makeup, but we made do. Would definitely stay here again!

title: AC Hotel - Review for Simone IO
text:
Simone is the absolute best. She made sure me and my team we properly accomadted and made us feel right at home during our business trip. She is an amazing hotel receptionist, and is the reason I will continue to stay at AC hotels throughout the country. 10/10 reccomend if you are staying in NYC to stay here and ask for Simone when booking! She may even get you a free drink voucher for the rooftop bar, but you didn’t hear it from me! 

Thank you Simone for making our stay fantastic. Continue being great. We will be back!

- Isaiah

title: Excellent customer service
text: I forgot my contact solution. I Didn't realize it untill late at night. Hotel market did not have any.  Ocean at the front desk went out of his way to help me. Really appreciated. Great customer service.

title: Ottima posizione, hotel ben tenuto
text: Hotel in ottima posizione a Midtown, vicino a tutto. Struttura pulita, letti e cuscini comodi. Il personale in reception molto gentile e accogliente, in particular Joshua!! Thank you for looking after us Joshua!!  Ritorneremo quando passiamo da New York

title: Welcome to New York
text: Hotel was great. But hotel service was greater!! Ricardo and Davon were big helps to us Louisiana guests. They gave us directions to places we wanted to visit. I down for a conference at another hotel. They gave me directions as to where I could walk and sightsee at the same time. All of our needs were met.  If we ever come back, this is our hotel. Hopefully, those two will meet us as we enter

title: Super Hotel
text: Gute zentrale Lage, sauberes und modernes Hotel, schöne Bar auf dem Dach und das Personal ist unausgesprochen freundlich! Vorallem Joshua, er war sehr hilfsbereit und hat uns super empfehlungen gegeben. Alle Anliegen die wir hatten behandelte er stehts freundlich und professionell 10/10! Wir werden wieder kommen.

title: The 5 Star Experience
text: The AC Hotel is super update to date. Ocean helped me get checked into my hotel on the night of Valentine’s Day. 10/10 recommend this hotel to anyone in NYC. Unforgettable experience. And the hotel is in Times Square so it’s perfect.

title: Awesome stay
text: Very easy check in. The front desk employees made my stay pleasant any convenient on top of that the room was very clean. The bar and restaurant ambiance was very nice. Room service was quick.. have no cons, will be staying again

title: Beyond amazing!
text: 5 stars in all areas but staff professionalism and kindness were beyond expectations. Ira was the sweetest person greeting us and making such an effort to make our stay extraordinary. It was my daughter’s birthday and she offered to decorate the room with balloons, brought her a cake and a card. The room was super clean, comfortable, our view on the 14th floor was super. Thank you for this amazing stay!

title: NYC Trip
text: The hotel and staff were absolutely amazing! Joshua at the front desk went above and beyond to make sure my mom, husband, and I felt welcomed to the city. Our room was spotless upon check-in and we had no issues during our stay. We will definitely be back!

title: Second Visit Better Than First
text:
This is my second stay here.  Better than the first.  The front desk staff were friendlier and more helpful than last time.  Rooms were in good condition and they put me on a high floor so there was very little street noise.  
The biggest downside was the overwhelming smell of cleaning chemicals in the room.  The upside is that you could tell they’d just cleaned the room.  But the smell was so strong that it gave me a headache and I couldn’t sleep at night.
The location is good walking distance to restaurants and Broadway shows.  Very safe.
For the price, this hotel is excellent value for money.
Now if only they could tone down that smell…

title: Friendly staff & the location!!
text: I love how close the hotel was to everything. Literally, I didn't mind the walks to Time Square and restaurants. Shoutout to Ocean, who made us feel welcome after a long day of delayed flights to New York.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: Hotel is in a nice location, especially for theater goers, not far from Times Square but far enough away that it is not in the middle of the mayhem. It is a very short walk from the E train from JFK and LGA, and also very close to many other lines at Times Square. Rooms are clean and in good repair. Staff is friendly and helpful, especially Ocean.

title: My go to hotel when in NYC!!!
text: We stay at this hotel often, my husband works in the city and I tag along. The rooms are quiet, modern and like any AC you get the boutique feeling. Devon is great! all the staff is really friendly and accommodating. They have Boqueria right downstairs and a chic rooftop. Great location and quiet corner even tho is in times square. Highly recommended.

title: This hotel makes your NYC visit perfect
text: My friend and I stayed January 27, 2023.  We had a nicely appointed and comfortable double queen room. The bathroom is well designed with a walk in shower and sliding glass doors.  Check-in was prompt and throughout the hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  The AC is a sleek and immaculately clean hotel.  The restaurant, Bouqueria, has good food and there is also a rooftop bar/lounge with stunning views of NYC.  I do recommend this hotel

title: Booking a room
text: Excellent A1 service with true good hospitality helped me book a room last minute with excellent view and comfortable beds. I will definitely recommend this stay to any else looking for something similar

title: Great Hotel !
text: I’ve been to tons of Marriotts in different states, and this truly had an amazing customer service experience. Dayvon and Ricardo were amazing and so welcoming. Their services made our weekend trip its absolute best!

title: Weekend get away
text: Me and my family visited for the weekend for my mother bday and it was amazing. Ocean was amazing! He was a great help to me a my family. We will definitely be back! Everyone go visit ocean he will take care of you!

title: Clean, modern hotel
text: Came in for business solo. Room was quiet, bathroom floors were a bit warped, but it was all very clean. Front desk person was nice. I don’t love the section of eight ave by port authority - there are more charming parts of the city - but it is a walkable tourist area with a lot of varied subway access.

title: Amazing experience!
text: Devon was amazing!! We arrived early from New Jersey with all our luggage hoping to check in early, and he accommodated us, showed us where to park, and was so warm and welcoming. The room was amazing and staff are great! We highly recommend this hotel if you’re coming to this area of of New York!

title: AC Hotel Time Square
text: We accidentally booked a different hotel, and found this one last minute. Such a beautiful hotel! We were greeted with a friendly, and helpful associate. Ocean was amazing, and super accommodating! Made our stay in NYC a dream!

title: Well taken care of
text: IO, Rudy, and Ocean gave fantastic service for my long stay here and accommodated all of my needs. Whether I needed any items for my room, or suggestions on where to go in New York City, they were able to help me.

title: Great stay for business and fun
text: 1 word = Joshua. He works on the front of house and helps out with bags, cars and many other things. He’s the nicest guy you’ll ever meet and is an asset to the hotel. People make a difference to your stay, and Josh does exactly that.

title: Wonderful experience!
text: I couldn’t say enough good things about this hotel. I was scrambling to find a hotel to stay in my last night in the city, and Nick at the front desk really took care of me. He quickly found a room that was available. Upon arrival, Nick was quick to make me feel at ease and checked me in swiftly. I have never had such amazing customer service in my life. If you’re looking for a hotel with an amazing staff, and close proximity to multiple locations, you have to stay here. Hotel is clean, modern, and very chic! Rooms are spacious and lobby is gorgeous. Nick that you so much for all that you did, you really saved my trip.

title: Ricardo made our trip to NYC special
text: My daughter and I stayed at the the AC hotel in Times Square to see one of the last showings of Beetlejuice on Broadway.  This hotel was wonderful and in an amazing location however, what really made it a lovely experience, was Ricardo.   He is the embodiment of excellent customer service, and it was genuine.  He made my daughter feel special which, of course, made my trip.  Thank you Ricardo.

title: Excellent hotel in NYC 🗽🇺🇸
text:
Amazing hotel, facilities and location. Roof top bar is a must go to when staying. Didn’t get a chance to eat at the restaurant next door, however the bar was excellent. 

Shout out to the concierge Joshua who sorted our taxi back to the airport 👌🏻

🇺🇸🗽

title: Vacation at the AC hotel time square with the sweetest staff
text:
Ocean was really kind and helped me get medication for my headache. I am so grateful to him because it was 4:45am in the morning and I (solo female traveller) was scared to walk outside alone to buy some. Great service. Thank you a thousand times!!❤️❤️
Ps: sorry for the bad english I m french canadian 😇

title: Excellent Experience for Holiday stay at AC Hotel NY Times Square
text: The hotel has excellent location. Many thanks to front desk staff especially Ocean who kindly granted us late check out in view of long haul flight at night and Ricardo who always put on the brightest smile and patiently advised on the transport options to the JFK airport! Overall an excellent experience.

title: Big Fun in NYC thanks to the AC Marriott staff
text: We had a great experience at the AC Hotel in Times Square.  The staff, specifically Jaron and Josh were amazing.  They gave us excellent customer service from the time we stepped into the lobby to our departure.  Highly recommend

title: Good for stay
text: Nice hotel with friendly, kind and polite staff . Clean rooms! Comfortable beds! Modern TV and other room equipment. Hotel has great location. The best offer in terms of price-quality ratio. Highly recommend and definitely come back!!!!

title: This was a business stay for three nights.
text: I Had a great time in AC Hotel with phenomenal service throughout my stay. I stayed for two nights and the customer service/front desk was flawless. I’d like to give a special mention to Ocean who gave world class service and made sure all of my needs were met.

title: Best weekend to bring in 2023
text: Came to NYC for a quick weekend trip with my friend and cousins. Both Marcus and Joshua at front desk were amazing and kind. I’ve been to multiple Marriotts, but this is one of my top favorites for customer service.

title: Great Hotel
text: Perfect stay for a couple visiting for 5 nights. Ocean was an amazing clerk at the front desk. We arrived at the hotel at 7am, and he was able to check us in early for no additional fee! Clean and modern hotel with friendly staff and a great restaurant called Boqueria. Coffee every morning and delicous tapas. Overall, very good experience for people like us, who are not staying at the hotel as much.

title: Best Hotel for Everything!
text:
My husband and I visit New York frequently for theatre and have stayed in numerous hotels. The AC Marriott in Times Sq on W. 40th is now our absolute favorite. We’re always looking for good prices but not wanting to sacrifice convenience, comfort, cleanliness, and safety.  
At Marriotts AC Hotel, the personal service is exceptional. No long waits at the front desk, special requests were honored, and theatres are only blocks away. Our rooms here are always spotless, stocked with just the right amenities and very comfy beds. And rooms are surprisingly quiet for Times Sq! As the AC is only 5 years old, the lobby is bright and well-designed, elevators are quick, and there’s a restaurant on the premises open for reasonably priced breakfast, lunch and dinner. AC Marriott offers more for the price than any other hotel in the city!

title: Great hotel with excellent location!
text: I chose this hotel specifically because it looked pretty new and in the area of Times Square. At check-in the attendants were super nice and courteous. The room was amazing with the most comfortable beds. We went there for 5 nights and ended up staying an extra one. It has the best bagel place next to it, great for breakfast. Also, a bunch of places to eat, in the same street and both adjacent streets. The hotel has a restaurant, but did not have enough time to eat there, but had a great menu.   I definitely recommend this hotel because of its price, location and amenities.

title: January stay
text: Customer service was excellent, the aesthetics are very pleasing. It was a very enjoyable stay. I will definitely stay here again and have referred the hotel to my friend who will be busing NY soon. I have nothing but compliment’s regarding my stay.

title: Five star serviced !
text:
I just want to say thank you so much to Ocean. My flight got canceled and needed to book a room. I called the hotel and made a reservation. Ocean was so helpful to get me a room around passed midnight (mostly hotel won’t let you check in around 2 pm.) but ocean understood my situation. He took his time to anticipated my need. 
 The room was clean and spacious. I highly recommend this hotel when you are in NY. 
Again thank  you Ocean. I really appreciated your help. Five star serviced!!

title: Great hotel with good space!
text: We came here for the NYE celebration with our host daughter and her family from Spain. We stayed for two days and departed on the 1st. From the moment we walked in, we had a great experience. Ricardo, was amazing. He welcomed our family, and my daughter felt like a major VIP! He made sure to address us every time he saw us. His warmness and outgoing personality made it wonderful to walk in each day. I also met the maintenance man there. He was extremely nice and let me know that what we broke (on accident) was fine because it was a child protection measure that was put in place to help families with little children. The location was perfect. I usually travel to NYC a few times a year and we usually catch the train in. With its prime location, we could get to the train station within 10 mins and from the hotel, to Times Square in 7 mins. They have several places around there to get some dim sum, pizza, and bagels. The location is safe and very convenient. I would def stay there again. I should also mention that the front staff was very accommodating and wonderful. They made you feel welcome by speaking to you the minute you walked into the hotel. The hotel has a bar on the rooftop and a restaurant downstairs. If you are on a food budget, there are plenty of food places around you, including a $1 pizza slice places around there. Great location and great hotel!

title: Five Stars
text: It was one of the best experiences we had Mr ocean helped us very greatly thank you so much for everything the room was very very nice for Times Square and again thank you so much for everything Mr ocean God bless you and your family Happy New Years thank you

title: Xmas in The City
text: We stay in NYC over Christmas each year and our experience at this hotel was very enjoyable. Our room was ready when we arrived and the gentleman who checked us in was very nice. Rooftop bar has great views. A little slow getting your order processed but worth the wait. Skip the restaurant attached to the hotel.

title: Beyond Amazing Service!!
text: Cannot rave enough about the staff at the AC Times Square! We asked to move rooms because we were across from the elevators and it was loud. We had theater tickets so couldn't move our things, and the desk staff graciously offered to take care of it for us. We returned after our night out to find all of our belongings, which we'd completely unpacked in our original room, set out and hung neatly in a gorgeous corner room on a higher floor with a fantastic view. Truly would not have expected such gracious treatment. Thank you, thank you, Ira, Tati,  and Ocean!!!

title: 5 stars
text: 5 star customer service! Clean large room great location  Davon and Ocean were the BEST!!! Will recommend to friends. Very quiet room too. Roof top area very nice. Will stay again for sure. Did not expect such excellent  service!

title: Recommendations
text: Mr. Ocean at the front desk at AC Hotel Manhattan Time Square  provided me with an amazing customer service , he was very professional and make things happen Thank you very much for your help and for  everything  you did for us

title: Brilliant!
text:
Brilliant hotel, brilliant location! 

This is set on Times Square just abit down from the busiest area, although the area is still busy the hotel is very secure, clean and made us feel safe away from home. The staff on front desk would greet us good morning and good evening every time we went past no matter how busy, they area a credit to the hotel. Although I didn’t catch all of there names they couldn’t be of more help for anything we needed. Joseph (we think his name was, always wears a beanie) escorted us to our car that the hotel booked at the end of the journey , was so kind and helpful . I would definitely recommend booking transfers through the hotel always much easier and was there waiting for us it was brilliant! 

The rooms were clean and had everything you needed for your stay, worth paying that bit more than other competitors in the area as we felt more relaxed and safe. 

Thanks so much AC Times Square! Happy holidays!

title: Ocean  at the front dest was excellent. Great Customer service and he was very helpful.
text: I’m having a wonderful time at the AC time square in Nyc. The staff was very helpful and professional. Especially Ocean at the front dest. What a wonderful person. Kudos to him and the full staff at AC time square. I’m looking forward to come back here on my next trip to NYC. I finally found a cool place to stay in NYC. 👍🏾👌🏾🇺🇸

title: Not a fan
text: This is the first time I've stayed at this hotel in NY.  I'm in NY almost once a month and it wasn't possible to book my two go to hotels so thought I'd try this property.  To begin with I hate the location, I knew that going in but I thought that there would be other redeeming qualities and it was only a 2 night stay so I could overlook it.  In order to get anywhere I want to walk to I have to walk past the craziness of the Port Authority and 42nd St, I usually stay more north and don't have to deal with this.  My biggest aggravation with the hotel is this...I am Gold Elite with Marriott.  I have a standing request on my profile for a high floor and have never had a problem at any hotel in NY having that request fulfilled.  This hotel has 21 floors, I was put on the 7th floor, this is not a high floor and to top it off my room was at the end of the hall directly overlooking the brick wall of a building.  I could not even open the curtains as you could see directly into the rooms of the other building.  I enjoy open curtains and sunlight, this really bothered me.  As gold Elite you are entitled to a room upgrade if available, I wasn't even looking for an upgrade this room to me was the bottom of the barrel.  The room itself was clean and neat but in my opinion it was dark, especially with having to keep the curtains closed and the furnishings were too stark and modern for my liking.  On the positive side the elevators were large and seemed to always be there when you needed one.  The lobby was very nice and the staff was cordial.  I tried it once but won't be back at this hotel.

title: Book here IMMEDIATELY!
text: Stayed here for a 4 day Christmas in NYC adventure and it did NOT disappoint! This hotel is new, clean, spacious, and in the perfect location! It’s close enough to Time Square for the action, but tucked away enough for privacy and peace & quiet. The staff were our favorite part of our visit!! We received the warmest welcome from Nick, Mario, & Ricardo! They were so kind, and filled with so much love & light! They made sure we had everything we needed our entire stay. The complimentary waters and fresh lavender in the lobby were also a plus! The Christmas decor was also beautiful in the lobby! Not only were the evening staff awesome, but the front desk staff in the morning were a complete JOY as well! Davon, Simone, Patrick, and Ira were refreshing in the morning. With great city recommendations!  They went above and beyond!  We loved everything about Ac Hotel, including the rooftop, & restaurants. The plush bathrooms & slippers.  Even Billy the engineer was so kind when he came to adjust our lighting, and Alex as we were departing.  We are so excited to visit NYC again, and we will def be back! 10’s across the board! 5 out of 5 stars! Would RECOMMENDt!

title: Ocean rocks.The best.ask for him
text: Ocean was a tremendous brand ambassador, very helpful.   Rudy and Rahim and Joseph the security guard were all very helpful and nice.  I look forward to my next visit with the team. Please visit ac when in nyc .

title: Clean, comfortable and convenient
text: Beds were comfortable and staff was pleasant and helpful.  Lighting in the bathroom was a bit dark   Josh at the front desk was extremely helpful in finding us a ride to the airport! Thanks Josh overall the hotel is in a great location for the theaters

title: Thank you very much
text: Ocean & Rudy was great helping me out with getting into my room . If you come ask for one of the two I promise you they won’t let you down. my view is amazing will definitely be back . Thank you again.

title: Wonderful Holiday Trip
text:
Ricardo made our stay wonderful! As first timers to NYC he created a welcoming environment and ensures that we had an incredible stay. 

This hotel is very walkable to Time Swuare, Broadway, Central Park, MET, etc. It’s also close to the subway.

title: Nice hotel
text: Nice,  clean hotel. Friendly staff. Convenient location. Would stay here again for sure. Didn’t feel like the other tiny, dingy NYC hotels. I even slept well, which is rare for an NYC stay.  I don’t have much else to say, but it requires me to hit 200 words.

title: 10/10 Recommend!
text: The perfect hotel for our weekend stay. Great location, comfortable room, and amazing staff (special thanks to Josh for helping make our stay so pleasant)! Both of the restaurants connected the hotel were very good as well.

title: Grate Hotel near Times Square
text:
The Hotel was very good to stay in New York. 5 min. From Time Square and near to any Subway.

The Service at Reception was very good Joshua is looking for all our Questions big Thanks to him.

We are will coming back to AC Hotel.

title: Wonderful experience
text: Awesome and beautiful place. Very convenience and close to everything . Joshua at front desk was very helpful and courteous. Overall from the front to the room was a wide full experience . Amenities were great . Highly highly recommended 😁

title: 3 night stay NYC - amazing customer service
text:
Stayed for 3 nights and every single employee was SO lovely! 
I had the pleasure of dealing with Ocean and Rudy, I can’t say enough wonderful things about them. Ocean was extremely accommodating making my overall travel experience so much more relaxing, thank you!! The hotel was very clean and location was amazing but Ocean definitely put our stay over the top!

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: This was perfect for a long weekend stay. We stayed on the 19th floor. The noise wasn’t an issue and we caught a glimpse of the Empire State Building. The staff were all extremely friendly, helpful and attentive. They all acted like they remembered you. We dined once at the restaurant and it was just as impressive. I don’t usually write reviews but this was a stand out - the staff were excellent; the hotel was very clean and the location was convenient.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Room and shower is amazing and the Reception staff where so friendly especially Simone :) she gave us different locations to visit and was extremely helpful. She should be promoted!!! Thank you to the rest of the staff also

title: Wonderful Staff and lovely experience
text: Hotel staff was Incredibly accommodating. we stay in hotels across the country and this is one of the best staff experiences we have had. Ocean and Joshua at the front desk were both outstanding and made our experience very special. The staff at the downstairs restaurant was also incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and had wonderful accommodations.

title: Convenient location & awesome staff
text:
What stood out most about our stay was the staff. Everyone we came into contact with was pleasant and attentive. I want to call out Joshua from the front as being incredibly hospitable. He just had great energy from helping us with our bags to giving terrific recommendations in the city. It's people like him who add to the experience while out of town.

The location is excellent, with lots of entertainment and shopping to walk to. Non-touristy neighborhoods are just a quick Uber ride away. The restaurant attached to the hotel (Boqueria) was a big plus too.

Rooms are on the smaller side (as expected in NYC), nothing special, but clean and modern.

title: Bucket list dream
text: Hotel was great, staff were amazing. Really friendly and welcoming at all times. All ways asking if we were ok or needed anything. Only downside was limited choice in restaurant and paper cups in room. Would be happy to visit again

title: Great stay and amazing front desk
text:
Receptionists were all excellent 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Location is great. Great room size for New York

I highly recommend AC Marriott Times Square 

Will definitely come back 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
My family enjoyed the hotel a lot

title: Not a good choice
text: Booked a king with city view.   View was not great for the extra money.  The room is in desperate need of a refresh   The wall paper is peeling off the walls.  See the picture of the window shade.   The hallway carpet is disgusting and dirty.   Would not recommend

title: Very satisfying hotel experience
text:
The room was small but clean, well appointed and our view of the Empire  State Building was lovely.  We had a microwave and small fridge in our room which was a bonus for me as I like to drink hot tea.  The location was good for Times Square and the Theatres.  The area does not have many choices for great restaurants really close by but if walking isn’t an issue you’re ok.  The rooftop bar and restaurant was impressive, good staff and food up there.
The front desk staff were great and accommodating.

title: A nice hotel
text:
We stayed for 5 days and found the hotel  excellent with a great rooftop bar with an outside seating area.
It was ideally situated for getting to all the tourist areas. We would certainly stay there again.

title: Don't leave your luggage with the hotel staff
text: I was at the hotel for a work conference. The day my conference was ending, I left my luggage with the hotel till I could pick it up and take it with me to the airport. Once returning to get my bag, the staff could not locate it? After sticking around and trying to sort out the people, I had to leave to catch my flight. This happened on a Thursday and I got a call 3-4 hours later that said they had accidentally taken my bag to a room. I get it, mistakes happen. However, rather than making it a priority to get my luggage back to me, I never heard another word out of the manager I was communicating with and had to call the hotel directly THREE times the following Monday to try and get someone to send my luggage. It wasn't until the following Monday around 3pm (65 some hours later) that someone said they would have my bag taken to UPS to be sent back to me. Was truly disappointed in my experience.

title: Girls Trio to NYC
text: We had a wonderful  3 nights stay AC Marriott Time Square.  Room was modern and clean.  Staff was super friendly (Ocean, Josh and Ricardo )  and very accommodating and informative.  Location was convenient.  Rooftop bar was a great place to have a drink.

title: Great service!! Joshua
text: We had one day to spend in NYC and AC held our bags in the lobby so we could go explore. Joshua was extremely helpful and had everything we needed. Joshua also called us a car and gave us recommendations. One of the best hotel services especially for the city. Thank you Joshua for making our stay so amazing!!

title: Davon is the bomb.com!
text: The best part of AC Hotel was Davon, he was simply AMAZING! Very patient, helpful, warm and welcoming during my stay. I didn’t want to leave NY lol!when I come back to Ny I’m staying at AC if Davin still works there lol!

title: Super hôtel
text: Super bien placé, près de tout je recommande fortement.la literie très confortable,les chambres spacieuses,le personnel attentif, le métro à proximité,un petit restaurant pour les petits déjeuner juste à côté très bon rapport qualité prix.

title: Hôtel super!
text:
Super hôtel, propre, chambres spacieuses, belle sdb, personnel très sympa, emplacement au top proche de tous les points à visiter, proche du métro. 
Seul petit point négatif, un peu bruyant. 
Le point positif : petit restau juste à côté en sortant de l’hôtel très bien pour le petit dej.

title: Solid choice close to Times Square
text: Stayed 2 nights for business in the area. Arrived late night and the staff was excellent getting us checked in quickly. Also gave us a complimentary bottle of wine. The hotel was clean and felt safe. I had a room on the 7th floor, not much of a view due to the hotel location. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others looking to be near Times Square.

title: Central NYC stay
text:
Stayed at the AC Times square for 3 nights as part of a cruise package. We were tired at check-in after a long flight. We were travelling as 2 couples.  One couple booked in no problem, but the hotel had our booking under a different name.  The 2 staff were not very helpful, and we found ourselves in a 'computer says no' situation. Eventually they got it sorted.  
Rooms were large with nice shower room. Very quiet so we slept well. 
The concierge Ricardo was just the nicest guy and so helpful - full of hints and tips on his mission to make our stay comfortable and stress free. When our transfer didnt turn up he couldnt do enough to help even bringing us out ice cream to cool us off and arranging alternative transport.  Huge thank you to Ricardo who completely changed our experience
Did not have breakfast - amazing bagels at deli next door.  Great location
Thank you would definitely stay again.

title: 13th Birthday Weekend!
text: We had the best weekend celebrating my daughter’s 13th Birthday. The treats in the room for her were very thoughtful. Everyone was kind and helpful. Ricardo is amazing! The location is perfect if Times Square is where you want to be. We walked everywhere and felt very safe, even when we had a late night after Broadway and dinner. Room was a great size. Rooftop bar area is beautiful. Highly recommend.

title: A great stay was had
text: We visited NYC with a group of friends and stayed at the AC. Location was prime for getting out to explore the city each day. Our room was very nice (although true floor to ceiling glass and privacy blinds took some getting used to). The entire staff was courteous and pleasant but I wanted to make a special shout out for Joshua, who was above and beyond when it came to his customer service skills.

title: AC saved the night!
text: Thank you AC for making my experience in NYC much better than the first hotel I checked into but then left because ugh! The AC staff was awesome! The location was perfect and the room was very comfortable.

title: Congratulation to the Staff at AC Marriott NY
text:
All the staff at AC Hotel Marriott Times Square is extremely friendly, especially the receptionists were very charming. They all made us feel so much welcome (thank you Ricardo). The location is perfect. Room and bathroom very clean.
Too much air conditioning in hotel-lobby though. We warmly recommend AC Marriott Times Square and we will for sure come back to AC on our next trip to NY.

title: Exceptional Service
text: Hotel was solid. Appreciated that the hotel wasn’t carpeted. The restaurant and rooftop bar were great. The best part was the service though, and particularly Joshua who went above and beyond throughout the trip. He facilitated the logistics of stay which made it seamless for us. At the end of our stay, he even helped us move our bags down the block due to road closures, and was well beyond our expectations.

title: WOW
text: The location was great,but  the staff was even better! They were warm,welcoming, and very helpful. Joshua was the absolute best. He and the entire staff my our trip smooth from the moment we check in to calling a cab and loading our bags with a pleasant farewell. We will definitely be back soon!

title: Clean rooms and amazing location
text: Great location near Times Square.  Very clean and well appointed rooms.  Super comfortable beds and pillows.  Roomy and bright bathroom .  Excellent gym.  Tons of restaurants near by.  Subway station right outside.  Friendly staff.  30 minutes to LaGuardia Airport.

title: Horrible- noise, front desk and management useless
text:
Absolutely horrible. I’m an ambassador. I called ahead of time and so did my ambassador to request a quiet room on the backside of the hotel. Upon arrival, they put me in a room facing the street- assuring me that on the 16th floor it would be quiet. My husband and I got back to the room and didn’t sleep at all due to the constant jackhammer noise ALL NIGHT. 
They switched our room the next night, but it ruined our first night. 
I left something at the hotel- my husband called twice and the manager said they’d call us back after checking both times. No one ever called. 
Nick and Marlene and Mario are who I spoke with- all useless. No help. They don’t care. 
I expect to be treated as a human, and moreover spending over $20,000 a year at Marriott and staying 100+ nights a year, I expect BETTER. the ambassador program with Marriott is useless- I’m switching myself and my employees back to Hyatt.

title: Joshua was great!
text: He got me a reasonably priced car to the airport and was very helpful with my luggage. My room was large (for nyc) and clean.  The restrooms and workspace in the cellar is fully equipped. The restaurant is also delicious. An easy walk for meetings in midtown.

title: Sorpresa desagradable
text: No entiendo nada...habitaciones que no se limpian durante la estancia. Lo comentamos con el hotel y nos dicen que és su politica de proteccion covid para  sus empleados ...pero sorpresa: no usan mascarillas ni en recepción, ni restaurante....supongo que solo contagian las sabana y toallas! O quizás se están ahorrando el coste de la limpieza....y a 500 dólares la noche si quieres la cama hecha o el baño limpio, te lo haces tú mismo...TOMADURA DE PELO?

title: Long weekend in NYC
text:
1st visit to NYC and wasn't disappointed with our stay. Hotel was well equipped and clean with friendly helpful staff.
We stayed on the 11th floor in a front facing nice sized room.
The staff were always at hand to help, especially Josh who arranged for car to return us the the airport.
A nice  central location, so close to everywhere.

title: Consistently good experience and friendly staff.
text: This team always does a great job and makes you feel truly taken care of. Josh at the front was so helpful this morning grabbing me a car when I was in a rush. Thanks Josh. And Davon…always awesome any time you need something.

title: le service d'étage est totalement inexistant
text:
chambre vieillissante ( parquet gondolé et rails de rideaux en mauvais état)
service d'étage déplorable, ménage fait deux fois en une semaine malgré de nombreuses réclamations
draps de bain non changés, pas de papier wc !!!!, pas dé draps changés !!! ménage médiocre ( papiers et sparadraps sous le lit a notre arrivée)

title: Good business hotel
text:
Clean rooms, nice inside. There is a cool bar on the roof. It has everything you would expect from a good business hotel.

I would personally stay more away from Time square, though i was travelling for work.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: There are way too many better hotels in NYC then to stay at AC Marriott. I used a suite upgrade and got a room with filthy shades, basically 10 TV stations and a view of an empty building. Glad I wasted my suite upgrade on this 2 star hotel. Plus the room upgrade was for a room reserved for someone who is hearing impaired, which is just a BS way to have Marriott cheat you out of your upgrade. What a joke. AVOID AVOID AVOID!!

title: Très confortable et très bien placé
text: Nous avons beaucoup apprécié cet hôtel lors de notre passage à NYC. Super bien placé et très confortable. Parking à proximité avec tarif préférentiel. Personnel au top et souriant, surtout RICARDO qui nous a beaucoup aidé. Nous recommandons !

title: Wonderful staff and comfortable accommodations
text:
The hotel is in a great location. It is close to the Port Authority and Times Square attractions. The beds are comfortable and the room is nice. We were only on the second floor and facing the road. We did not experience any problems with noise. The room was also equipped with a mini refrigerator which came in handy to store water on the 100 degree day. 
The staff go above to ensure the stay is pleasant. There is a rooftop lounge that opens at 4pm. Children are only allowed up there until 7.   Glynda took my girls and I up earlier in the day so we could see it. She also recommended places to visit and things to see.  In addition, Riccardo at the front desk assisted with our plans and transportation to get to the MetLife stadium to see the sold out Lady Gaga concert. 
The air conditioning is not as cool as some people like. However, we found that if we closed the shades the room cooled down. The elevators were a bit slow but it was not a big deal. 
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointing check in experience
text:
I was led to believe my late checkout request was confirmed as I was told via the front desk chat with the hotel on the Bonvoy app, the night before the check in, that my late checkout request was confirmed by 2pm as an elite member. As I checked in and wanted to double check, the front desk person said the room is booked only til 1pm. I explained the communication that led me to believe it is until 2pm, however the front desk person repeated that it is until 1pm, and told me 2pm late checkout is for gold members, and he generally had the attitude that seemed like he didn’t want to help me or be empathetic of the situation, other than the fact that he mentioned, after I showed him the actual chat I believe, that they can hold the luggage after checkout. No apology for the miscommunication, the whole checkin experience felt generally unwelcoming due to the front desk person’s attitude that felt rather not very responsive or empathetic. 

However, The room was nice, except for the fact that there were two bath towels instead of 3 I expected as I had put in the request for another one before the check in. I thought the default number of bath towels was 2. Also the checkout experience was much more pleasant with a different desk person. I generally had positive feelings about the AC hotel brand before but I am a bit disappointed now. I might stay at a different branch, although it wouldn’t be my first choice, but not sure if I’d go back to this one in the future.

title: Awesome staff, good beds, central spot
text: I've come back after the covid shut down, again staff made this such a great stay.  Attention to detail from the connection by text, makes it super easy to request something like extra towels.  Hotel rooms with vinyl plank is much cleaner, well appointed rooms with lots of light if you don't have a view room.  Fridge is great too. Will stay again.

title: Needs Improvement
text:
Just returned to from NYC where I stayed three nights at this hotel. I will start by stating that the hotel was very clean (lobby, common areas, room upon arrival, etc.) and the location was outstanding based on our needs. We upgraded to get a room with a better view - and the room itself was really amazing.

Outside of that, everything is completely uneven and in need of attention.

The front desk staff are casual and unprofessional. I spoke with them on four occasions and it was clear that some additional training is critical. Basic requests fluster them and go unresolved.

I will not go into everything, but the major challenges were as follows:
1) Room was never cleaned the entire stay (despite every 2nd day policy)
2) Room cleaner got into a verbal altercation with a guest on our floor when they asked if their room would be cleaned at some point (didn't make me feel great about reporting the fact that our room was also overdue for cleaning)
3) Was denied late checkout - and guest right in back of me (traveling with us) was granted late checkout without a single question asked - literally a wink and a nod
4) Went back down next day and asked for late checkout, got it with absolutely no questions asked from a different front desk clerk (appreciated, but calls out uneven and randomness of process)
5) Multiple issues with room key not working

I will choose a different Bonvoy hotel next time. Not worth the hassle...but everything above is fixable.  Some small changes and this hotel could be a winner.

Tip: if you don't want to stare at an abandoned factory out your window, you will need to upgrade to city view (which basically gets you a "view" of the New York Times building).

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Chambre un peu étroite pour 3 personnes mais correcte tout de même.
Bon point : bouteilles d'eau à discrétion
Ménage des chambres tous les 2 jours mais un peu léger côté aspiration des sols .
Malgré tout un très bon séjour.
Un grand merci particulier au voiturier qui nous a régler notre soucis de transfert aéroport un un claquement de doigts

title: Excellent staff, great hotel!
text: Stayed here for a 6 day trip and service was element. Reception staff put us in a great corner room on the 18th and Joshua was a real star throughout. Ensuring our needs were met. Thank you to all the staff for maling this trip so special! Would 100% stay again.

title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
Nos hospedamos 10 días mi familia y yo en julio 2022 y lo único que puedo decir es GRACIAS 
Tuvimos una estadía muy padre 
Toda la gente del hotel es Excelente 
Principalmente Alex y Ricardo 
La ubicación, habitaciones, instalaciones 
Todo génial
GRACIAS 🤩!!!!
Esperamos volver pronto y hospedarnos con ustdes 🗽

title: Great Stay!
text: Lovely hotel, outstanding customer service, and perfect location just outside of Times Square. The room was super clean and modern. The staff at the front desk made our check in seamless and went above and beyond to make us comfortable. I would definitely stay again.

title: July 2022 Stay
text: Visited in July 2022 and absolutely loved this hotel. The balcony room was AMAZING - so incredible to have a balcony near Times Square! This was my third time at an AC Hotel and I really like this brand - very contemporary and European with many amenities. The front desk team was great and the location near Penn Station and Times Square was perfect. Excellent stay, five stars.

title: Lovely hotel
text: From booking to check out everything was smooth.  Special thank you too Simone, Tatiana, Su and Nicholas, you all ensure, by sending personal texts, that your customers are satisfied.  This speaks volumes to me.  When entering not only my lovely room but the hotel itself, there was a nice scent that was soft and pleasant.  The room was cleaned and welcoming.  I’m a stickler for neat bathrooms and AC didn’t let me down.  There is an on-site restaurant as well as a rooftop bar.  The decor of the entire property is nothing short of beautiful. This hotel is near all of the attractions for Times Square.  Most things you can walk to in order to avoid the busy street life of NYC and paying for Lyft or Uber which can get expensive for a weekend.  I plan to be back in just a couple of months.  LOOK NO FURTHER, AC Marriott Times Square is it.

title: Would recommend and stay again
text:
Perfect location of course. The biggest surprise was early check in. Had a super early flight and was allowed to check in at 10a; which made the trip extra special. It gave us that extra day without having to think about occupying time before check in. My room was a king, single occupancy and had a microwave and fridge. Nice size bathroom and great shower.
Only con is the bed was firmer than I prefer.
Friendly staff and close to tons.

title: Nice Hotel and Terrific Location
text: Couldn't be happier with the stay we had at the AC Hotel Times Square my wife and I had July 8-10th, 2022.  We were upgraded to a room on the 19th floor that had a balcony.  The room was very nice and the balcony was amazing!   We ate our delicious Spanish egg sandwiches and drank coffee in the mornings purchased from the Boqueria restaurant downstairs that's associated with the hotel on the balcony and drank wine in the evenings after exploring Manhattan during the day. It was our oasis after exploring Manhattan during the day and after our evenings out!  The hotel is conveniently located to everything, the staff was terrific and would definitely make it our go to hotel whenever we our in Manhattan.

title: MALTRATO
text: Llevo dos días en el hotel y no me han limpiado la habitación, nos hemos quejado en reiteradas ocasiones y ni caso , me parece increíble !!! Elegimos esta cadena por confianza y menudo FRAUDE , no hay palabras para describir mi mal pesar que pen

title: Non va bene
text:
La camera che ci hanno assegnato per tre persone è molto piccola con un armadio inesistente . Le pulizie delle camere se non vengono richieste esplicitamente e con insistenza , non vengono fatte 
Nessun receptionist parla l’italiano

title: Great location , lovely hotel just an issue with room on 5ft floor not cleaned despite asking multiple times
text:
This is a 2 part review as I had booked 2 room , 3 of us stayed in a 2 double bed room really lovely , very good size for NYC lovely bathroom 2 , very comfortable beds and cleaning was great , lovely people on reception great location 
We had a king room on the 5th floor we stayed for 4 nights and we asked for the room on the 5th floor to be cleaned but it was never cleaned , on our final night when we came back there were clean sheet just left on a table there was no one to do the bed so we had to do it ourselves , so whoever was working on the 5th floor during the june bank holiday is the issue , would definitely stay here again when we return in 2 years but the issue with the 5th floor room isn't good enough

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: I'm a huge fan of this AC (part of the Marriott group.)  Location is excellent for all Broadway shows; quick walk from Penn Station, across the street from Port Authority.  Super-clean; I particularly love the NO CARPETING in the rooms, just smooth floors that they wash down with disinfectant.  Also, the windows open!  Love the front desk staff- Davoun and Ricardo are the best.  Already planning a return trip this fall.

title: Long Weekend in NYC
text: Stayed here for long weekend in NYC. Hotel is very hip and the room was clean. There were three of us in the room, so it was tight quarters but nice to have a small fridge for water and the bathroom was a good size for a NYC hotel. On the afternoon of day 2 we requested housekeeping for the next day and was told we would be put on the list. When we departed for the day on day 3, I checked again at front desk to confirm that we would get our room cleaned and they said again they would “put us on the list.” Unfortunately when we returned early evening, our room had not been cleaned. So I asked that they just bring us fresh towels, which they did promptly. We went out for dinner and when we returned at 11:30 pm, our room had been cleaned but they had left our room door slightly cracked. Nothing was taken but it wasn’t a great feeling coming back to an unlocked room. The area around Times Square has gotten kind of rough with lots of homeless sleeping on the sidewalks near the hotel. Not much the AC can do about that but be aware if you stay in the Times Square area.

title: Amazing NYC trip
text: Every single staff member was phenomenal in making this a great trip!  From making meal recommendations to ensuring a smooth stay while in NYC. Would recommend this hotel for other guests who want an exceptional NYC stay.

title: Great location and building.  The rest not so much.
text:
The hotel sits in a prime location, and the building and rooms are very nice.  Unfortunately this is where Marriott gave up.

Check in was a nightmare.  I arrived in the morning after a red eye flight.  The front desk informed me that they had no rooms available due to the hour. Fair enough, it was a bit early, I forgave this even though they knew we would be early.  They said it would be roughly 45 minutes and that breakfast was available in "the restraunt" (more on this later).  I asked if it was complimentary due to the delay, the answer was no.

After roughly 45 minutes of trying not to pass out in the lobby a large group of 20 people walks in looking to check in.  Surprise!  They have no delay and keys are handed out to the whole group!  I walk up, and ask for my room key, and am told it isn't available yet.  I get angry.  They say the previous group "booked yesterday".  My reservation was 3 days old.  I ended up waiting almost 2 hours falling asleep in the lobby before a room was provided.  Not a good start.

The hotel restraunt, that is literally in the lobby, with signs in the elevators and appears on the hotel website, "isn't part of the hotel".  If you are a Marriott rewards member you will receive no discounts, benefits, and collect no points for eating there.  Of course they don't point this out until you pay.

The rooms a very nice looking, and quiet, (as quiet as Times Square can be).  The beds seem to be aimed at Asian clientele as they are much like beds found at hotels in Japan.  They are basically futons, very firm.  If that's your thing great.  Its not mine.

The next morning I got into the shower and found that there was no soap or shampoo.  This hotel has gone with the "three seashells" motifs where they have 3 large pumps in the shower to save money.  Thats fine, I actually like this.  No need to create more waste.  The problem here is that  for both the shampoo and soap pumps to be empty it means the cleaning staff haven't checked them in WEEKS.  This gives me pause about the cleanliness of the rest of the room.  If they aren't checking the soap for weeks how often is the bedding being changed?

title: AMAZING HOTEL GUEST EXPERIENCE ~ MAY 2022
text:
Upon arriving at the AC Hotel New York Times Square, I was greeted with the best front desk team. They were welcoming, had big smiles, quickly assisted with my reservation and made me feel like a valued Marriott Bonvoy member. My family had 2 rooms for the entire week and each time we traveled through the lobby, Will M., Ricardo and/or Davon were so gracious, always extending themselves for whatever we needed (directions, restaurant referrals, rooftop drink tickets, bottles of water and on and on). 
They were thoughtful, kind and considerate. The training they received by General Manager Glenda Gomez was spot on. She, too, was warm and generous, taking many of our graduation photos in the beautiful lobby.  You could tell she loves her job and this property.
This is our new hotel of choice in New York City. Looking forward to the next visit!

title: Promises made but never carried kept
text:
The following is an update to my original review for a one night stay back on April 16  (confirm 99093774). Our confirmed reservation was a room with a balcony. Since the current guest had a late check out and due to our needing the room to get ready for my daughter's engagement party, we had no choice but to downgrade our room. Priscilla at the front desk was apologetic that this happened and was doing everything possible to make things right. Even though a downgrade, it was a very nice room (clean, large windows overlooking city).  Due to the mishap with our originally confirmed room, Priscilla as well as the front desk manager indicated that they would be depositing additional Bonvoy points (in addition to the standard 500 points you get as a Lifetime member) to my Bonvoy account for the inconvenience. This promise was repeated not once but twice at check in as well as at check out.  It has now been seven weeks and nothing.  No response from the hotel.  The Bonvoy desk simply states that they are looking into it with no follow through.  In summary, don't offer something to your guest if you are  not going to follow through.  
 We are now The rAdditionally, she spoke to her manager who indicated that they would compensate this mishap with added points to the Bonvoy account. In summary, a great hotel with front desk personnel who really seem to care. Thank you Priscilla.

title: We love it!!!
text: What a marvelous experience at this hotel!  Beautiful lobby and areas, modern rooms, perfect location and the best part: friendly and service oriented staff, especially Ricardo, Alex and Davon!! Beyond our expectations. Boqueria restaurant was very good also. Will stay here again!!

title: Gem
text:
If I could give this property 10 stars, I would. 
Situated in the heart of Times Square, this is a gem of a property.
we visited on Memorial Day weekend , the place was packed however the staff were extremely patient, super efficient and friendly.
The rooms are immaculate modern and clean. They are on the smaller side but it’s manhattan.
Parking is v close not an issue at all
The restaurant and the rooftop are both amazing with some really delicious food and innovative cocktails.

Once again, it’s the amazing hardworking staff at this property by just blew my mind away and I’m a titanium lifetime Marriott member.

Navendu Vyas

title: Uh, maybe not, next time
text: A friend and I stayed at the hotel when we were in town for a show and needed a place to stay after that. As a Marriott Rewards member, I thought it looked like a reasonable choice. I asked for a quiet room, but I wasn't reminded that we wouldn't be able to qualify for a room on a high enough floor to get reduced street noise and W. 40th Street can be a very busy, loud place to be. Why didn't the person suggest a room NOT on the street side? Oh, well. I had no issues with the desk staff, who seemed fine, except where it came to suggestions for a diner to eat breakfast. They seem only told to suggest their own in-hose restaurants. That's just wrong. And they have only 3 elevators which meant rather long waits to get to and from one's room. With all the choices nearby, I would choose a different hotel next time.

title: Great Hotel!!
text: We booked our hotel 8 months prior to our trip to NYC and couldn't wait for this trip! The entire staff were SUPER helpful and really nice and accommodating. We aren't huge fans of the Times Square area, but based upon how great the hotel was, we'd most likely come back and stay just because of how much we liked the hotel! The view from our room on the 18th floor was beautiful, and their rooftop bar was gorgeous as well.  The only thing is I wish the rooftop bar was open later, but other than that I don't have one negative thing to say about the hotel or their staff!! Thank you AC Marriott for your hospitality and kindness!!

title: Great for a theater weekend.
text:
Modern and convenient hotel with 5 star service, but not prices.  Excellent for the theatre focused trips. 

We stayed in a balcony room for 2 nights.  Dayvon, the first person we encountered at the hotel gave us a warm and friendly greeting.  One of the most enthusiastic I’ve ever experienced.  And all other staff we encountered exuded the same friendly traits.  

Our room, while a little spartan, was nice sized, clean and lacked for nothing.   We liked the fridge; higher quality than most hotel fridges. 

The balcony was well furnished and we were impressed with the live boxwood shrub. We enjoyed it both morning and night.  Even had some NYC friends up for a drink.  I wish it was south-facing, but the hotel’s location would  not allow it.  We were happy to have gone for the upgraded room.  

We enjoyed a pre-theatre drink in the 20th floor lounge which had  a nice buzz.  Again, friendly and efficient in spite of a good crowd.  

The lobby was attractive and stylish.  

All-in-all, a great experience and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.

title: Customer service
text: Firstly the worst front desk I have ever encountered with, The staff in the morning are so unprofessional and pure rude. They are just standing there on their phones, talking with their other colleges without wanting to help guests, ignoring their presence. Per check out I encountered with Tatiana Davon and I believe Joshua not sure if I am spelling there names properly as I am walking towards the front desk to check out they were just talking, laughing and acting as if I didn't exist. They were extremely rude making faces when I asked for my receipt. Then she gives me my receipt with such a bad attitude and sarcastic, literally just throwing it at me. I felt so  disrespected and uncomfortable this is not the type of morning you want to have and definitely not the type of customer service you give to guests. I left with a very bad experience. Not wanting to come back. It's the little things that make a huge difference. should consider who you hire for the front desk. It's a very bad look. I usually don't make a big deal but for being in the hospitality business I would never make a guest feel this way. Horrible check out.  Not visting ever again.

title: Love this property
text: Always my choice in NY. Hotel is clean,  rooms are nice and staff is great.  Special shout out to Nick and Devon at the front desk for going above and beyond on my recent stay. Castell is good for a light bite with a cool vibe and location is perfect. Close to everything.

title: Great place to stay
text: Have visited NYC many times (husband is from Long Island) and stayed at lots of hotels.  This one was one of the best. Came for a weekend trip with my sisters and our stay here was fantastic.  The staff was welcoming and accommodating with all of our requests (lots of coffee lol).  The room was spotless with plenty of towels.  Rooftop bar is a really cool place to have a drink.  Whenever we left or returned to the hotel the front desk staff asked us how everything was and always with huge smiles.  The location is perfect.  Also, the pillows were the most comfortable I have ever slept on I any hotel.  When we come back, we will definitely stay here.

title: AC Hotel (Times Square) - Never Again!!!
text: First, I arrived to check-in around 3:30pm Saturday afternoon, but was told that my room was not available yet and it'd take about one hour before it would be ready. This forced my husband & I to wander the city with no destination with our two daughters (ages 6 & 2). When we were finally able to enter our room over an hour later, it was decent with a view of the Empire State building on the 19th floor. Later that evening my daughters and I attended a show & upon our late return, the fire alarm was ringing while the 3 main elevators were completely shut down & I had to wait in the lobby for 45 minutes until the fireman came to inspect the building.  After a LONG day, with a wet/hungry toddler my patience had worn thin. I needed my room without another delay! My husband, staying sleeping at the hotel to prepare for his night shift, was completely disturbed by all the alarm bells. His rest was broken. Once I got to my room my 6 year old discovered a pair of glasses under the bed that didn't belong to anyone in my party. This made me feel that perhaps the room wasn't fully inspected or cleaned from the last guest. It caused immediate anxiety especially surrounding the Covid issue & cleanliness in common areas. In addition after this exhausting day the body-wash & hair conditioner dispenser was empty. This just added to the frustration I was already feeling about the quality of service here at this hotel. Overall, It was the worst hotel stay I've had at any Marriott hotel.

title: New York Experience
text: This hotel was amazing.  Friendly and helpful.  The hotel manager Ricardo was wonderful.  Rooms were very nice and overlooked the New York Times. Large floor to ceiling windows and convenient to everything in Times Square.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Je recommande !
text: Tout était parfait. Je recommande ! Les gens sont gentils, petites bouteilles d’eau le matin à l’accueil, les chambres sont propres, lits confortables. Nous étions au 7e et n’avons pas été dérangé par le bruit. Je reviendrai au AC assurément!

title: Nice Hotel but Rude Housekeeping Staff
text: The hotel was in the perfect location in Times Square area with the subway stop just half a block away from the hotel. It is also close to all the Broadway Shows and Penn Station which takes you to Newark Airport (EWR). The rooms were nice inside and were clean when I arrived. However, the next day I requested for housekeeping because there were things missing such as toilet paper and a bath mat and the housekeeping ignored my request and took my tip and then left the old bed sheets on top of my bed. The front desk was super nice in accommodating my early check in request and late check out since I had a flight coming in on a red eye from the West Coast. However, when I checked out the worker said they would take my keys and check me out but they never formally checked me out which was ridiculous. Luckily, I called at the airport to confirm if they checked me out since I never received the email confirming I checked out and they informed me that they never checked me out but wouldn't charge me extra since it was their error. The view that I got from my room facing the back was horrible as it is facing a garment factory.

title: One Washcloth
text: My daughter and I checked in a few hours ago. About to shower and notice only 1 washcloth. Like, why?? Even for 2 people..can we get at least 4? I’m that one who always travels with washcloths. Don’t even wanna buzz front desk about this, as some things u just figure will come w the room.

title: Ambassador
text:
Excellent location. Nice rooms. 

Davon, at the front desk was super helpful.  Switched my room to one with two beds vice one bed and was very friendly and gracious.  Gave me good advice about this part of NYC. He was great.

I will come back!

title: Great Hotel - Great location - Fabulous Staff
text:
This hotel is a 2 minute walk from the hustle of Times Square yet it's set back from a lot of the noise and crowds.
The rooms are modern, clean and the lobby staff are wonderful. They helped us with general questions, couldn't do enough for us and greeted us every time we entered of left the hotel. Ok the view from our room wasn't breathtaking as we overlooked the office block across the street but we were barely in the room so it really didn't matter. There is an amazing rooftop bar which is one of the nicest spaces in the evening!
A great smaller hotel which has the personal touch with a fantastic atmosphere.

title: Great Hotel in Times Square
text:
Have to say great hotel in the area! it is close to Times Square yet far from the crowds. It is also close to a subway stn. It has a restaurant and rooftop lounge. But lots of food stores around the hotel.

The room is big. The shower and toilet is modern  but no tub. It has all the amenities that a traveller needs. 

Have to commend the staff for assisting us. Special mention to Nick (Frontdesk) who checked us in and Joshua who helped us with our luggages.

Overall, my family enjoyed our stay! Hope to be back again soon!

title: Promises not kept
text:
Josh was great. Otherwise requested early checking received confirmation and did not happen. Requested house keeping did not happen. Requested coffee got it no cups. 

Josh came through. Got us a car excellent service

title: Love it here!
text: Davon was/is the absolute best. Great at accommodating us during the checkin process. So friendly & helpful. He honored all of our last minute request. Made changes quickly when added. Will definitely be back because of him.

title: Warm Welcome from Davon
text: We are in town for my friend’s 30th birthday and we had the warmest welcome from Davon. I cannot express how happy he made her. He was so kind and welcoming, making great small talk. He even eased her mind about turning 30 with some kind words. Highly recommend this staff, especially Davon.

title: Best Hotel for incredible customer Service!
text: Wow!  What an amazing staff!!  If you are looking for impeccable customer service within a classy and super chic hotel then this is IT!  I am staying on a business trip had a concerns about billing to my corporate account and Davon at the front desk was honestly truly amazing in helping me get my billing and room situated with zero hiccups.  He is extremely friendly and accommodating. Upon entry through the front doors you will be greeted and acknowledged, offered water and asked if you need any assistance.  This is truly a TOP notch employee and I will continue booking with this hotel for future business trips to NYC. Thank you AC Hotel!!!

title: Best front desk assistance ever
text:
Best front desk ever

Davon (I apologize profusely if I mis-spell his name)is the greatest front desk clerk I have ever dealt with.  I had a strange request in order to make right a wrong, and he bent over backwards out of the kindness of his heart and helped me out.

As the front desk is often the face of a hotel, all I can say is you cannot go wrong with a hotel with people at the front desk like Davon!

title: Come for the location, then again & again for the amazing staff
text: We have stayed here multiple times and the experience has been consistently outstanding.  The hotel is clean, modern, centrally located with easy subway access and reasonable (for NYC) parking nearby. We keep returning because of the service.  This hotel has service on par, or better than an Autograph or JW Marriott.  There's nothing better than arriving after a few hours of travel to receive a friendly welcome and attention from Ricardo and Alex. For our regular visits to NYC we never look around for hotels, because it just doesn't get better than this.  See you next month!

title: Coolest Hotel in TSQ-rooftop bar superb!
text: The staff is amazing-Roberto always lending a hand.  Sara in sales and Jackie so kind and helpful.  This is becoming my second home already, planning to make regular business trips and stay here.  Great meeting room downstairs and Boqueria offers catering and delicious tapas at night.  Highlight: Nigel Barker suite and rooftop bar -stupendous.  Make sure to book an outside table ahead of time.  ***** five star experience!  Thanks to their outstanding team!

title: Great location! Amazing staff
text: Took my daughter and her friend to NYC for her 18th birthday. This hotel was fabulous. You can’t beat the location. It’s close to everything-Times Square, theater, 15 minute walk to Rockefelle. Great restaurants nearby. And the staff was fantastic. Davon greeted us with the best energy and smile and was fun to talk to throughout our stay. Alice was super helpful and delightful. I’ve stayed at numerous hotels in NYC throughout the years and will definitely be back to the AC. Room was spacious and quiet (we were on the 8th floor) The girls even commented on how nice the bathroom was. The rooftop bar was lovely as well

title: Great Hotel with the most Amazing staff in NYC!
text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  The staff goes above and beyond all the while being so nice and gracious.  I have stayed in 1000s of hotels and this has to be the nicest, most accommodating, and professional staff I have ever come across.  The rooms are a great size (especially for NYC).  We came for an overnight trip and will definitely be back.  I wish the ratings went higher than 5!  They deserve more! It is close to the port authority, a few minutes walk from Penn, and a many subways right out the front door.  Great location!  The rooftop lounge was perfect for an end of the evening cocktail.

title: Amazing staff and lovely hotel.
text: Lovely hotel and a good value.  Great location on Times Square.  The staff is Amazing.  Very friendly and hospitable the minimize I walked in.  I watched them interacting with many guests while waiting to check in.  They were making sure everyone was good and taking care of their needs.   Davon went out of his way to make my stay great!   Much appreciated!

title: awesome stay
text: This hotel was beautiful, clean and a perfect location. The room was larger than expected and the bed was super comfortable. We booked a "high floor" and got floor 7, which felt like it was still a lower level, but it was still quiet. There was parking about half a block away. Everyone at the front desk was super kind and helpful, and very friendly. I didn't want to leave, we had such a nice stay!

title: Disappointing for a 4 star hotel
text:
I've stayed in many three star hotels that were better than this hotel. 

In terms of things that were objectively bad: there was a missing picture in the room (just hooks sticking out the wall); the bedsheets were super thin; there were no glasses/cups (only two paper cups); the blind and curtain is the wrong way round (its not easy to use the blind for privacy with light because the curtain is in between the blind and the window); the heating/air conditioning was so loud (and the room got really hot without it on even though it was February); I found a dead fly by the window, a bug in the bathroom and my husband found a toothpick in the bed. 

To be fair to the hotel, I did request glasses and an additional comforter/duvet which they did bring me quickly but the glasses were dirty. 

The hotel is in a convenient location for sightseeing but there are so many other hotels around, I would pick a different one for next time. 

All in all, I was very disappointed.

title: weekend getawy
text: Ricardo was wonderful- very helpful. Room was clean. Requested glasses and brought quickly. lobby area was nice. Early check in was not available. 200 word minimum for this review is very annoying. I was happy enough said

title: Everything to Like
text: Beautiful hotel; excellent location; very clean; and the best staff overall I have seen in one place.  Every single staff member from the front desk to the rooftop bar was courteous, friendly, helpful, and performed their jobs particularly well.  An excellent recommendation for a restaurant for a large group was suggested and worked out very well for us.  They were all a pleasure, and the entire experience made for a really wonderful weekend.  Highly recommend and will go again.

title: Missing bathroom door in our room!
text: After the excellent reviews I read prior to booking here, I was shocked at the lack of customer service and attention to maintenance that we experienced while staying two nights. Our room was MISSING A BATHROOM DOOR.  Soon after checking in, I was sent a text to see how the stay was, and I explained how our room was missing the bathroom door and how it was not ideal and unexpected and received no response back. After an additional text that I received after check out encouraging a review on Trip Advisor, I texted back that I would be leaving a review on the missing bathroom door, lack of customer service after being notified of the missing bathroom door, and lack of room maintenance. I received plenty of responses then. Very disappointed because this was a weekend of auditioning for my daughter and this situation proved very awkward, inconvenient, and a lack of privacy coupled with zero timely responses to remedy the situation. In addition, the middle elevator in the lobby reeked of weed all day on Saturday (even while being double masked!). Will not stay here again and will not recommend to others.

title: Excellent stay
text: The location was great, the rooms were clean and the staff was so helpful and warm and kind.  They helped us find subway stops  and stored out bags after check out so we could shop and come back and get them!  Ricardo  greeted us at the door and helped us all weekend. I will stay here again!!!

title: Awesome hotel, Amazing staff and great midtown experience!
text:
Love the location of the AC hotel, From the moment me and my party entered the lobby, the staff was amazing, very accommodating! Gaby and Amanda went above and beyond! They provided excellent service for me and my party! I can’t say thank you enough to them, they helped get me and my party an awesome room with a great view and all the necessities we would need for this trip in New York City! They were very helpful and gave us the best tips and tricks to enjoy our time in the city! They of course gave us great food recommendations and fun activities to do in the city! I’ll definitely book this hotel again when I’m back in the city!  
The room was very clean and very spacious and accommodated everything we need for the whole week we were there! The beds were very comfortable and I sleep like a baby in them! 
The bar up on the 21st floor was very nice, and had a fanatic view of the city and the drinks were awesome!

title: Avoid this hotel
text: Had the worst experience at this hotel.  Was there for a quick weekend to see The Music Man with my 90 year old mother after I bought tickets in Nov '19. Tried to reach Marriott in advance numerous times to make this a special weekend- even stopped into the hotel in person in Nov ‘21 to talk to them directly when I was in town. They would not commit to a specific room until 48 hours prior to our stay. Room was average, view was marginal, I got stuck in an elevator and had to pull the emergency alarm.
