The worst was the lack of accommodations for my mother. The handicap accessible room had no bars for the toilet or shower (she had to use her walker to brace herself to use the toilet).. The rooftop bar made her wait with her walker while we tried to get a table Sat night. (There is no preferential treatment for guests who are actually staying in the hotel vs. just visiting the lounge.) We were finally seated.....outside under heat lamps in 10 degree weather. They moved us to an indoor table after I made it clear how bad our stay had been. All I received from Marriott by way of customer service were texts about “how sorry” they were about my experience. Can't wait for the automated response to this review from the hotel saying "We are sad to hear that our hotel did not meet your needs or expectations. Nonetheless, we are grateful for the opportunity to serve you." Will also be filing a complaint with the Dept of Justice about lack of compliance for a handicap accessible room.

title: Great Hotel in a great location
text: Stayed at this hotel for the weekend to see a show and have dinner.  Walkable to most everything in the theater district and very close to Bryant Park area.  Not Times Square really, which is great, because i'm not a fan of being in the heart of all of those lights.  We arrived at 5pm and our room still wasn't ready, but after about 30 minutes, was able to get in.  Small but modern room with a comfortable bed and linens.  Nice bright bathroom with nice shower.  Went to the restaurant in the lobby for a drink after dinner.  Was really impressed with the mixologists at the bar and the tapas looked amazing.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Hotel in  the Theater District yet Quiet,
text: From the moment we entered the lobby to when we left the staff could not have been more accommodating and friendly.  Even when they were busy and under pressure you they made you feel you were special and they were there to make sure your stay at the AC was going to be wonderful.  The room exceeded our expectations , very Euro modern, exceptionally clean with a great view of the skyline.   There also just couldn't be a better way to end an evening out on the town then having a cocktails out on their rooftop bar.  Though right in the Theater district the street is quiet. We will definitely will stay there again on our return trip to NY.

title: Close to the Bryant Park & Times Square
text: Spent Thanksgiving weekend at the AC Hotel.  Nice bar on top floor to have drinks.  Room was spacious and clean. If you go request a high floor to avoid hearing the street traffic.   My sister and brother in law were in the 7th floor and did not hear the noise like we did.   We stayed in the 2nd floor.   The restaurant Boqueria is connected to the hotel and we love tapas.  Staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

title: Nice Hotel, Quiet, Great Staff and Midtown View and Roof Top Lounge.
text:
The AC hotel in Midtown is conveniently located in Times Square Area with easy walking distance to the Theaters.   The staff were very friendly and supportive. Gabriella and the staff checked in with us daily to see if there was anything we required. 

We upgraded the room to a balcony view had a nice midtown City view. 

Roof top lounge - tapas style, Reservations recommended.
   

 Breakfast order from  the reastaurant, - like room service.  

 Easy walk to Grand Central station, the Edge in Hudson yards, Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathederal.   

We will be staying there again.

title: Holiday Family Trio
text: We loved the location, the hotel was just what was advertised.  Upstairs bar was a nice addition.  However, overall the staff made the difference.  Gabby and Melissa helped with logistics, subway directions and dinner reservations.  They made a good trip even better.

title: Amazing staff, spacious upscale room
text:
The ladies at the front were incredible, especially Tatiana, who held my room for me when I had left my baggage and got caught up with work & traveling.

Cannot say thank you enough. This and the room was really upscale, with all the necessities and comfort you would expect from a high end hotel.

title: Pas au niveau attendu, manque les basiques
text: Déçus car cet établissement est loin des standards de la chaîne. Même en tant que membre Élite Marriott nous avons eu du mal à obtenir une chambre propre et calme. La boquieria et le rooftop sont tjs pleins et n’appartiennent pas à l’hôtel ! :(

title: Okay, not what we’d expected
text:
It was a clean place to stay in a decent location. Other than the typical city noise, the hotel was fairly quiet. The people working here seem nice. But overall, the AC hotel was not what we’d expected. 

The minimalist decor was so basic we didn’t have enough space to hang our clothes on the rack. 

The only option for food in the morning is “breakfast to go” from  Boqueira. They don’t serve patrons in the restaurant until 12 noon. We wish the website had clearly stated their new hours and policy, as it would’ve influenced our hotel choice. We enjoy being served breakfast while on vacation, on premises. So this was a big take-away for our family. 

We also weren’t informed the room wouldn’t be cleaned during our 4-day stay, So we had to stop at the front desk to request fresh towels. At that time, we were told we could request for the room to be cleaned the next day…which we did. However when we arrived back to our room after a day out in the city, it hadn’t been touched. It was disappointing they did not meet our request.

Since it is so basic, it’s a good place to stay for a single night. But at nearly $400/night, the room rate  isn’t basic! So I don’t plan on booking the AC brand in the future. My teenage son even said he wishes we’d stayed at one of the prior hotels we have visited in the city.

title: Great Location and hotel
text:
We like AC hotels and this one ended up being a good choice due to location, price, and service.

Location: literally 2 blocks from Times Square and about 4 blocks from Broadway. Hotel on 40th and our plays were on 44th, 46th. Shops, restaurants and entertainment all around. Central Park walkable but nice little jaunt

Price: pretty good for NYC

Rooms: nice size and get an upgrade up possible if you’re a Marriott member. Balcony was huge

Bar: upstairs bar was fun; expensive cocktails but good food and didn’t keep us from going back 3 times

Service: staff was helpful, courteous and can’t say a bad thing. 

Airport transportation: not here. I heard you Call a day or two ahead and they can help you arrange transportation from airport. Probably around $70 but worth it versus Uber/Lyft. We used for ride back to LaGuardia

Only con is lack of coffee in lobby but I don’t blame them. Starbucks and Dunkin’ Donuts less than blick away.

Highly recommend hotel for your stay especially if you’re visiting for Broadway.

title: Ricardo made my birthday!
text: Our entire hotel stay was wonderful, but the highlight was being greeted by Ricardo when I first arrived. I was wearing a tiara (friends gave it to me before I left for nyc) and Ricardo asked if it was my birthday. When I said yes, he excused himself and returned with a box of chocolates and a delicious bottle of wine. He made me feel incredibly special. Thank you, Ricardo and AC for making my day special!

title: Ac Hotel Times Square great visit!
text:
I visited NYC this week and has a fantastic visit - many thanks to Gabriela Carrasquillo!  I have been at the hotel before on business and have always received great service, but when Gabriela found out that I had my Daughter with me as well as  her boyfriend to celebrate my daughter’s birthday, she really went out of her way for us (also because it was the first trip to New York for her boyfriend). She checked is in quickly with a smile as always, ordered us up extra towels, and was even able to get us a great room high up with a city view. This made such a big impact on the kids that they asked if all hotel workers were as nice as Gabriela. I assured them that most are very nice but she is special. She even checked in on us each day to make sure everything was going well and if we had any needs. 
The overall hotel experience was great everything worked well and we had a wonderful week in New York and always had a great room to come back to!

Looking forward to our next trip!

title: Hotel needs more cleaning staff
text: Staff was okay but they need more management training and also hire more cleaning staff. I stayed here for 5 nights and requested the cleaning everyday and they just cleaned it once. I tried to request the service for all my stay since I did the check in and the receptionist told me I needed to request it everyday, which is ridiculous.

title: Perfect position
text: 45 minutes from JFK perfect position for getting about Manhattan a bit of engineering work going on as scaffolding about room(815) was right opposite the elevators but never heard no noise at all room very high standard not enough tea/coffee just called in at reception and ask they give you what you ask for really efficient and friendly

title: Nice Hotel with a great staff
text: Spent two nights at the AC Hotel at 260 W 40th Street. Am a Marriott Hotel devotee but never stayed at one of their AC brand properties. Rooms are small but clean and adequate. The staff was great - attentive - smiling - helpful - responsive -- could not ask for more. Especially appreciated Ricardo who has been there since the day it opened. The rooftop tapas bar/restaurant was fun -- we were able to sit outside and enjoy the fresh air and the views - it is a small room so make a reservation. The larger restaurant on the ground floor has a Spanish flavored menu -- enjoyed a great meal at a reasonable cost after seeing a Broadway show.

title: rapport qualité prix décevant
text:
le mot qui me viens a l'esprit est BOF 
les + emplacement qui deviendra également un moins
literie confortable 
chambre relativement grande pour New York
bouteille d'eau a disposition du matin au d=soir dans le lobby 

les - emplacement extrêmement bruyant chambre au 5e étages j'avais pourtant demander une chambre en milieu ou hauteur a l'accueil mais la réceptionniste n'en  a rien eu a faire surement le faite d'être européen.
travaux dans la rue 
ménage inexistant le covid a bon dos que celui ci ne soit pas fait soit mais des serviettes propres tout les jours serais un minimum et que la direction ne m ecrive pas en me disant que l'on peut les demandés car a + de 300 $ la nuit ............
la lumiere du couloir qui passe sous la porte de la chambre mettre une serviette sinon réveil matinal garantie.
bref ne vaut pas les + de 300 $ la nuit pour les prestations proposer.

title: Wonderful place to stay in NY Times Square.
text: I booked this hotel from 12/04-12/06/2021 for my husband's 50th Birthday. We stayed on the 19th floor with a city view and a Balcony. I must say the staff was very nice and accommodating. JOSH is the best! He brought our luggage to our room and even upon check out he kept our bags secure while we went out to get food before leaving. SHAMAR also would periodically text me to see if i needed anything. I must say the website hasn't been updated and I thought they had valet parking and due to Covid, that option isn't available but their is a parking structure very close by and the hotel will stamp it for you and you get a discounted fee for parking there. They have a nice restaurant attached and rooftop lounge if you don't want to leave the hotel for food. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Minimalist Hotel few blocks away from Times Square
text:
Stayed here last week for 3 nights. Was very disappointed with the concept of AC Hotels as this was the first time in this chain and is the worst among the Marriott properties we have stayed in the past 10 years. 

Location: 
Midtown, Close to Time Square. A few of blocks away. 
There is construction going around the area and it takes forever for the Uber to get here. Give yourself atleast 10-15 minutes even if the uber app say 4 minutes.
The neighborhood seemed quite dodgy in the evening.

Service: 

-Staff: Very Polite Staff at the reception. They provide bottled water etc. 
- Housekeeping:  No housekeeping service unless you stay more than 5 nights.  New policy. 

Rooms:
The rooms are really small  and the bathrooms are even smaller.  The closet is an open steel rack all cramped up. The pictures provided don't represent the  actual dimensions of the room.  No noise cancellation between rooms. You can hear drunk people shouting in the middle of the night.

Price: 
Very expensive ( $371/night ) and not worth it.  

 Will not  recommend  it .

title: Amazing Gem in the heart of mid-town Manhattan
text:
What I love about this property is the top notch staff including Gabby and general manager Shamar. Gabby's interactions with me were helpful and kind. I watched her interact with a airline flight crew leaving the hotel. All of them knew her name and what she does for us as guests makes us feel welcome and appreciated. That's huge as a customer! 
The location is perfect for access to Broadway to catch a show and the MTA subway. I also liked the 2 restaurant options in house along with the ability to purchase black car service to the various NYC area airports.

title: Updated review
text: An update to Jelianne Kelly review. After our bag was given to someone else by mistake the staff had done nothing but to turn things around. We get it, things happens, we are all human and make mistakes and now we have the bag back and we can think clearly and this will be more of a neutral review for the hotel. The staff is really friendly and helpful, especially Channel who has gone above and beyond for us during this stay. The hotel has two restaurants on site, and they are delicious! The hotel is located close to everything in time square and if you prefer to take the subway there’s one right around the corner. The rooms are clean and the bed is very comfortable.

title: Missing bag
text: I checked in online saying that I was arriving at 1200, got here and they said that the room is not ready and that check in is not until 1600… I called around 1530 asking if the room is ready and they said not yet… we’ll someone texted 5 min later saying that the hotel staff gave our bag to them and they were at the airport … so great way to start a trip to New York with no clothes… thank God the other couple wanted  their bag so they are coming back to give our bag back and to retrieve their bag…. Maybe this is a special treat for platinum members

title: Great Team!
text:
My partner and I took a recent trip to New York and stayed at the AC Time Square. The whole staff is inviting - including Luis from the Engineering team. The rooms were clean, since we are from Florida the views are great, location is convenient, and the food is delicious! Thank you for everything and we look forward to our next stay. 

PS. Their hotel also smells SO good!

title: Great staff!!!
text: My husband recently surprised me with a weekend trip to New York! I was super excited as this was our first trip after the pandemic. I felt super comfortable staying in this hotel, every staff member had a face mask and the cleanliness was impeccable. Soon as we entered the elevator we were greeted by one of the staff members. my husband had our luggages and was struggling a bit. This staff member was kind enough to help us get to our room as well as help my husband and I with our things. The room we had was clean and spacious! We did have issues with our tv. When we called downstairs for help we were told one of the engineers would come up to help. It literally took just  a couple of minutes from when we called and the engineer arrived (wonderful service!) to our surprise it was the same friendly face we met in the elevator. Luis was the staff member in the elevator who left just a great impression on us. He took just a few minutes to fix our tv. He was super helpful and friendly and even gave us wonderful recommendations for restaurants!  My husband and I were left with such great impressions of the hotel and staff. Thank you AC hotel! And shout out to luis!

title: Outstanding experience !
text: Typically when in New York I stay at the Sofitel.  However as it was Thanksgiving weekend the Sofitel was booked and we found the AC Marriott Times Square to be a more then able stand in.  The rooftop tapas bar and restaurant has its own unique New York vibe, staffed Abily by friendly front desk attendants and at the bar by Xavier and Wilson.  We all know that Bellman rule the world in New York City, and Ricardo is no exception at the AC Marriott.  Friendly attentive and highly knowledgeable about the hotel and local environs Ricardo is a pleasure to interact with.  We highly recommend the AC Marriott Times Square.

title: Our stay at the AC Hotel
text: Perfect location and extremely friendly, the hotel is very clean and all staff are very welcoming. We particularly loved Josh and all his help! We would definitely return again when we return to New York

title: NYC friends trip
text: Will definitely stay at this hotel again, this hotel is smack down in the middle of everything subways lines, Times Square and a bunch of good restaurants and tourists attractions. Tatianna and Amanda were very helpful during check-in time!

title: Wonderful Wedding Weekend
text: We stayed at the AC for our wedding weekend in October, as did many of our guests.  Our wedding took place  at the hotel's Castell Rooftop Lounge (for which there will be a separate review). Everyone at the hotel was helpful, courteous and professional.  Check-in and check-out were efficient.  The public areas of the hotel were clean, and COVID protocols were followed, with little or no inconvenience to guests.  Our room, while on the small side, was clean and amenity-filled.  Moreover, it was delightfully quiet, even though it was steps from Times Square. It also had a balcony, which was delightful.   I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Just awright
text: Booked this hotel after seeing the tout on the rooftop lounge.  After arriving at the hotel we were informed the lounge was "unavailable" due to private party.  Well you should tell people this prior to booking for that date if you are so proud of it.  Also, elevators are gimmiky and don't work properly.  As a Platinum member breakfast is typically a complimentary benefit. Not here though.  In fact the woman at checkin matter of factly told us "No we don't do that here."  Since no housekeeping is available we called down to get additional coffee and cups.  Never got them!  Paper cups?  GIMME A BREAK.  Put it on your website!!! There are much better hotels here for this price.  Stay elsewhere.

title: Amazing stay
text: Thank you ocean and amanda for the wonderful check in service. Keep up the good work. I will definately be back…. Loved where the location of the hotel. Everything was pretty close by. My girl and her son enjoyed everything from the hotel.Definately be back

title: Location is everything
text:
The location is near any subway line you’ll need during your stay and a metro station is literally steps from the hotel lobby.  

Rooms were clean and spacious. Bottled waters were available in the in-room fridge and were also available at the front desk upon request.  Hotel service was very good.  My only complaint was the strong smell of marijuana permeating in the hall and in our room the first night.  The manager on duty was very helpful in remedying the problem and I was happy with the attention she gave the matter.

title: If I could give three and a half stars…
text:
I’ve stayed at AC hotels before and I quite enjoy them, but this one just didn’t live up to expectations.
- the rooms were supposedly new or renovated.  Yet the wallpaper in my room was scratched snd peeling in parts.
- both the lobby and my bedroom had an overwhelming scent of cologne.  Almost like they were masking some other smell,
- front desk staff totally disinterested and not engaged.

On the upside ,the food and drink at Boqueria and the roof lounge was really good.

title: Great Staff, Location, spacious rooms
text: The AC Hotel Times Square is a great new modern hotel in a perfect location. The rooms are spacious and well designed. The rooftop lounge was a fun place to hangout, with a friendly wait staff. The front desk staff were just amazing,  they went way beyond to be friendly,  helpful and accommodating! I look forward to returning!

title: Beautiful, modern hotel near Times Square
text:
Beautiful, modern hotel located close to port authority, Penn station/MSG, and Times Square. Room was clean and comfortable. On-site restaurants had excellent food and drinks (Spanish style). Good customer service from front desk staff. 

The only issues we experienced were 1. Hotel phone message says hotel has valet but there wasn’t. 2. There was confusion at checkin about the package we booked and how to honor the food/beverage included with it.

title: Great hospitality, will be back
text:
Greta hospitality over Halloween weekend from this team. I am a rewards member and was created at checkin. I also got an upgrade to a higher floor and away from the elevator which was a plus. 

Our first night we had dinner at Boqueria, but make sure to make reservations. We were lucky to get a seat at the bar, but will make reservations the next time. The food and cocktails were amazing and it kicked off a great trip. 

We had a few maintenance issues and everything was attended to when asked without any question. While the hotel is located a few blocks off Times Square but the rooms quiet and we didn’t hear a lot of the commotion, just normal NYC sound. 

Thanks again for a great trip and I will be back!

title: Must stay in NYC
text: Excellent hotel in the heart of Times Square. Nicely appointed room with great views. Dont expect a ton of room - it IS NYC after all - but the space is used wisely and you have everything you need to be comfortable. The workers are kind and always are sure to say hello and good evening as you come and go. Great stay if you are seeing a show - just a few block walk. The rooftop bar was great and the restaurant, boqueria, was also really good too. Would highly recommend!

title: Must book hotel w/ amazing hospitality.  Thank you Marlene and Melissa!
text: Amazing location, great service, clean rooms, solid gym, then you have Castell  a cool rooftop bar on 21st floor and a delicious hopping tapas restaurant Boqueria attached on the lobby level.  Marlene Caro Operations Mgr and Melissa provided a superb check in experience.  They are both very friendly and attentive to anything you need.  Lastly, for being soooo close to Times Square it is extremely quiet.

title: YOU SAVED MY LIFE
text: My flight from JFK was three hours late and I couldn’t take a train to Westchester so I knew the AC hotel because I go to dinner at Boqueria so I went to the front desk and there was this really tall elegant gentleman his name is ocean and he made it happen and he took care of me and I hope management hires more elegant patients and eloquence employees such as him.

title: Bonvoy Program, beware buying points
text:
I recently wanted to subsidize my points by purchasing additional for a hotel stay. I wanted to see what it would cost and clicked "buy points". There was no summary, no notice of cost, no confirmation, it just bought points and reserved my room. I paid &300  for points, used 50,000 total for a $170 room. The only way I knew the points costs was to look at my credit card statement. 
I requested a refund on the points as I would just pay for my room. They have refused any refund. 
Beware. 
Generally, since going to Bonvoy, the Marriott awards program is one of the worst in the industry.

title: Recently renovated, well run hotel
text: Recently renovated, upgraded to a room with a balcony.  Clean, well run, well sized. Very friendly service. Specifically, Gabriela was extremely helpful around my check in.  A good business budget option that is centrally located.  Solid hotel.

title: Great location and great staff!
text:
This hotel was perfect.  I loved the location.  It was a Times Square location, but just far enough away to make it a quiet hotel. The best thing about the hotel by far was the doormen, Alan and Roberto.  I could never say enough good things about them!  We picked this hotel with the hopes of having staff readily available to help us navigate NYC and hit the best places.  Alan and Roberto did not disappoint!  They even helped me download a subway and train app that helped us navigate transportation.  Roberto gave my little girl candy the first day and we got hugs on other days.  They remembered our names and knew what coffee we liked from the Dunkin a few doors down.  This was a girls trip with ages ranging from 9-45.  Roberto and Alan helped us navigate some things that were great for all ages.  

The location was fantastic.  We were within walking distance of so many things!  We walked to the Empire State Building, Macy’s, Tiffany’s, Rockefeller Plaza and were just down the street from Bryant Square Park.  We were also right by the Big Red Bus bus stop which got us all over the rest of the city from Central Park to the Freedom Tower. 

The beds were comfortable, the view was fantastic overlooking the New York Times and the bathroom was very spacious!  This room was surprisingly large for New York City. 

All the staff were very accommodating from the front desk to maintenance and housekeeping.  Next time I am New York this will definitely be the place I stay.  I can’t wait to go back and see Roberto and Alan :)

title: AC Times Square
text: I love AC hotels.  I'm particularly fond of this one because it's just blocks away from the theatre district.  I was in town and chose to stay at this particular hotel due to positive experiences at other AC properties.  The staff went above and beyond to exceed my expectations, whether it was having a room ready a couple of hours prior to check in time or arranging transportation to the airport after my departure.  My room was spotless and felt as if it had been throughly cleansed which is always a good thing.  I slept like a baby on the plush mattress.  It was a perfect oasis in the middle of packed Times Square.  I'll definitely be paying them another visit when I'm in NYC.

title: Clean, modern, FAST Wi-Fi.
text:
Clean, modern and comfortable hotel in a good location a couple of blocks away from Times Square. 
Good sound proofing so it is super quiet from outside noise although my room was facing a semi abandoned warehouse building so it was probably going to be quiet anyway! 
Probably the fastest Wi-Fi I’ve ever had in a hotel!
I would happily stay here again.

title: La ville qui ne dort jamais
text:
10 jours de rêve,  majestueux, grandiose la mégapole en elle-même ce suffit, l’hôtel est vraiment à la hauteur de Time square. La vue de la chambre est époustouflante les prestations à l’intérieur de celle-ci sont digne d’un palace le service en chambre est extrêmement rapide et du La vue de la chambre est époustouflante les prestations à l’intérieur de celle-ci sont digne d’un palace le service en chambre est extrêmement rapide et d’une qualité indéniabe
Un rêve à concrétiser tous les ans

title: Great sanctuary in Midtown.
text: This is a terrific hotel.  Rooms are good size for Manhattan.  They are simply but sensibly appointed, with a very modern almost Scandinavian style including wood floors.   Wall to ceiling windows with some nice views if you are facing 40th Street.  But the real strength of this hotel is the staff — consistently kind, helpful, and seem genuinely pleased to work there.  Everyone was great, from the security to the desk team go housekeeping.  What a pleasant addition to the midtown hotel scene and the Marriott family.    Thank you AC New York Times Square.

title: Nice Modern Hotel in Times Square Area
text: So this hotel offered us affordable hotel rates with modern rooms albeit smallish rooms. The hotel lobby had a restaurant(Boqueria) and a rooftop bar which was beautiful. Since it is in close proximity to Times Square it allowed us to cover easily places for us to go within a short walking distance. Always a plus when you can skip the Ubers or the subway system. Highly recommend. Next time I want a balcony room though.

title: Wonderful Experience & Great Staff
text:
This is an excellent hotel. From the moment we checked in, everyone we interacted with who worked at the property was friendly and eager to help. What stood out the most is that they took the time to put up AMAZING birthday decorations in the room that truly made our celebration special!!! The messaging feature on the app was also helpful and everything we requested was received promptly. The room is a great size, the amenities are wonderful, and Boqueria was also great (especially the margaritas). I was so impressed and would absolutely stay here the next time I'm in the city. The location is great -- the subway station is less than a block away. 

Thank you to the team for an amazing time!

title: Wonderful Customer Service along with Modern Room
text: This hotel had it all.  From wonderful customer service to modern decor, my stay was made comfortable and pleasant.  Ricardo made my daughter and me feel welcome and the rest of the staff followed suit.  The receptionist on my arrival was able to quickly check me in and provided me with all the information that I needed to have a great stay.  The receptionist on my departure was wonderful as well (I believe her name was Laura).  Altogether, my stay was outstanding and I will stay again on my next trip to New York.

title: Best staff - Ricardo is the MAN
text:
We arrived at the hotel and asked about parking 
- Ricardo said - no valet due to COVID but pointed us in the right direction.  
- Before parking we had to unload our stuff onto a troll - Ricardo was the one to get the trolly and help us get the bags to our room.
- heading out for dinner - Ricardo pointed us in the right direction as we were walking (in the rain) to our restaurant.
- back from dinner and Ricardo greets us with the biggest smile and warm welcome back ... Are we staying at an Air BNB, a Bed and breakfast?  He is so caring and always available.
Last day... we need a trolly to get our bags to the lobby and get our parking ticket validated - YOU GUESSED it - RICARDO is at our hotel room door with the validation stamp AND the trolly.  He is a gem and makes this hotel have the character and charm it offers.  I strongly encourage you to go and stay here, meet him and say hello!  He is from a multi- generation family of hospitality workers and he is amazing which made the AC an amazing place to stay!

title: Nice, Modern Rooms
text: I love the rooms in this hotel. They are a nice size for NYC / Manhattan, bigger than most Manhattan hotels. It's also a fantastic location. It's so convenient if you're there for theater or business in Times Square or Midtown. I would stay here again.

title: We have nice time at AC hotel
text: Me and my friend stay at AC hotel at time square.  The hotel is nice and clean and the staffs are very professional and friendly especially Ricardo.  Anytime we go NYC we are staying at AC hotel . Thanks Ricardo

title: KID-FRIENDLY, MOM AND DAD APPROVED
text: The staff was amazing! I am terrible with names so if I forget anyone I'm sorry, but everyone was great from the bellman, to the guest service associates to the lobby attendant. When we arrived, they let our kids pick out a snack from the market and truth be told, they let them pick out snacks a few more times. (Don't mean to get you in trouble Jonathan Fabietti) The bellman new the fastest end easiest way to the Statue of Liberty ferry, they recommended the best restaurants, and were genuinely excited to hear our kids tell them about their day when we got back each night. The room was super clean and PITCH DARK at night. We cranked the AC and slept like babies. The restaurant on the lobby level was delicious and the rooftop bar was amazing. We could not have been happier!  Thank you Shanel, Jon, Melissa and D-Man!

title: Solid Hotel
text: I enjoyed my stay here.  It was comfortable and quiet.  The restaurant downstairs is great - and the rooftop bar was awesome (besides giving a time limit as to how much time you can stay).  Only reason for 4 stars is that the AC unit was SO noisy!  It sounded like it was huffing and puffing.  I would stay here again.  Roomy for a NYC hotel.

title: Buen hotel pero no el entorno
text: La ubicacion del hotel es buena si uno busca estar cerca de muchos de los atractivos de Manhatan, pero el entorno actualmente no es muy bueno, muy ruidoso y desordenado. El hotel es sencillo pero comodo y su punto alto es la atencion de las personas de la recepcion, muy amables y siempre pendientes de las necesidades de los huespedes. Tiene un restaurant en planta baja y un bar en la terraza muy lindo pero de precio elevado.

title: The best bell hop ever!
text: Ricardo the bell hp was amazing from day one. Stored our bags like a champ, was always kind, went out of the way to get us a shuttle. Friendly, attentive, and went over the top to assist. The hotel was a great location in Midtown!

title: Five stars 🌟 🌟 🌟🌟🌟
text: This hotel was amazing! Dixon (Security) was the first person I came in contact with, and his level of customer service and professionalism was above and beyond. He was very genuine, and easy to speak to.  Jonathan the front desk supervisor was phenomenal. He was very well spoken, and hooked up my lady with a bottle of wine as a complimentary service because it was her birthday. He sent security to the room immediately with a bottle opener, and the level of service was so fast and on point. Everyone including the bellman, made our stay wonderful. Erica the front desk agent was very kind, and friendly. The hotel is close to everything including time sq. I wil definitely stay again and recommend this hotel to anyone. The roof bar was amazing as well.

title: Birthday weekend for Daughter
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this location.  Perfect loction if you are looking to stay steps away from Times Square.  The staff was phenomenal, especially Daniel.  Rooms were clean and requests were completed very timely.  Highly recommend!

title: Nice business travel experience, not perfect
text:
It’s been 17 months since I traveled for business.  Having visited NYC fairly often in the preceding 5 years, it was fittingly my first business travel destination.  I wanted to try a new Marriott property and the AC hit the mark in terms of location and amenities.

LOCATION
The AC is between 7th and 8th on 40th St.  This location is convenient and walkable to Times Square, theater, and most of the office locations in the Midtown area.  There are multiple restaurants at different levels of class nearby, and you can reach the hotel in about 30 minutes from LGA with normal / low traffic.

ROOMS
This brand seems like Marriott’s version of Starwood’s Westin: it’s more of a business traveler hotel in terms of minimalist luxury, function, amenities, and overall feel.  I advise choosing a high floor to avoid the typical NYC street noise, and it didn’t matter to me that I faced an industrial building.  The nightstands are ample for electronics, and feature AC as well as USB.  The telescoping reading light and bedside lamps are a nice touch.  King beds are offered, but with the standard mush pillows that collapse to the height of a credit card when you put weight on them.  The bed is still comfortable but not like Westin’s bed.  TVs in these rooms are huge, but this is fairly normal in modern times.  The desk is a bit small, and I’d like to see AC use a smaller space for coffee and sundries (perhaps move them to the small microwave and refrigerator area) to leave more room for a workspace.  However, offering a microwave and refrigerator (with a glass door) at all is welcomed.  There is no closet, but plenty of room for business casual wear for 4-5 days.  The bathroom has a rainhead shower that also offers a handheld (in typical Westin fashion), and the counter space is excellent.  I never felt cramped in this bathroom as the designers thoughtfully used a pocket door.  Great job, AC!

AMENITIES
A rooftop lounge sits on the 21st floor of this building, and I heard it had a great view and bar, but never went up there.  The restaurant selection seems a bit poor, as the only breakfast option currently offers “takeout”-type meals and no seated service.  While the lobby is quite large and nicely adorned, it seemed like an area where you weren’t ever really going to hang out.  The fitness center, which is the priority for me with business travel, is actually quite good, and especially good in comparison to some of the other nearby Marriott properties.  Moxy Times Square has good equipment but hardly any space, and Moxy Chelsea has plenty of space but a lack of equipment.  AC seems to have prioritized both.  There are kettlebells up to 50 lbs (HUGE bonus), 6 cardio machines, and plenty of floor space to use dumbbells, mats, and any other equipment.  There’s also a cable machine with several attachments, and a filtered water dispenser on the wall.

SERVICE
The front desk at the AC did a nice job being warm and welcoming, especially in the wake of COVID19.  It was so long since I had checked into a hotel for a work trip that I wasn’t sure what to expect, especially in one of the most restrictive cities still remaining in the US.  The staff was helpful, but the text messaging that the hotel initiated seemed to be largely ignored.  They contacted me first about 30 minutes after check-in, to which I replied with a request for more bottled water.  It never came.  I repeated the request the next morning, and although they responded, nothing happened yet again.  It wasn’t until I asked the front desk in person, and they immediately accommodated my request.  Front desk staff = good, digital staff = not so good.

OVERALL
I’ll definitely stay here again, especially to return to the same office, only 10 blocks away.  It’s not perfect, but the priorities for me are met.  It’s not quite like a Westin although it tries to be similar – better in some ways, not better in others.

title: Amazing Staff
text: My 12 night stay at the AC Marriott Hotel Times Square was awesome. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff goes above and beyond to be friendly and help with anything you could possibly need. The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming every single morning when we started our day, even going above and beyond to give us food suggestions during a busy check in. The manager (im sorry I never caught her name) was extremely friendly and I swear she was working every single time I went to the lobby the entire 12 days I was there. Johnathan at the front desk was beyond friendly and went out of his way to say hello and make sure we were okay and didn't need anything else. He even offered to book me a car to the airport on my last day, and called with a confirmation number within 5 minutes. The room was absolutely spotless and when we asked for it to be serviced it was done within the hour. I am a Hilton Dimond member and I can honestly say after this experience, I definitely need to switch to Marriott. Thank you AC Marriott Times Square Staff for making my first trip to New York a great one!

title: Wow Factor
text: I knew when I came to a hotel in the heart of NYC that it would be amazing. But I never expected the staff to go so far above an beyond. This is my second time here for business, an I cannot say WOW enough! Jonathan Fabietti has amazed me both times! I cannot thank you enough. Great hotel. Great team. Great job!

title: Best staff and a great hotel !!!
text: When another Bonvoy property canceled on us 5 days prior our vacation, this hotel went far and beyond to accommodate our needs. We got great rooms/ price and even a nice upgrade upon arrival!!!  Rooms are nice and clean and no carpet is a big plus! The staff was amazing and very friendly, we got so many useful advices and did appreciate them all !  Can’t wait to come back !!!

title: Great location, we will be back !
text:
While we were in Costa Rica, we acquired a private search engine called destinationsvacationclub.com, it looked too good to be true, even so, we did our first search to spend the end of the year in New York.
The Hotel we chose was the Ac Hotel New York Times Square, first for its location, second for being a good hotel and lastly because, through the Destinations search engine, we got a discount of almost 30%, we stayed from December 22 to January 2 and we saved approximately 2k, thanks to this we had an incredible Christmas and an unforgettable New Year.
The place did not disappoint, very good service, excellent meals and a room that made us feel in New York, just as it should be!
To be the first DVC test we did very well, we plan to return next year in addition to continuing to travel with this new way ... 100% recommended!

title: Will be back. Absolutely
text:
Just checked out today. Got a wonderful rate. Clean. Basic amenities in room but I don't need to live there. Updated rooms and hotel. Partner gym buff used gym and he gave high score for equipment. Did not eat at hotel choices but looked wonderful. 

Location is extremely close to Port Authority and about 6 walking blocks from Penn Station which I traveled to on train. Walking close to MSG area and Times Square area the other direction. Totally stocked Duane Reade store block up on 8th. Many shops and eating places around. Dunkin donuts etc. Wish I could have stayed longer.

Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Will check luggage as needed. During busy times expect to check in at check in time and not sooner.

title: Great time and friendly staff
text: My daughter and I are currently staying here to celebrate her high school graduation which was last week. Sad to say tomorrow is our last full day. The staff here are the friendliest and most helpful people. Ricardo and Gabby specifically are amazing! Gabby was so nice when we checked in...you could tell she loved what she does and helping people and Ricardo is always a warm joyful greeting when we return. He just makes you feel right at home. I would definitely stay here again! The location is perfect right near times square and the theater district. That along with the modern design, the great staff and super clean hotel make it a really great choice for your next trip. There’s tons of great food options nearby too! Joe’s pizza which is a NY must do, Momentea right across the street has really great sushi and if you like Empanadas then Empanada Mama is just a few doors down. Can’t wait to come back!!

title: Great location and comfy room
text: Enjoyed our weekend stay. Great location. Easy subway access near by. Stayed in room 1703 which gives a bit of a view of the Empire State Building. Staff were super friendly. Room was clean, king size bed slept well. Second time staying here, last time before covid. Only problem was the unending pot smell that engulfed the hallway and permeated the room. Still, would stay here again.

title: Ricardo was amazing
text: We just wanted to leave a review sharing how amazing Ricardo was! So kind, thoughtful, and took great care of us. People like him make stays so much more enjoyable and welcoming! Thank you Ricardo! We really appreciate it

title: Ask for Justin
text: The hotel was a nice experience. Justin made it even better. He was very helpful and implemented the perfect example of customer service. At a time where customer service is suffering tremendously, it was like a breath of fresh air to find someone who takes pride in how they treat people.

title: Gross Party Place
text:
The hotel staff is friendly and show concern and interest in how your stay is going but that’s about it. The best way I can describe this place is that it’s a rooftop bar/lounge/cafe that happens to have a hotel underneath it. There’s people coming and going in and out of the lobby all day that aren’t even hotel guests, they’re just going to the rooftop and take up the elevators for the people actually staying in the hotel. We waited on our floor for over 20 minutes on a Friday night for 6+ elevators to go because they were FULL of partiers (elevator says max 2 people for Covid but on average the rooftop patrons were filling up the elevator like it was nothing. At one point I counted 12 people). One of the three elevators was down which contributed to the delays but that was only announced to us via a memo that was left in the hotel room. That should have definitely been an email to hotel guests prior to arrival or a disclaimer on their website prior to booking.

We stayed in a top floor room with balcony. The room is small but I’m learning that’s normal for New York. I literally opened the door and the nightstand and bed is right next to it. First thing we noticed when we got off the elevator was that the hallways were dirty. This was typical of many floors that we saw as the elevator was going down and stopping. There was a cloth dinner napkin and trash on the balcony when we got there and the toiletries that are locked in a shower caddy were half used. I asked the front desk if they reuse the same bottles between guests and just refill them and the girl said no- and she did genuinely seem concerned and upset that it had happened and said she would send some new ones up immediately. 20 minutes later someone brought three bottles (shampoo, conditioner, body wash) and replaced the ones in the caddy. The “new” bottles were clearly old used bottles they had just refilled to the top so I opted not even to use them. My partner seemed unmoved by that fact, but to me especially during Covid, the thought of reusing toiletry bottles after strangers in the shower is just ridiculous.

title: Excellent stay
text: I just needed one night since i went to NY from VA to drop my daughter off at college. The room was really clean, new, and what i liked the most was that it had wooden floors instead of carpet. I paid $103 for the night which was a great deal. The staff was very friendly and welcoming (Daniel). Will definitely be back.

title: Very clean
text: Great hotel attaches importance to hygiene. I saw the housekeepers clean the room very meticulously and carefully. The hotel is very new and the facilities were well-appointed and functional. Close to a lot of metro lines, so transportation was very convenient.

title: I thought the stay was nice but the service was really lacking at the hotel
text:
I will tell you that for a Marriott Hotel even during the COVID pandemic this hotel was really lacking a lot of the basic services like enough towels for two people, they would not clean the room or even refresh it. I ended up cleaning it and throwing the garbage out because I did not want to come back to a dirty room. The staff said it is because they did not want much contact because of the virus.

I thought the front desk staff was a little abrasive. I had to check in before a friend who had gotten us the room and I practically got the third degree. I understand that there is a global pandemic going on but there is also basic customer service as well. I stayed at two other hotels recently upstate and they could not have been nicer.

The problem with the room was that everything was so low. For a tall person, this place is a nightmare.  The sink, toilet and beds are perfect if you are five feel tall. I had to lean down to do everything.

The upside is that the location by Port Authority was excellent and the views are amazing from the room. The beds are so comfortable that you will sleep like a log. I got two great night's sleep here and that what it was all about.

Overall I would not go back until the pandemic was over.

title: Amazing experience!
text: We had unforgettable experience at AC Hotel New York Times Square. We came late at night and Cheryl Andrews greeted us with smile. She was incredibly welcoming and helpful. One day she let us borrow umbrellas and it really saved us! All staff members were very friendly and helped us out with all our requests. Housekeeping did a great job as well, our room was clean and cozy. Thank you for welcoming us at your hotel and big thanks to Cheryl Andrews for going extra mile to make us feel like we’re at home!

title: ROOMS ARE NOT PROPERLY CLEANED
text:
I have stayed at this hotel before but post-COVID it’s rooms are not cleaned to pre-pandemic standards, let alone in accordance with current Marriott and Public Health standards.   To exacerbate the problem, the worst customer service experience.   I checked into my room.  First thing I noticed was a trash bin liner laying on the desk over the trash can.  Weird I thought, but maybe I’d I have trash they would prefer I just use the liner.  

The next morning I realize no face towels in the bathroom and only one towel.   I call down to housekeeping and ask face towels be brought up and received them straight away.   I wash my face using my own face cleanser, get ready to take a shower and there is NO soap in the room.  No shower gel.   There is an empty space for a shower gel bottle but it is missing.  To body soap bars either.  Then I start thinking, trash liner on desk, missing towels, no soap....did my room even get cleaned — because at best they didn’t FINISH cleaning. 

I called to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager on duty.  Maybe there was some weird protocol they didn’t explain I thought.   The front desk clerk, Miranda, lets out a heavy sigh and said I can help you.   And I said oh are you the MOD and she said no but she was available to help me and I said ok, explained the situation and she starts responding that they don’t clean the rooms daily because of COVID and I explain I am a new guest, this was how the room was sold to me and she sighs again and says well I will have someone send you towels, I said no they were already brought up to me.   I have questions about the cleaning protocols.  She sighs again and said “how would I know about those?”   To which I replied, I didn’t assume you did which is why I asked to speak to the MOD and you wouldn’t let me.   She said well he is busy and I said that is fine he can call me when he is free.  5 seconds later I get a call back from a man who identifies himself as the AGM and says he was listening to the conversation and I immediately said oh “so you were not busy” and he said he was listening while helping another guest.   I said oh so you weren’t listening to the other guest and listening to me instead.   He got upset and I said I see where his front desk learned her bad attitude from — her AGM and he then proceeds to argue with me and when I ask about the cleaning protocols again tries to explain that they have limited housekeeping due to COVID.   

I am so sick of hotels using this COVID excuse.   Either hire enough people to properly clean rooms and provide a clean room or DO NOT OPEN.  I have plenty of out of work friends in the hospitality industry who would love to go back to work.

And listen to your guests!!! My room wasn’t properly cleaned and stocked when I arrived!   This has nothing to do with daily housekeeping!   He refused to listen.   Was more interested in arguing with me than understanding me.   

I immediately checked out and moved to another property.   If you stay at this hotel you do at your own health risk and God forbid you have a question as they will not listen and might just argue with you.   Bad service, uncaring, unsafe and staffed by unprofessional people from management on down.

Thankfully I hold Marriott’s highest tiered loyalty level, called the concierge at the corporate reservations Ambassador desk and they were more than helpful in getting me out the rest of my reservation and rebooking me at a hotel that actually has good service AND cleans their rooms!

title: Just Alright
text: I saw so many goo reviews but felt after staying her is was average. The front desk was not very friendly. They did not explain anything with the hotel. The room was not very big. Just a basic room with bed and bathroom. They are not servicing the rooms daily unless you ask. That was not stated at check in. I know covid is going on but you should still let guests know what the services are and how they are doing things now.  It is is a pretty descent location. The restaurant next door is good but on the pricey side for what you get. It was nice weather outside so nice to sit out there and eat. I was expecting a little more from being a Marriott.

title: Another great stay
text: We had another wonderful stay at the AC Hotel in NYC.  We visit this hotel often and always enjoy ourselves.   Securing a room with a balcony should be on your must do list.  It is wonderful being able to sit outside and take in the city.  The entire staff goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is enjoyable.  I’d like to personally thank Stephanie Donnelly, the hotel manager.  She was very helpful making sure our stay was perfect.  She is a very dedicated member of the hotel and her work should be recognized.  I’d also like to thank Martha Gavilan and Christopher Lamarche - two extremely helpful and kind members of the AC hotel.  They both answered questions and made check in simple.  I don’t often take the time to review a hotel - but I think the three individuals I mentioned deserve recognition.  See you soon AC!

title: ROACHES
text: This hotel not only are they rude but they’re dirty af too ! Rooms had no soaps & roaches ! Disgusting . I won’t be back . The operator when i called to tell her she just was like oh okay well i don’t know . Like what do u mean ? This is disgusting

title: THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE
text: I made a reservation at this hotel to bring my sister back to NYC after the lockdown due to Covid-19 pandemic. A few days later I received an email cancellation one week prior to my arrival date, I called the hotel to inquire about the reason for the cancellation but I was put on hold several times without any explanation, finally I asked the agent if he can simply reinstate my reservation but he stated in a rude manner that he won't do that as he didn't know the reason for the cancellation. I called Marriott Guest Relations department and they informed me that my Amex on file has expired but that's not a reason for them to cancel my reservation 1 week prior to my arrival without even calling me to update my credit card expiration date. At that point I thought it was just an usual incident and the rude agent was having a bad day so I made a new reservation which I eventually cancelled due to the riots that erupted in the area during that weekend. To my surprise, I found myself getting charged $1 for the first reservation that they cancelled without contacting me, then they charged me a full rate and taxes for the cancelled reservation. I called the hotel to speak to a manager and all I got was the runaround from the front desk agents who claimed there was no manager available. Finally I spoke to someone who didn't believe the reservation was cancelled before the deadline so I forwarded the cancellation email to him hoping he will issue a credit for the charges they applied on my account as I wasn't expecting anyone from the hotel to take ownership of the poor experience I've encountered before I even step foot at their hotel. Unfortunately, and until this moment I still haven't received a reimbursement for the charges on my card almost 3 weeks later.

title: Great stay
text: I had a great 1 night stay at this hotel. Every staff member that I came in contact with was extremely nice and helpful! The young lady that checked me in and the gentleman that checked me out were very friendly. The first room that I checked into had TV & AC issues but Derek & another engineer (didn't catch his name) were able to move me promptly.  I was placed on the 17th floor with a beautiful view. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Week stay in NY
text: We had the pleasure of staying at this AC hotel from 10th to 18th March.  The hotel is very modern, and the staff welcoming and ready to help.  Our room was on the 14th floor, with street view.  The room had large glass windows, very comfortable beds, and pillows, and a very modern bathroom with a great powerful shower.  Everything was spotless and we found the hotel to be quiet.  We also visited the roof terrace for a drink.  The hotel is close to many sites, some were within walking distance.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again on our next visit.  I highly recommend it.

title: Gorgeous Hotel
text: We absolutely LOVED this hotel! The staff was exceptionally nice and the room was amazing. The hotel is very new and modern, great views, and the bed was extremely comfortable!  We loved the huge window in the room with all the natural light and great views. It was really nice being so close to times square as well. It felt like a really luxurious stay!

title: Wonderful stay
text: This is a great hotel in a perfect location, close enough to Times Square but away from the noise and crowds. The hotel staff was exceptional in accommodating every single request and giving great recommendations for things to do and places to eat. The bed was very comfy and the room was impeccably spotless. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Recently stayed in the AC Hotel New York Times Square. The location was easy walking distance to Times Square. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were modern and very clean. My only negative was the size of the room. It was tiny...not normal for an AC Marriott hotel.

title: Great modern place to stay
text: I really enjoyed the sleek modern atmosphere at the AC Times Square, all the amenities you could ask for and just half a block away from the action it is not overwhelmed by lights and a great place to stay!

title: Modern standard of what a functional hotel should be.
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a night. It is well located near Times Square. Quite busy street but very close to the 42nd Street subway station from where you can go anywhere.

It is a standard AC Hotel. A more basic modern functional hotel that has everything you need and nothing more.

I like that it has showers. The beds are comfortable. Internet, TV service with Netflix (your account) HBO Go and Showtime Anytime.

It’s a new hotel so it has state of the art windows, locks, safe, usb ports galore.

It has the standard Boquería restaurant at the first floor. It has healthy essentials and good coffee. Overall it’s a great place to stay at a much better price than other places.

I’d stay here again!

title: Great service, great location
text: Andrea and Dharyann made the trip great. This was a last minute trip and we did not have a lot planned but they helped a lot when we got there. Andrea left a birthday card and some sweets in the room for my daughter as it was her 18th birthday. Dharyann was always very helpful in directing us on what subways to go on and gave a great suggestion for breakfast at a bagel place called "Best Bagels and Coffee". There is a subway stop next to the hotel, very convenient. There is no breakfast conceirge but there is a great bakery next door. Joe's Pizza is very close to the hotel and a must to go get a slice of pizza before you leave. Overall, it was a great trip and this hotel made it better.

title: 5泊しました
text:
立地も良く部屋も綺麗です。すこし狭い気もしますがNYならしょうがないという感じです。チェックインのときに、「今日は外も見えないエレベーターの目の前の部屋しか空いてなく申し訳ない。明日になったら部屋を変えるのでまたフロントに来て下さい」と、次の日は街中が見える側の部屋に移動させてもらえました。
こちらから何か言った訳でもないのにとても親切な対応をして下さりホスピタリティを感じました。

title: Hôtel au top à tous les niveaux
text:
Nous revenons de NY où nous avons passé 4 jours en famille dans cet hôtel. Nous sommes tombés sous le charme de la ville, mais aussi de cet hôtel et de sa localisation. Quelques centaines de mètres vous séparent de Times square! Les chambres sont magnifiques, spacieuses, très propres et la vue sur les bureaux du NY Times est vraiment super!
Le roof top offre une vue imprenable sur la ville avec notamment l'Empire State Building et une jolie cheminée réchauffe des balades frigorifiantes en hiver.
La salle de sport est vraiment très belle et neuve. L'accès aux ordinateurs et aux imprimantes est un réel plus surtout pour finaliser un départ en avion par exemple.
Enfin, le personnel est aux petits soins et vraiment souriants. Une mention spéciale pour Shanyce qui nous a accueillis et qui a su rendre notre séjour inoubliable avec de petites attentions. Bravo et merci!

title: Basic but nice and new
text: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and going back again this weekend because of a deal my husband got. It is a nice hotel, it's pretty basic--clean, new and overall stylish. The rooms are very small, furniture is simple, the baths are nice. There is no room service which is a bummer and I would say there are limited services generally speaking. The roof top bar is very cool and a great place for a drink. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. I am not a fan of the neighborhood but it is convenient to a lot.

title: Excellent service and location
text: We stayed two nights for a last minute trip. The staff was very pleasant, helpful and accommodating.  The location was perfect, close to the train,Time Square, plenty of shops and restaurants The rooms were very clean. Everything is new. Roof top bar/lounge area was awesome.

title: Stuck in NYC
text:
Canceled flight and needed a good nights 
sleep. Got a great rate, quiet room and comfy bed here. The staff was pleasant, no complications for my quick stay.  This hotel is in a great area, close to list of  nightlife but not right in the middle of Times Square.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Stayed here by chance after reading reviews as we normally stay at the Residence Inn Times Square across from Bryant Park.  Pleasantly surprised!  Great location - walkable to all of the action, but far enough away that you do not hear noise in the evening.  Clean hotel with excellent service!  Alon was amazing and was there to greet us at check in as well as check out.  Amazing roof top bar/restaurant (pricey) with fabulous view.  Will stay again!

title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: Super cool hotel in the heart of Times Square.  This fairly new hotel is up to date and stylish like all AC's.  The rooms are nice and the service is fabulous.  The staff will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable.  Located close to 8th Ave the hotel is very safe and right by tons of great places to eat.  Pefect for a family and the rates are reasonable for the location.Theres a great bar on the roof top and they have happy hour Monday - Friday.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: My daughters and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February, 2020 and it was a great stay.  It's close to Time Square.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooftop bar is really nice.  We will stay here again when we come back.

title: Muy céntrico, pero ruidoso por las noches
text: La ubicación del hotel es muy buena, Su equipamiento es irregular: buena cama, caja fuerte, pequeño frigorífico, pero el armario es una barra en la que se disponen 5 congadores (para una habitación doble), aunque no caben muchos más, y dos cajones. No obstante, lo peor es el ruido nocturno, que no procede del tráfico o de la calle, sino de una instalación eléctrica que se encuentra en el patio interior al que daba nuestra habitación. El aire acondicionado también es muy ruidoso. No sé si en otras habitaciones esto es distinto.

title: Cool hotel
text: If you like a sleek, modern, somewhat minimalist hotel with friendly staff, this is the place.  Hard to beat the location-- right near Times Square and the subway.  So nice to have a walk-in shower and counter space in the bathroom.  The floor-to-ceiling windows offer plenty of light.  Great tapas restaurant next door.

title: Better than expected !
text: This hotel is only two years old, and still feels very fresh and updated - cool floor to ceiling windows with both light filtering and room darkening electric shades .  Room was very clean - no carpets in room .  No room service but drinks, snacks and wine available for purchase in Lobby.  Spanish tapas restaurant on lobby level has outstanding food which you can do take away back to your room.  Rooftop lounge also.  Great central location.

title: Great Hotel for NYC
text: Loved my stay here. The location is extremely hard to beat, you are walking distance from a lot. The bar on the roof has great martinis and a nice view of the city. The rooms are comfortable, however make sure you stay on a high floor to avoid road noise (my mistake). Will stay every time I'm in NYC.

title: Great hotel in the heart of New York!
text: For New York, this hotel is well located and super clean. The staff is unbelievably friendly and helpful. Walking distance to Times Square and many restaurants and bars nearby. Quick walk to pick up the big red bus for a tour of the big apple. Subway is close and extremely close to the theatre district for all of the broadway shows. Highly recommended. Flooring not carpet makes for a cleaner room and for the area, the rooms are spacious and well kept.

title: Very Quaint
text:
As a Marriott Bonvoy Silver Elite member, I make sure that when I go on trips, that I stay at a Marriott Branded hotel so I can keep earning points.  I was going to be in NYC for a night and wanted to check out a different hotel than the ones I have staying at, ie..Westin, Marriott Marquis.  The AC Hotel is right in the area that I like to stay at.  When I arrived I was greeted by the bellman, and a very nice gentleman at check-in .  Even though i was early, a room on the 18th floor was ready for me, and even though he did state that it was right next to the elevator, I said "let's do it".  The room itself is very small, even by NYC standards, but it was clean and quaint.  One very big complaint:  it's dark in the room because the lighting switches are just weird and hard to figure out.  

The roof top deck was very nice.  I had a couple of drinks up there along with a couple of sliders.  Note that at check-in I was given a voucher for a free drink upstairs, which was very nice of him (sorry that I don't remember his name).  

All in all, it was a nice stay, but I probably would go elsewhere if I was there with the whole family.  This is mostly a hotel for the business traveler and millennials.

title: Overall a good hotel, convenient location
text: Overall, this was a nice place to stay.  I thought the check-in staff were particularly friendly.  The rooms are somewhat small, and a little spartan, but clean and new.  The location is very convenient, although not my favorite location in NYC (or even near Times Square).

title: Great Location and nice facility
text: We enjoyed our stay for a brief weekend trip. Front desk helped me figure out the necessary form for a discounted rate I did not know I needed when I booked. Room was modern and cozy. Only criticism on the room was the noisy rattling of the bathroom door when it was opened and closed on its track. Would definitely stay again. Great location.

title: Awesome hotel!
text: I would stay here again just for the check-in process. The entire staff around the front desk could not have been nicer with small touches like giving a small boy a free ice cream that I saw and just in general a very refreshing experience. The hotel itself is really nice considering the nightly rate. I had a chance to stay in a room on the 19th floor that had a balcony that ran the length of the room. The room itself was not really large but nicely appointed. The bathroom shower was great (good pressure and heat, a key item for me). The bed was very comfortable, the windows have a sheer and blackout option and were raised and lowered by power. I will certainly be staying here again on my next trip to New York.

title: Great place to stay
text: Great location near time square. Front desk was very helpful at all times. Charges were clear and upfront. It was our 1st time in NYC. The hotel felt very safe and had all of the amenities that we could ask for. We traveled with 2 teens and felt comfortable leaving them in the room to go check out the roof top bar or a local establishment. This location is close to the subway and easy for an uber or lyft to get in and out.  Overall it was a good fit for our family.

title: Chic, friendly and clean
text: Had the loveliest stay. Front desk staff, especially Alyssa, made us feel right at home. Was in for an important meeting and they got us an early check in so we could change and refresh. Restaurant attached Boqueria is great for breakfast. Also checked out the lovely roof top bar after dinner for a cocktail. Room is modern, clean and comfortable with high end bathroom fixtures and coffee maker in the room. Highly recommend!

title: PÉSSIMA ESCOLHA, FUJA!!!
text:
Já fiz várias viagens e jamais escrevi sobre um hotel, mas dessa vez, tive que deixar minha opinião, principalmente porque este hotel AC está ótima avaliação e não merece. 

Fiquei neste hotel de 21.12.2019 a 06.01.2020, com mulher e filho adolescente.

O hotel realmente é novo e somente isto tem de bom.

O atendimento na recepção é péssimo. Os atendentes, principalmente as mulheres, são rudes, o que se agrava se vc não domina o inglês.

Cheguei no hotel por volta das 10h00 da manhã e o check in era apenas às 15h00. Pedi um quarto alto. 

Pois bem, além da extrema grosseria dos atendentes, não sei se de propósito, não atenderam meu pedido, forneceram um quarto no 3º andar e apenas no horário exato do check in, muito embora houvesse quartos liberados (facilmente constatado pelo check out dos outros hóspedes).

A limpeza dos quartos é igualmente péssima. Dos 16 dias de hospedagem, em 08 não houve a reposição das toalhas (de banho, rosto e piso) no banheiro. Ao pedir a reposição, demorava cerca de 40 minutos para o pedido ser atendido, isso ligando lá unas 3 ou 4 vezes nesse intervalo.

No quarto, apenas o banheiro é higienizado, sendo que não há troca de lençóis e tampouco varrimento na área das camas (diga-se de passagem, minúscula).

A rua onde se localiza, é muito bem servida de metrôs, mas é super suja.

Então, pense bem antes de se hospedar num hotel que trata super mal os hóspedes e não fornece as comodidades prometidas. 

Não recomendo para ninguém. Fuja, você achará ótimos hotéis pelo mesmo valor.

title: Nice location near times square
text: Very friendly and professional staff. Location is very close to Times Square. Rooms are clean. Service was excellent, very friendly staff. Very helpful . Close to all tourist sites. Recommend to stay at this location.

title: Good hotel and friendly staff
text:
We cost NYC for NYE. We stay here for four night. 
The location is very convenient. The room is clean and spacious. The staff is extremely helpful. They can responsibly answering our question and replying our needs. Like we need extra pillow and water kettle.  I also want to name the special thanks for front desk Tashany . She provide us very detail information about our travel plan and very friendly to my kid. My three year boy love to talk to her.

title: Holiday in the City HINTS
text:
I’ve stayed in NYC many times and this is a great hotel and location.  The one thing that stands out ... SERVICE!

1. Valet Parking is easy and convenient right in front of the hotel but leave yourself at least 30 mins if you need to get your car out.
2. There is a great bar/restaurant on the top floor with outdoor seating
3. Location is Times Square but it is behind the “Crazy” and one block down from the Garment District ... good location 

Enjoy

title: Loved this hotel
text: We came from England for Christmas and loved this hotel. The staff are so friendly and helpful! Rooms are spacious and clean with floor to ceiling windows. Great location, very central but far enough away from all the noise, it’s actually opposite the New York Times offices. Definitely take advantage of the airport transfer service which is reasonably priced and takes all the stress out of arriving! The restaurant next door although not owned by the hotel was great for breakfast in the morning offering healthier alternatives to the usual heavy fry up breakfast. Roof top bar is lovely also but a bit on the expensive side for drinks.

title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Rooms
text: I really like the AC Hotel concept. The rooms are generally spacious, well appointed, and have great attention to details. The bathrooms are well done in general. My wife and I stayed at this location two times in June. Each time we received an upgrade to a room with a balcony. The rooms were outstanding and the view, while not the best view in NYC, was still pretty good. We enjoyed the roof top bar and the in hotel restaurant. The location, which is near Times Square and the Bus Terminal, is a little more busy than I prefer. But it was still easy to navigate and not too crowded in June. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: Great location and great staff!
text: We brought a group of 30 kids to NY for an overnight trip. The hotel while slow to check us in was very accommodating for such a large group. The restaurant in the lobby is great for drinks and breakfast. There is also a wonderful rooftop bar that has great views of Times Square. The rooms while small, are well appointed and comfortable. The bed and pillows were comfortable as well. My only complaint is that you can hear outside traffic and noise which was not too bad to complain but if you are sensitive to noise, it may pose a problem. We were in walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and the theater district. Would highly recommend for a stay in NY.

title: Super hotel with great staff!
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the AC Hotel on 40th in Manhattan. This is a very nice property which feels new or recently renovated. I am unsure of which, but rest assured it’s on point. We were greeted warmly by the staff and they were very attentive throughout our stay. The room was clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows really make the room feel big and the natural light is awesome. We didn’t try the restaurant, but the rooftop bar is not to be missed. Fantastic atmosphere and cocktails to match. 

We did have a slight issue with the valet parking at the end of our stay. The bellman and staff went out of their way to make it right and we are impressed with them even more after that series of interactions. The issue was out of the control of the hotel, as the garage had an elevator issue and we waited a long time for the car (1.5 hours)

Overall, fantastic stay and would highly recommend. Walkable to Times Square, Theater District, Bryant Park and more. Give them a try.

title: Oscuro y triste exteriormente.
text: Con 5 noches de reserva y socia de AC me han dado una habitación interior que da a un patio ruidoso y que huele a comida que apesta. El ruido del aire acondicionado es insoportable. Es un hotel ubicado en una calle oscura, y que en la habitación no se sabe si es de día o de noche. A favor, el personal es amable y la habitación está muy limpia y es moderna. Las camas son confortables, las toallas muy buenas. Los productos de aseos son básicos y no reponen. Ponen agua y café , no sé si la cobrarán, pero es un detalle. No todos hablan español. En el bar de la Boqueria perteneciente al hotel, me he tomado la peor cerveza tirada del mundo!!!!, por la módica cantidad de 8 dólares. Yo creo que no repetiré nunca y me estoy pensando darme de baja de socio. De todas las tarjetas que tengo de hoteles, sin lugar a dudas, Melia!!!. Insisto la gente muy, muy amable y maja. Por supuesto, wifi gratis, pero como en todo el mundo, lo que pasa que ellos dicen que es por ser socio.

title: Hidden Gem
text: This hotel is one block off Times Square which was an excellent location for our weekend. No platinum lounge but they gave us 2 $10 vouchers which we used for yummy cocktails. The room was perfect. Front desk staff was really friendly and gave us lots of little bottles of water. I’ll be back!!

title: Great fun place
text: Great fun place, They are very helpful especially Douglas sharing some of the highlights of the area for both food and drink and entertainment. Rates are reasonable and people very friendly, we will be back here next year :-) VBL

title: Thought it was a smoke free hotel?
text: Stayed at AC/Times Sq last 2 nights.  Great location, etc but room filled w/ cig smoke smell the 2nd night.  Someone close by was smoking on 7th floor.  This was difficult for my wife to sleep due to the strong cigarette smell and some health issues she’s having.  We saved our Marriott points for this trip and It’s tough because really was a downer on the second night.  First night was great and I would stay again IF it truly was a non-smoking facility.

title: Quick NYC Overnight
text: Needed to be in NYC for a night and chose the AC Times Sq. The hotel is close to everything, restaurants, transportation, the theater district and a quick walk to Rockefeller Center if you want to see the Christmas Tree which we did. The hotel has a hip feeling with floor to ceiling windows in the room, and despite it being a bit small it’s nice. You may here noise from outside since there is a lot of construction nearby and it’s a busy area. There is also a rooftop bar with a nice view.

title: Just stay here, you’ll be happy & comfortable
text: I’m a road warrior. I travel about 100 nights each year for work and make trips to New York City 3-4 times each year. This was my first time at the AC Hotel New York and my stay was excellent. The location is so perfect and central to everything— walking distance to Penn Station, close to Subway, Times Square, shopping on 34th St, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, etc. Hotel room is very clean, modern and comfortable. I was on the 15th floor with a city view. Typical NYC noise which subsided after 11pm. Lots of accessible plugs & ports, mini fridge with complimentary water, floor to ceiling windows with shades for sleep and privacy. Bed was more comfortable than other AC Hotels Izvestia stayed at. Bathroom has great counter space, fabulous shower with dual heads. They provide a hairdryer, Korres bath products, shower cap, cotton balls and q-tips. Check in was a breeze. Several hours ahead I received a text from Andrea my room was ready. Brian at check in was very personable and informative. They had their tree lighting when I was there which was a wonderful event. All the staff I encountered were so friendly and always smiling. Upon leaving and returning, Ricardo was there to greet me and chat. And he arranged for my transportation back to LGA in a nano-second when my Uber driver bailed on me. They can arrange car service if you need it and it’s comparably priced to Uber, depending on time of day (most likely rush hour). Next door there’s a cafe with reasonably priced, fantastic breakfast (eggs, omelettes, bagels, muffin, etc.)  Or a few blocks up, Best Bagel. If you’re here for fun, you can walk to most places. If not, Subway, taxi or Uber is easy from here. I was very pleased with the quality of my stay, and the AC is my new favorite hotel when my travel brings me to the Big Apple.
