So just stay here, you will be happy and comfortable! To the hotel manager, keep doing what you are doing! Thank you AC for making my stay great and see you next year! Cheers!

title: DASHING TIMES
text: As I’m rushing around town trying to find winter clothes because I’m a Florida boy and winter isn’t a season we practice. AC hotel time square was extremely accommodating In my late check out. Couldn’t have asked for more fair treatment. Thank you guys.

title: There are so many better options
text: The hotel is new but very blah. The rooms are okay if you're not there much. The beds are okay. The location is good. But the staff is what really drags this hotel down. It started 2 weeks before check in when I began getting emails threatending to cancel my room becuase they don't have a credit card on file. They actually have 2 and every time I got the emails I called and they said they had them. There is nothign more terrifying then getting a threatenging email the day of check in, on a holiday night, which I did as well. The negative experience will continued with a long line to check in and front desk staff that is trained in check in but if anyting else more confusing comes up you can expect a long wait. I had booked 2 rooms and that caused a lot of confusion. And still is with them charging the wrong credit cards. At checkout, despite the street having opened again I sitll had to walk to my "valet" car and waiting outside at a garage 2 blocks away for 35 minutes. Overall this hotel gave me one of my top 5 worst Marriott experiences (and I'm an eltie member who travels often). This hotel is clearly not run well, and if you don't have Status I would Not stay here if they can't even take care of their elite status guests.

title: Great stay
text: Terrific central location and top notch staff.  Always a friendly sincere greeting when you come in. Special shout out to Daniel at the front desk for all his special service. Spacious rooms for new New York.

title: Location / clean / modern - great value for money
text: Clean, modern and simple in an excellent, easily accessible location. We only stayed one night but the hotel exceeded our expectations and was far superior a stay to a much more expensive hotel the night before - I would happily recommend this hotel as a go to spot in NYC

title: Clean, good location
text: Location was right off of Times Square. Easy walk. Perfect distance from the Lyric Theater which was our main attraction to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. One of the beds in the double room was not comfortable however and the noise from the street had to be drowned out by a white noise app. However the rest was just fine. Very clean. Nice staff.

title: Great location great hotel
text: This was the first time for us to stay at the AC Hotel Times Square. The hotel was very  clean and the room and bathroom were a decent size. The hotel is located in the middle of the the Theater District Walking distance to the Times Square ticket office, all the theaters and many restaurants. It was also a shot walk to the subway. Our room did not face the street so it was very quiet.

title: Clean and comfy
text: The AC Hotel Times Square was clean, comfortable bed, decent sized bathroom.   Hotel located smack dab in the middle of the Theater District if that’s your thing.  It was easy to get anywhere on the subway.  The rooftop bar was amazing.  We had a view of the Empire State Building from our room.  I’d stay again.

title: Great service from Ricardo!
text:
I just stayed here for the first time on a business trip from Australia.

Overall the hotel facilities and room amenities were great - clean and comfortable but the real stand out was the staff! They really were exceptional - helpful welcoming and friendly, remembering my face and room number when I added things to my room from the hotel store.

I especially wanted to call out Ricardo who was always there to greet me on my return to the hotel lobby and provided me with excellent service when I needed to leave my bags briefly (when I ran to the cash point) as well as finding me a car to the airport.

Thanks for making sure I had a great stay - much appreciated!

title: Our son’s first trip to NYC
text:
We brought our eight-year-old to New York city for his first time and decided to stay in Times Square for convenience to most of the attractions we planned to do. I decided to book with this hotel for its location and its contemporary style. I’m kind of a hotel snob. I like modern, chic, and comfy. Beds were nice, and bathroom is a good size. Complimentary water is a nice touch!  
I booked a higher floor room to give my son a nice view for his first time. We were put on the 8th floor. I was hoping for higher, but learned that the high floors start at 6. That was the only room with a decent view they had available that day. It was ready, so we took it. 
I was messaged by Sharon the next morning to see how our stay was going. I told her about the floor confusion, but also told her we did like the room and amenities. She replied back to tell me she was holding a room coming available that afternoon and we could switch to be higher. We were pleased. It was an easy move. I didn’t have to go down to the lobby. They came up to our room with the new room keys. And up we went to the 16th floor.  My son was happier. And that all I wanted. It was his trip. Thank you Sharon!
The guys at the front desk were so awesome too. They are all very friendly and helpful with questions. 
I would definitely stay here again. Great hotel. Great location.

title: Great Location
text: Central Manhattan close to subways. Very nice accommodations. Ricardo was most helpful upon checking out, offered the hotel’s black car as an alternative to ride sharing. All staff that we encountered were very pleasant. Rooftop bar was a plus, great to go to on our first evening while we were getting our bearings.

title: OK but was expecting more
text:
The location is great and there's plenty of choices for food, shopping and transportation within walking distance.  Rooms are clean and modern.  Rooms are small but pretty standard-sized compared to similar hotels in NYC; my family of four did not have issues with space.  Staff was always professional and friendly.  I had to work after checking out, although there's plenty of space to sit down and work, I couldn't make any calls because there's not a quiet place in the entire lobby, there's very loud music everywhere. The "meeting room" was locked and was being used as a storage space.

We did have some issues with the service, that when looked at each instance individually they don't amount to too much and could be easily dismissed in many other cases, however, they did influence our stay in a negative manner so I am sharing them with you...

We kept having to ask for extra shower towels because we were only given two, even though my Marriott profile says to leave extra towels. Even when we asked sometimes the towels never arrived.

I was charged for a meal that we never had.  First time I brought it up, the gentleman at front desk said they would have to review the receipts from the restaurant to make sure it wasn't me.  After it wasn't fixed and nobody checked, I brought it up to a different lady at the front desk, she said it was a default charge for incidentals.  After I argued why it said "restaurant" and not incidentals she finally took the time to check and removed it.

Two nights before our departure my daughter got sick and vomited in the toilet and the toilet got clogged.  I called the front desk at 11pm and said they would send somebody over to fix it, one hour later nobody had arrived, called again after midnight, while still tending to our daughter, and was told someone would come in ten minutes.  It was 1:30pm and nobody had been there to fix it.  After deciding it was too late for somebody to come I reached out and asked for somebody to come in the morning and that time they did.

I have not received a survey from the hotel, so I have not posted this review on their website. I will if they do, but I'm not sure if I'll get a request for feedback.

title: Hotel bien, desayuno horrible
text:
Lo primero decir que el Hotel está bien, la ubicación muy buena y la limpieza perfecta. Como siempre la calidad-precio no llega al nivel España pero eso ya lo sabemos cuándo salimos fuera.
Lo que me pareció un auténtico timo fue el buffet de desayuno, el primer día lo cogimos, costaba 30 dolares, decir que no había tal buffet, nos dieron a elegir entre huevos revueltos o fritos, pero es que no había casi nada, un par de plátanos y tres manzanas (fruta entera, sin pelar en un 4 estrellas), dos trozos de queso mal puestos, cuatro lonchas de jamón de York y dos yogures. Y no penséis que estaba bien puesto al estilo buffet,de verdad muy cutre, y se de qué hablo que trabajo en una cadena de Hoteles de consultora y se cómo está organizado un buffet...en fin que por 30 dolares podían hacerlo mejor. El resto de los días desayunamos en una cafetería justo pegando al Hotel que eran super amables, y por menos de 30 dolares desayunábamos los dos. El restaurante del Hotel vacío a la hora del desayuno y este lleno de clientes del Hotel, que me fijo en estas cosas.
Y como las comparaciones son odiosas, estuvimos en el Riu que está al lado a saludar a un conocido español que trabaja alli en temas de expansión y vimos el buffet...que buffet señores de AC, pasen un día por allí que son vecinos, y por menos de 20 dólares, fruta pelada y variada, zona caliente perfectamente diferenciada, bollería de un montón de clases, vamos lo que viene siendo un buffet y no un timo.

title: My husband's special birthday in NYC!
text:
We spent four nights at the AC NY Times Square and loved it . . . a lot.  Besides the great location and facility (great size room, beautifully maintained and appointed), the staff was fantastic.  Abraham greeted us so kindly at the front door and volunteered to help us with transportation advice and thankfully knew the subway system very well!  Tashany at the front desk was friendly, professional and so helpful.  Ricardo was large and in charge later in the lobby, friendly as we returned from Broadway and the next day, asked us if we needed airport transportation.  I encountered Warner in the evening who was friendly, engaging and made me feel like I was in my Southern California surf town instead of busy Manhattan!  

But the amazing thing is when I inquired of the front desk manager, Sharon, about something I could send to the room for my husband's 60th birthday . . . she later took it upon herself to send a card to the room wishing him a fabulous birthday 'from his AC NY Times Square family' as well as a bottle of Chianti and chocolate treats. 

I asked for all of their names as folks are so quick to send a negative review but seldom take the time to write a positive one, particularly naming standout individuals.

So grateful . . . we will go back!  

Mrs. Christine DiGiacomo

title: Bonne adresse
text: C est un hôtel neuf , très bonne situation, à 3 minutes de Times Square, chambre très bien pensée : rien de manque et tout est fonctionnel. Le plus : le personnel est franchement top , avec mon anglais approximatif, ils se mettent en quatre pour vous aider, encore merci à Alyssa de la réception....le moins , si il  faut en trouver un : le tarif du petit déjeuner , il est très élevé, mais comme toute restauration a New York.

title: Excellent all the way around.
text: Hotel was a great location. Douglas, the concierge was phenomenal. He took all of the stress and worry away of keeping our bags safe as we continued around the city after check out and had our car ready and waiting for us to head to the airport. He was so kind!!

title: Great hotel!  Staff is super friendly. Hotel is very clean. It's become my favorite Nyc hotel. ❤️Rooftop bar!
text: Great hotel!  Staff is super friendly. Hotel is very clean. It's become my favorite Nyc hotel. ❤️Rooftop bar! Douglas the bellman was awesome. They all were😀 restaurant had a great vibe!  Great location!

title: Great hotel
text: We spent two nights at the AC Hotel and it was wonderful! The room was exceptionally clean and quiet and the hotel was convenient to so many attractions. We loved that the rooms didn’t have carpet- very Eurapean. We enjoyed the restaurant for dinner as well as breakfast, although it is pricey. The front desk and staff couldn’t be nicer, especially Warner.

title: Birthday Celebration in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate his 50th birthdday. The hotel is clean, the location is great and the decor is stylish and modern. Our room was spacious for New York and we had floor to ceiling windows which was very cool. It was also very quiet considering how loud it is outside. Loved the bathroom, the shower has a rain shower-head and handheld jet showerhead. The service and hotel staff were awesome!!! Received texts several times regarding my visit to check in on the status of my room etc. I can’t say enough about how helpful and courteous the staff are. They went above and beyond and did some extras to make the bday boy feel special. Thank you for the top service you provided. We also loved the outdoor rooftop terrace, it’s beautiful and the view is amazing plus they have yummy specialty drinks! The attached restaurant, Boqueria Tapas, is also great-the churros are a must! The only negatives were minor, the towels in the bathroom are really poor quality and the hotel doesn’t have room service. I recommend this hotel if you are in town.

title: Great place for a weekend trip to NYC
text: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend. The hotel’s location is excellent and the decor is stylish. Rooms are quite spacious ( we did not expect it considering its New York) and very clean. Good thing is they are not carpeted so you don’t have to worry about the smell and stains ... the hotel staff is quite pleasant!

title: Thin walls
text:
The hotel is clean and modern.  It is conveniently located near a metro station.

The only problem I had was the noise from the adjacent rooms.  I didn't hear the noise from outside the street though.

If you are lucky that your next door neighbors are quiet, then you will have a quite stay.

I was unlucky that I was next to a room with a bunch people playing music and partying at late night.  The front desk did switch me to a different floor that night.  However the new room was next to some people getting up early and loudly talking all morning.

title: NYC visit
text: Very nice hotel!  Great service and friendliness by front desk staff and Doug and Alan on our departure. Hotel was well located for our excursions and the theatres.  I recommend this hotel if you are in town.

title: Convenient and classy!
text: Located just off 8th Avenue, this W40th Street hotel is one block away from the bright lights of Times Square and just steps away from Penn Station. The 8th Ave Metro is mere footsteps away. A short walk takes you to Broadway, Bryant Park and Herald Square. The Hotel is nicely equipped and the service is excellent. We loved the outdoor dining option at Boqueria and really enjoyed our 4night stay.

title: Not as bad, as my 2 star rating might imply: room for improvement
text:
As a frequent business traveler to NYC and Platinum with Marriott and Accor, I frequent many properties of those 2 major hotel chains.  First time stay  at this property, but did enjoy dinner with few friends at their Boqueria tapas place on previous occasion. In general, I rather like AC Hotel concept, modern and minimalistic with Spanish flair.
One of the disadvantages of staying at this property is location.  It is right across the street from Port Authority Bus Terminal, and fairly close to Penn Station. What it really translates to is that it is not the most attractive city block. Moreover, and, that is alarming: it is not easy to have a business meeting there during the day. Few unsavory characters from across the street were wandering into lobby, got seated to rest, talked to themselves, etc....  Not the best smell. We were distracted.  You got the picture.  I am not making any political statements here, make your own conclusions.  
Rooms are a little too small, no upgrade this time, no view.  The rooms and bathrooms are functional and clean though.  The towels in the bathroom were cheap and bad quality. For this price could be better. Service is not bad, but rathe mediocre and indifferent.  Well, I burned my Marriott points, so it was free night for me, otherwise, I might be less charitable towards this hotel. It is definitely better than horrible Moxy Times Square, and can be 3-4 star rating, with improvements, and lower rates. Have zero interest of paying the rates comparable to Sofitel, Novotel, and W while having 1/2 of the value....

title: Modern and quiet room
text: The room is modern and quiet. The flooring is not carpet. The bedding is comfortable. The AC is easy to set to your liking. The front desk is courteous and helpful. They offer water bottles at check-in which is helpful. The bathroom is spacious. The shower has rain shower-head and handheld jet showehead. The toiletry is by Korres, Greek brand. The room has chilled glasses for water. The location is convenient. Next time, I would like to check out their rooftop bar which closes at 11 pm.

title: Visit to N.Y.C
text: My wife and I travelled to NYC to celebrate her birthday. We went with another couple who stayed at another large brand name hotel. Their experience was just o.k. We felt welcomed from the moment we arrived. By the end of the 3 nights we were treated like family, Will, Douglas and Abraham were the best of the best! Thank you guys for the top service you provided. The location was great, short walk to time Sq and other attractions. Short walk to the pier for Circle Line Tours. We used our hotel as the meeting place and enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop bar...a nice touch. The room was just right with everything we needed. Our friends said they will stay there the next time they are in NYC and we have already recommended to friends of our who are going in a few weeks.

title: Midtown location and excellent service
text:
From the time we were greeted by the front desk, we all felt welcomed. This is my second time staying here, first was on business, this time pleasure. We wanted something midtown, close to the tourist attractions. The front desk, the bell hops all were very personable, helping us in anyway we needed. The Rooms were clean as was the bathroom and a bit larger (Manhattan size) than most. We had a room in the back of the hotel, so it was quiet at night and in the am. The black out curtains kept the sun out. 
Would recommend this hotel for those that are seeing a show, need a place to crash while being a tourist and seeing the midtown attractions.

title: Great hotel- very centrally located
text:
I would highly recommend this hotel. Good location as it’s close to Subways, Bryant Park and Times Square. The staff were very obliging and helped make our stay. Our room was a good size and it was a bonus to have a microwave and fridge. The roof top bar was also a very nice place to relax. 
Thanks heaps to Douglas for assisting with our requests and also for arranging our transport back to JFK for our flight to Australia. Love your work Douglas!

title: If you are looking for poor customer service and experience...this is our place!
text: To start I will say the hotel is in a good location. However, the reason I would advise staying at another hotel is because I had one of the poorest customer service experiences ever at this hotel. I travel often and as a result I usually stay at a Marriott property, but this one is the worst and needs someone to seriously train the employees. Upon checking in the front desk employee was trying to multi-task as she was checking me in. After she pulled up my reservation, she did not thank me for being a Gold member or even acknowledge that I was one. There was another front desk employee that was beside her checking in another guest where she acknowledged the guest's status (Gold), asked him did he need a late check-out and told him how many bonus points he would receive for his stay. I then asked the woman checking me in was there an upgrade available and she said there was, but I would need to come back later to access the room. I had plans on check-in day, however I walked around the city and came back at 2pm which is the time she indicated. Upon returning she indicated that the room was no longer available as it had been given to another guest. I asked her why she would tell me to come back at specific time, yet the room upgrade was given to someone else when she has my phone number to text me if it was available sooner than 2pm. She then began to explain the program to me and that the upgrades are not guaranteed, which I am fully aware of how the program works.

title: Escape in NY
text:
We visited NY with families during under other circumstances a non peak month, however the city was overcrowded.
They were late to check us in.
The room was extremely small without any facilities. Mini bar was empty.
We check for four people and they offered just 2 small bottles of water.
The prices were unreasonable high for what the hotel is offering.
The room was clean. The location was very central to Times Square.
The best part of the hotel was the roof top bar, however is also available to the public.

title: Not a good option for Marriott Bonvoy Rewards
text: Folks at the front desk were great, but management of this hotel (OTO Development) does not allow upgrades to the highest room category available. In this case I booked a regular king room and at the time of checkin the app and website showed a room with a balcony available, but the front desk declined to honor the upgrade stating that management does not allow it and their system would make me pay the full regular rate. Disappointed that franchise properties like this one are not required to follow Marriott Bonvoy program rules. Would not recommend if you are traveling on business and looking forward to an upgrade as this property games the system. (Shout out to Sharon and her colleague at the front desk for being impressively professional and trying their best to accommodate even though their hands are tied by OTO Development's out of compliance policies regarding the Marriott Bonvoy program). Stay somewhere else!!!

title: Awesome Mid-Town Hotel
text: This hotel felt clean, contemporary, and new.  The service was the best I’ve experienced in NYC in years.  The front of house team went out of their way to engage in conversation.  The room was modern and fresh.  Despite being in a very busy neighborhood our room on the 16th floor (upgraded b/c of Marriott Gold Status) was super quiet.  I’ll be back.

title: Bien!
text:
Le personnel est gentil, accueillant, souriant, serviable.
Il restait peu de chambres disponibles aussi nous n’avons pas eu une chambre en hauteur avec une belle vue.
Cependant, on a donné une chambre de standing correct.
L’hôtel est bien situé, le petit-déjeuner du resto de l’hôtel est bien avec un prix correct pour New york!

title: Wonderful hotel with great
text:
We booked a basic room and the beds were comfortable - but with the basic we didn't have a great view from our room.  Our room was quiet and I didn't have any problem sleeping and getting a great nights rest.
The staff at the front desk was amazing!  They were friendly and welcoming when we arrived, attentive when we asked for anything at all.  The entire hotel was spotless and beautiful.  
We were also close to everything in Times Square without all the noise.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent location & fabulous staff
text:
The location is pretty good; just across The Times on 40th street. It is a pretty new hotel - a couple of years old - so everything is still in good condition. The roof deck is small but you cannot beat a roof deck in New York! It is probably one of my favorite hotels to stay in New York given the location, amenities and price.
Now, though, for the best part: the people. The staff here is very nice and friendly. Impressively enough, if you visit the hotel more than a couple of times, they do remember and greet you. They also do go above and beyond. But most recently, Fabulous Cheryl came to my rescue and saved the day, warranting a 55 star review. :) A couple of Sundays ago I was delayed getting in with the storms. Somehow I did not make a reservation - imagine getting to the hotel at midnight and realizing you did not have a reservation! Cheryl, who remembered me from a previous trip a few months back - impressive point #1 - found me a room and sorted everything in a second - impressive point #2.
New York hotels tend to get very busy and sometimes their staff might be a bit rushed or impersonal. Not the staff at the AC Hotel. Friendly, polite and caring always. Exactly like how SPG was in the pre-merger days. :)

title: Nice hotel
text:
I was there for one night and i get a room in front of the elevator. I thought this would have been a trouble but in fact you don t hear a lot of noise. 

The housekeeping knocking at your door at 8am is maybe what should be rethink for people visiting Manathan. 

Otherwise the room was comfy and well furnished, bathroom are nice and well executed. The only minus if i can say that is the coffee machine in room 

Other than that it s the perfect location to visit NYc close to subway time square  and central park.

title: Over priced
text: Located in the busy and somewhat unpleasant neighboring areas of Times Square (mostly by night). The room views (if facing the rear alley are depressing). The furnishing is quite basic as so are the finishings (plastic-wooden floors). For breakfast, the offer at the restaurant (Boquería) is quite basic.

title: Très bel établissement
text:
Personnel charmant, chambre très propre et spacieuse
Outre toutes ces qualités, l’hôtel est extrêmement bien situé
Proche de Times Square, à quelques pas des métros, de l’empire.
Vous pouvez réserver les yeux fermés vous ne serez pas déçus.

title: Excelente opción para visitar NYC
text:
Perfectamente ubicado, recientemente reformado, limpio y bien atendido. Estuve con mi familia, somos cuatro, y repetiría sin duda. 

Tiene dos paradas de metro de diferentes líneas en la misma manzana, una a menos de 20 metros de la puerta. Esta a dos manzanas de Times Square. Desde muchas habitaciones se ve el Empire State Building. 

Las habitaciones están impecables, los baños son modernos y muy funcionales, y la limpieza es total. Las cortinas cierran bien, los colchones son muy cómodos y tienes dos tipos de almohada. Dejan agua en el minibar para que consumas gratis lo que necesites. Esto en verano es muy de agradecer.

El personal es muy amable y puedes encontrar a algunos que hablen español. Te pueden gestionar el transporte a los aeropuertos aunque con Uber es perfecto también. 
Tienen una terraza en el piso 21, creo recordar, que merece la pena una visita. 

En los alrededores tienes todo tipo de servicios. Desde el típico dinner neoyorquino para desayunar (recomiendo Junior’s), hamburgueserías (shake shack) o pizzas (las típicas de Joe’s).

Si te puedes permitir el precio, es una opción fantástica para visitar Nueva York.

title: Bel hôtel contemporain idéalement situé
text:
Séjour réservé via Voyage Privé
Nous sommes sur la chaîne hôtel MARRIOTT, sur un de leur établissement rénové l'année dernière donc pas de mauvaise surprise, au contraire.
Hôtel contemporain idéalement situé à côté du métro et face à l'immeuble abritant Le New York Time !
Très propre et moderne.
Chambre spacieuse et agréable.
Produits d'accueils dans la salle de bain (tout le nécessaire) réapprovisionnés tous les jours en fonction de votre utilisation.
Bouteille d'eau offerte et réapprovisionnés tous les jours
Sèche cheveux
Table et fer à repasser
Coffre fort
Bouilloire
Cafetière
Service bagagerie, pratique le jour du départ
Corner dans le hall où acheter si besoin  le nécessaire manquant : brosse a dent etc, snaking sucré salé, boissons..
Notre chambre ne donnait pas sur la rue, pas de vue mais au calme.
Personnel très accueillant, très arrangeant, vous remette un super plan très pratique pour se déplacer ( métro compris)
Très beau Roof Top.
Les petits dej à NYC , on les prends à l'Américaine, dans les cafés 👍 donc pas besoin d'avoir une offre petit déjeuner inclus.
Restaurant La Boqueria au pied de l'hôtel , tapas sympa mais resto cher à mon goût.
En même temps, les restos en général sont chers à NYC.
Petite astuce, les gifts (porte clé, mug..) sont vendus dans pleins pleins de boutiques à touristes. Sur le trottoir en face de l'hôtel à droite, le dernier jour j'ai découvert un magasin genre "la foire fouille" donc pas super glamour, n'empêche que j'ai pu y trouver un parapluie un jour de pluie qui ne valait pas 10 000$! Et quelques gifts à des prix biens moins chers qu'en boutique. Dont mes chewing-gum à la cannelle 🤗

title: A GREAT, new place to stay
text: This is my first time staying in the AC Hotel Times Square, but it certainly won’t be my last. Over the past 20-25 years, I have stayed in the Sheraton Times Square. Now with the Bonvoy merger, I found this alternative, staying on points; this hotel was significantly fewer points. The location for the AC is grand: steps away from the 42nd Street train station. Also I took the plane train and the E line from JFK, spending $7.75 to get to the hotel and avoiding all traffic! It was so easy to do! The only challenge was hauling my suitcase up two flights of stairs upon arrival at the 42nd Street stop, but it was not a big deal. The hotel does offer a car service to the airports, and my daughter, who came in to spend the weekend with me during my trip, used it to get back to LaGuardia. I wish we had known about this for her arrival! It is only $55, a flat rate to the airport (plus tip), which is significantly less than Uber/Lyft (depending on the day, time and weather, of course). She arrived later than we anticipated, and we had a show to go to, so we took the bellman’s advice and grabbed a slice at the 99 cent slice place just a couple of doors down; we could have gone to Kiss my Slice if we were walking the other way – both places convenient, cheap, and delicious for a quick slice. I got a meal from the Hummus and Pita restaurant on the corner of 40th and 8th Avenue, again just steps from the hotel, and took it back to my room to eat one afternoon. That was delicious!  In addition to the convenience factor, the hotel has first rate service! Ari at check in walked me to my room, showing me how to use the app on my phone to access the elevator and then to open my room door. Ricardo and Warner, the bellmen, were so helpful and kind and professional! It seems that “110 percent” is the motto for these service providers, and it makes for a great experience. The housekeepers left everything as I requested, and the room was always made up quickly. One tiny inconvenience for a green situation: the AC goes into dormant mode without movement, and this cannot be changed. I asked the front desk and the maintenance man who came up to my room. I kept my bathrobe on the bed and waved it up in the air whenever I woke up in order to get the AC to come on ; ) When we traveled to Europe last year, all of the hotels had this feature, but we could override it by inserting our room key into a slot in the thermostat. I wish the rooms had this feature, but it was not terrible. The bath products are so nice, and the shower is strong, coming from a rainshower faucet. So nice! The room also has plenty of USB ports, and it has a small refrigerator! SOOO nice for our leftovers and to cool our water jugs overnight. A little nicety: the hotel offers FREE small bottles of water both in the room and in the lobby. Many guests were offered cold water upon arrival and/or when returning from a day out on the town. In the mornings, they also have complimentary newspapers: WSJ, NY Times, and/or USA Today. Food carts are set up just outside of the hotel on the NY Times side of the street, and I grabbed a smoothie and a bagel in the mornings. My daughter and I checked out the rooftop bar -- very pretty, but very pricey. We went down to the Spanish tapas restaurant next to the hotel instead and enjoyed some delicious sangria for a much better price, sitting at the pretty bar.  Overall I was very very impressed with the AC Hotel Times Square.

title: Unbeatable value right in Times Square
text: Reserved with Mariott points at 1/3 of what the surrounding properties were going for. Accommodations were large for NYC standards, very clean, bathroom/shower were excellent. On location tapas restaurant was pretty good, if not a bit pricey. Don't overlook AC Times Square when making NYC travel plans.

title: Nice Place
text:
The location, staff, food and room....AWESOME!!!!!!
New York gem, Rooftop terrace with beautiful views, 
only one restaurant but lot of places near by.
highly recommend!!!!!
will return...for sure
I love New York

title: Last minute find
text: My husband and I were getting away for the weekend and had our plans changed last minute. I am a Marriott rewards member and picked this hotel the day of. We couldn’t have been more pleased with this hotel. The staff is amazingly friendly and goes above and beyond to help you out. We loved it so much we ended up extending our stay and they did all the could to squeeze us in last minute again. We will definitely be back. The room was clean and beautiful with floor to ceiling windows.

title: Good time.
text: Hotel was great! Got 5 rooms with balconys, the view isnt the best but good! Just a balcony alone in new york is a gift!! No room service 😦. Hotel is close to everything , just off the beaten path. Lots of action .

title: Adequate
text: I stayed at at this hotel for a business Trip in August of 2019. Besides the great staff at the front desk I was not impressed. The ambiance and the quality of room cleaning did not resemble a “4.5 star hotel”. Our bathroom was not cleaned, they left us with no toilet paper and for some reason the only thing they did in our bathroom was leave us with excessive amounts of shampoo and conditioner. I felt like the hotel was done on a low budget. The towels were very thin, our door wouldn’t shut properly and some of the light switches wouldn’t work. On the other hand the employees at the front desk were excellent! Every night when we came In they were very friendly and went out of their way to do everything they could to make your stay better. Douglas, Alan, and Andrea especially stood out and really made up for the flaws in the hotel. If you are looking for a luxurious stay in New York I would not recommend AC hotels.

title: Disappointed Stay
text: Never stayed at this hotel before and had high hopes.  Needless to say it did not meet my expectations. I am a Marriott Reward Member and received a text that my room was ready at 1:00 pm.  I arrived at 3:00 to check in and thought it would be seamless.  I was told the room needed to be checked and I could go have a seat and the reception clerk would bring the key over in a few minutes.  I waited a 1/2 hour and the woman had disappeared.  I went over and inquired about the room and was told it was ready. Extremely irritated that I was basically forgotten about.  My overall observation is it is definitely a 3 star.  The reception desk is not very friendly to guests whether they are checking in or out.  The location is okay and the hotel is clean.  I will also point out that the walls seem thin as you can definitely hear hallway noise from inside.  I would not stay here again for the price.

title: Modern/Clean and Adequate for Location.
text: We stayed here for two nights because we needed to be within walking distance to a workshop being held near Times Square. Like someone else said, it's Times Square...On top of that this hotel is located across from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Right there should give you a good indication of what you are going to encounter once you walk out the front doors. Do yourself a favor, if you want a central "Times Square" location stay over by Bryant Park. A few blocks to the east but honestly a world away! As for the hotel itself, all the staff that we encountered were very friendly except for one front desk person. The rooms were on the smaller side for NYC and after two nights we were definitely feeling cramped. Although clean and "sleek" they did feel somewhat cold (no cheap slippers in our room either for the tile "wood" floors.) Could never get the temperature right, either too hot or cold. The glass bathroom door rattled every time it was opened/closed not ideal for the middle of the night when sharing a room. Our glass shower door never stayed closed and would always roll open as well. The rooftop bar is small and if you are traveling with kids they're only allowed up there between 4-7pm. The room did have plenty of USB outlets and nice reading lights. Hydration stations were also a nice touch but not located on every floor. Odd number rooms are in the back of the hotel, small windows over-looking brick wall. We were moved to the front, same size rooms just felt more open with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the New York Times Bldg. The rooms in the reviews with the slanted floor to ceiling windows were located on the top two floors and seemed to only be king. Overall good "basic" modern/clean accommodations on the small side with a few minor flaws... if you really need to be in that area.

title: Great hotel - fab location and friendly staff
text: We arrived at the AC hotel after a transatlantic flight. The room was very comfortable and very well sound proofed considering the central location of the hotel just off Times Square. Had an amazingly comfortable and peaceful night sleep after enjoying the great rooftop bar for a few drinks. Staff were all very accommodating and friendly.

title: Pretty Good!
text: We usually stay at the Westin Times Square but tried the AC this trip.  No regrets.  Room and staff were all top-rate.  Literally the ONLY issue we had was that the bath towels are VERY VERY thin.  Not sure why they skimped on those.

title: No bathroom door
text:
Stayed at this hotel with 2 friends. Everything was great except for the fact that there was no bathroom door. The front desk told us that all of the rooms with a bathroom door had already been taken. 

My friend group consisted of both men and women so needless to say it was quite an awkward situation. We laughed a lot about it but obviously less than ideal to have to go downstairs to the lobby bathroom in the middle of the night for privacy’s sake.

title: Buena opción
text: Super cerca de Time Square pero sin estar en todo el ambiente, a solo un par de calles de muchas atracciones. Parada de metro cercana y un bar y una terraza con buenas opciones. Aparentemente en recepción no hablaban español pero el trato fue genial. Tuvieron el detalle de dejarnos un adaptador de corriente. Habitaciones nuevas y elegantes. Buena opción para pasar una semana. Recomendable

title: Great Location, Nice Rooms, The Worse Service
text: I travel alot and typically do not expect alot from a hotel except a clean room, nice crisp sheets, room to work AND respectful service.  I typically keep it low key because travelling and staying in hotels often is no longer exciting for me.  For this hotel chain, I am currently classified as an Ambassador Elite (Lifetime Platinum Elite).  I checked in the day after the city experienced a power outage.  They advised me when I had checked in that there was no wifi/internet, cable TV and the elevators were organized by calling a head as they had to be manually controlled.  I understood this and had no issue with it.  I was offered a complimentary coffee when I checked in but it was so hot outside I asked for a raincheck.  The room was clean, bright, modern and very functional - no complaints.  I was informed of the location of the closest Starbucks so I could spend the afternoon and get my work done (because they had wifi).  After spending 5 hours at Starbucks, I returned back to the hotel to grab some dinner.  I was informed when I returned that the wifi/internet, cable and elevators were at the same status.  I had asked about getting my cup of coffee and was told it was $4 ... no exceptions.  The hotel is running a Nespresso machine behind the reception counter; the paying guests have been inconvenienced to work elsewhere if they need internet and going the extra mile of handing someone a cup of coffee was out of the question.  I paid the $4. More annoying was that the hotel offered no type of compensation for the inconvenience caused by the outage and the duration of impact to the paying guests.  The only individual that offered any type of professional service was when I checked in.  I stayed at the hotel for 5 days.  Any time I had approached the front desk to ask any question there was either no one present to ask or they were too interested in their own conversations I was invisible to them or if they did ask me if they could be of assistance their attention span was less then 5 seconds.  One morning it was raining so hard, I had asked about the best place to catch a taxi for myself and 2 co-workers.  The person I was talking to started to tell me and half sentence was distracted by another co-worker and actually walked away from me.  I kept telling my co-workers that joined me on this business trip that I would write a bad review.  This was our 3rd trip to NYC in 3 months and we all agreed the worse hotel when it came to service/friendliness, but agreed the rooms were good.  Today, the reason I am actually taking the time to write the review is because I received an email about a returned package.  When I checked in, I had informed them that I was expecting a package.  Every day after work, I had asked about the package and was told it never arrived.  When I checked out, I meant to call the sender to let them know but time got away from me and I forgot.  Today, the email I received informed me that my package was returned.  When I contacted the sender the reason they were given and I quote "The receiver determined this is a duplicate product order and has refused the delivery. / The package will be returned to the sender."  I checked out on July 18, this message was given by the hotel to UPS on July 24!  I had to spend an hour on the phone to explain that this was not me and I wasn't even at the hotel at that time.  I also had paid $20 for express shipping to ensure that the package would arrive on time.  According to the UPS slip, the package arrived on July 15 when I was actually at the hotel.  They gave me the tracking details and the package was actually at the hotel on July 15.  I had to now convince the sender to reimburse the $20 shipping fee in addition to the return of the package since it was not me who returned the package.  Service speaks volumes to how people react and feel about a hotel stay - I hope someone learns something from this.  I definitely will not return to this hotel.

title: Marginal
text:
Not even in the same class as most of the AC Hotels I've stayed in. 
We arrived about 11pm.  The roof top bar and their restaurant had both closed early. 

I had used 4 of my Major reward  "suite nights" ttyl get a suite.   They don't have any suites.  They put me in a "City View" room... don't waste your money.   Out looks right aft the side of another building.  It has no view.   

I'd think Marriott would be embarrassed to have this in their chain,  especially as an AC hotel.

title: Bel hôtel
text: 10 jours dans cet hôtel au cœur de Manhattan, très bien situé. Chambre au 11ème étage,très jolie, calme avec ce qu'il faut en équipement, un petit bémol une table de nuit de chaque côté du lit serait nécessaire sinon les matelas penchent d'un côté et les lits ne sont pas assez larges pour 2 adultes. Au niveau du service, les lits étaient fait tous les jours mais il manquait à chaque fois un drap de bain, 2 draps de bain à chaque fois alors qu'on était 3 et pareil pour les gels douche et malheureusement le sol n'était pas nettoyé, le strict minimum était fait ! La terrasse au 21ème étage était top et le restaurant une bonne découverte avec de bons plats, pensez à réserver !

title: Great Hotel!
text: This was our first time in New York and we had a wonderful time at AC Hotel New York! It's in a great location, far enough away from Time Square, but close enough to walk to a lot of attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.

title: Loved our stay!
text:
Went in for a conference and stayed an extra day with my wife. Loved this hotel!
Super clean, well maintained, very friendly staff especially the guy at the front desk.

Great location, comfortable bed, clean room.

Water pressure in the shower could be increased but was still very good.

I’ll make an effort to get this one again in future visits.

title: Clean and Sleek for a great value
text:
My family and I travelled to NYC July 19-24, 2019.  There were 6 of us so we got 3 rooms at the AC Hotel in midtown manhattan. The hotel is centrally located and is within walking distance to many of the main attractions of the city.  The hotel is a refreshing oasis  amid the hustle and bustle of the city.  It is sleek and modern and very clean.  The rooms are modern and up to date with hard wood floors although the rooms are a little small and there is no closet space what so ever.  This hotel is definitely designed for the business traveller who lives out of their suitcase for a day or two not a family looking to unpack their bags.  There is also only 2 small drawers the size of a night stand in the entire room. 

I am a Marriott/Bonvoy  Elite member but this hotel does not offer a Club room for breakfast or coupons for a complimentary breakfast.

title: Front desk is super friendly!
text: Sharon (or Shannon, so sorry if I messed that up!) was super helpful and accommodating with my baggage check. Room was great and hotel is beautiful and close to everything I needed. Will come back for future business trips.

title: European Design
text:
The hotel promotes itself as: "strips away the unnecessary, drawing your attention to the essentials." The rooms are just that...stripped down to the bare essentials!
Except for a frig, the average-size king room has no carpet, no closet (small hanger rack), only one drawer, tiny end tables on each side of bed & only a cart for toiletries in bathroom. I had a high floor & room overlooking street was quiet. The Spanish tapas rest. (next store) - Boqueria - is quite good. We enjoyed drinks, appetizers in eve & breakfast. The downside - no complimentary coffee service for guests. Front desk staff are polite, but don't go out of their way for service. As a Marriott Bonvoy member, I was glad I could use points (my rate was almost $400!) Even though the location is convenient to many midtown sites, I would stay elsewhere next time.

title: Stylish, comfortable accommodations
text: Great property. Excellent location. Artfully designed. Excellent service. Room was very quiet despite the central location. Great gym. Boqueria was excellent for dining. Rooftop bar was also very stylish, only complaint was that for a more mature crowd (37 years old here), was very college crowded busy feel on  a Saturday night. It was also only open until midnight-would have thought for NYC it might be later. But in general, great property. Very much enjoyed my stay.

title: Where were you when the lights went out? Unfortunately at the AC Hotel.
text: I really wanted to like the AC Hotel NY Times Square - the location is great, and it has a fabulous tapas restaurant, Boqueria. The rooftop bar is also nice, but overpriced and often closed for special events. Unfortunately this hotel offers few benefits for elite travelers, and won't compensate you when it fails deliver basic services. I was there during the blackout, and we had only partial elevator service for 5 days (with my room on the 17th floor!) and no TV service for 2 days. The response was essentially "it's not our fault, deal with it." It short, very poor management. I wrote a long critique to the hotel manager, and her response was pretty much "sorry you won't be coming back." Look elsewhere, NYC visitors - there are many other great options in Midtown. Stay somewhere where management actually values your business.

title: Modern upscale with great location!
text: Modern, upscale,super clean room with wood floor(no smelly carpet). Can't beat the location, right next to subway stations. We saved so much time by being close to the station & to all the eateries. It is a room that help me relax after a full day of sightseeing. We stayed on the 9th floor, there are some traffic noise but not so bad for being so close to Time Square. This will be my go to hotel next time I visit!

title: No power
text: The hotel staff did an excellent job during the power outage. This was a stressful time for everyone staying here and the front desk staff was very professional and accommodating. The staff is very personable and the guys working the doors were always friendly when they greeted you. The room was a little strange since it had a nightstand on one side of the bed but not on the other although there were plugs on the side without a nightstand. Why? The hotel is in a great location if you are seeing any shows since you are just blocks away. We thought there was supposed to be an upgrade or a bonus point reward for being “gold” but nothing was said at check in. Last time we got a free cava at the bar.

title: Modern hotel in convenient location
text: I made a last minute reservation when the other hotel I booked did not have a decent room available. The upgraded room on the high floor with a sloped window wall was quite nice; however, I could hear the people in the adjoining room. The guest’s coughing kept me up all night. They need to address this issue. The location was convenient to transportation.

title: Great Place
text:
I somewhat randomly picked this place because of the location and price. I'm glad I did. It's new and everything spotless and works fine. AC is very cold. Free bottled water at the front desk and in the room. But the staff...could not have been nicer, friendlier, or more professional. Smiles and service from start to finish. Made me feel welcome.

Location is great too. near a lot of tourist spots. And the power went out from 9th street west from 72nd to the Battery. Havoc everywhere. The hotel did not lose power, but I assume a surge blew out the elevator controls. There was a letter under the door within an hour apologizing and explaining the situation. The elevators worked, just not automatically. They brought in staff from sister properties to man the elevators so as to have no disruption. Now that is professional. I'll stay there again.

The rooms in the back face another building so it was always dark looking and no view...but it was quiet. Don't know if the rooms facing the front had street noise or not, but I can assume much brighter  Bathroom sink is very shallow (not a problem) and the faucet is short. Hardly enough room to wash your hands or brush your teeth....not a complaint, just an observation. And like every other hotel room, no light fixture in the middle of the ceiling. Don't know why hotels don't have a central light fixture

title: Great Hotel in a very Central Location
text: A very nice clean modern centrally located hotel. Check in/out was a breeze. Would have given 5* rating had we been put up on a higher floor but then again we were out most of the Day. Job well done to the Team @ Ac Hotel.

title: Perfecto para visitar NY
text:
Estuvimos 6 días alojados en este hotel y fue un acierto. Es nuevo, todo muy limpio y la atención de 10, son super amables.
Las habitaciones nuevas, buen tamaño y limpias. El baño muy amplio y moderno.
La ubicación no puede ser mejor, a 5 minutos caminando de Times Square y con paradas de metro al lado del hotel.
El restaurante y rooftop también recomendable.
Sin duda para repetir en el próximo viaje a NY!

title: Great - As Usual for AC Hotels
text: Stayed here for a business trip recently. Great hotel with location in Times Square. Sleek and modern with very friendly staff. Has a rooftop bar but didnt get a chance to check it out. Always appreciate a free room upgrade too! Would stay here again and have enjoyed several stays at AC hotels lately!

title: Super hotel
text: En plein centre ville, au cœur du quartier animé de Times Square, personnel accueillant, attentionné  et serviable, chambre spacieuse et très propre. Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits au 5ème étage. L hotel est calme. Bar au 21eme étage qui offre une très belle vue,

title: Very modern rooms, big bright bathroom
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in New York, and this one is my favorite. The whole hotel is newly built and the bathrooms are so bright and clean. They also use shower doors instead of shower curtains which I find much more welcoming and hygienic. 

My only recommendation for the hotel is to improve the sound insulation for rooms facing 40th St, especially the ones on the lower floor. Even though the windows already have double-layer glass, I can still hear the traffic on the street very clearly at night and it disturbed my sleep. For light sleepers like me, I advise asking the front desk to give you rooms that don't face the street.

title: Very 'unequal' hotel and, all in all, rather disappointing experience
text:
Stayed 5 nights in this hotel, and experienced very unequal service: from great ( Douglas was incredibly helpful to  expedited my family into a concierge car service back to the airport) to very poor (Front desk not helpful at all to accommodate our requirement to have a room in upper floor…looks like if you don’t book directly at the hotel, you are not ‘entitled’ to the best room, upper floor, with view on the buildings…you simply deserve lower floor’s room with either a lot of street noise…or in the back of the hotel, with a superb view on a dirty building + AC noise)
Also, rooftop lounge was closed almost every day for private events and not available for hotel guests…
Our room was not cleaned until 5:30 pm on Saturday 23rd, just the days we wanted to step back into the room before heading to a clipper sunset cruise. Bad luck.
Need to admit the great location of the hotel, the nice breakfast (expensive like everything in NY), and the large bedroom for NYC

title: AC’s are a great Marriott product.
text: Stayed at AC’s before and really like their modern decor.  The rooms were sufficient size, small fridge and coffee maker.  The hallways and outside doors look a little dated but not the rooms.  Front desk was very helpful and accommodating with my earlier than 3 arrival.  Alexis was especially helpful and determined to get a better room for me (which she did).  Tried the adjoining restaurant for apptz- was good.  Went to the roof top bar which has a cool setting.  Within walking distance to many places - I was attending a conference at Javits Center and walked to it one morning.   Lots of good places for coffee and breakfast nearby.  Would stay at this hotel again

title: Great rooms pathetic service
text: The rooms were great but the service is absolutely pathetic. Despite being a Marriott titanium status holder was not able to get these guys to even clean my room properly. Emailed the operations manager but got no response from him. Apparently he only believes in responding to online reviews and not guests who are staying at the hotel. Also they market the hotel on their rooftop lounge but it was closed every day for private events and not available for hotel guests.

title: Great location; slow front desk
text: Perfect location,  great new room,  friendly housekeeping.  Only complaint is the slow front desk.  Took 30 minutes to check in and there was no line.  Middle of our stay needed cards re-keyed took another 30 minutes.  Other people traveling w us had the same problem.  Front desk needs to step it up to get a 5 star rating.

title: Great reception & service
text: Really nice culture and team working at this hotel.  Douglas was incredibly helpful at checkout and expedited my family into a concierge car service back to the airport.  Very proactive and customer focused.  Well done.

title: Super lækkert og centralt beliggende
text:
Hotellet er meget moderne, flot og rent. 

Vi var glade for gulv til loft vinduerne og hotellet og værelset levede fuldt op til de billeder vi havde set på nettet og på hotels.com 

Hotellet ligger meget centralt i forhold til bl a Times Square, Empire State Building og Madison Square Garden. Der er naturligvis noget støj fra gaden, når man bor så centralt, men det generede ikke os. 

Vi var glade for detaljer som 4 usb stik, hvor vi kunne oplade iPhones og ipad

title: Falha na limpeza
text:
Hotel novo, moderno, quarto com tamanho bom, sem carpete, recepcionistas altamente cordiais, mas nada adianta se a limpeza do quarto não for boa.
Cheguei e o quarto estava com o chão sujo. Esperei para ver se o no dia seguinte seria limpo, mas não foi. Reclamamos na recepção e pelo terceiro dia consecutivo o chão continua sujo. 
A governança apenas troca as toalhas e arruma as camas.
Não voltaria apenas pela limpeza.

title: Exceptional, Modern Hotel Experience
text: In recent years I have stayed at a Kimpton when in Manhattan. My first time here suggests this may become my hotel of choice in NYC. I loved the room — clean, comfortable (albeit without a comfortable chair or settee; desk chair only), great bathroom and shower, and spacious lobby. The location is very good, with easy walking access to the heart of uptown Manhattan (including Bryant Park, which offers a delightful outside respite with coffee and a book. The hotel is also a short walk (15 minutes) from Penn Station.

title: Staff is fantastic, location great. Room OK.
text:
OK, bad news first: the walls between the rooms are thin. After one restless night due to a noisy neighbor, the next night I had to go to their room to get them to quiet down. The air conditioner is loud too, which I got used to but the first night was rough.

With that out of the way...the rest of the hotel was FANTASTIC.  Everyone on the staff is incredibly friendly and go out of their way to help you out.  The front desk staff in particular were exemplary. Here are some examples:

* Once while coming up to the hotel, there was a queue for the revolving door. One of the staff opened the side door for me so I could avoid the line.
* Another time another big group was checking in, and one of the staff grabbed some waters and offered them to everyone in line.
* In my room, the maid arranged my toiletries (tooth brush, tooth paste) on a folded towel next to the sink for me.  What a nice touch!

The location is great too - just a quick walk to subway, Times Square, etc.  There are some inexpensive, hidden gem food areas too you can try out if you are on a budget or looking for something better than $1 pizza slices.

Did I mention how great the staff were? I've been at some very fancy hotels around the world and these people are right up there with the best.  They get 5 stars, and the only reason my review is 4 stars is the quietness of the rooms (next time I'll bring ear plugs)

title: 6 nuits en plein cœur de la big Apple
text: Très bel hôtel, confortable, calme ( nous étions au 12ème étage, pas un bruit), personnel très gentil ( ce qui est vrai pour 95 pour cent des New yorkais ils sont incroyables). Chambre nickel, taille correcte. J’ai adoré la localisation qui nous a permis de faire bcp de choses à pied ou à qq pas du métro.Le restaurant la boqueira est topissime. C’est certes un budget mais ça en vaut la peine.

title: 地點超棒的優質飯店
text: 主要是為了工作而選擇住宿在這裡，地點非常方便，距離時代廣場、圖書館、梅西百貨都很近，房間乾淨而舒適，早餐也不錯，值得一提有Roof top bar!

title: Great stay, perfect hotel
text: Stayed with a few rooms for the family this week, the hotel was clean, smart and perfectly located. Front of house team was exceptional and looked after the family really well. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Location wise this hotel is perfect, everything in midtown is walkable and anything downtown is a quick uber of subway ride.

title: Hôtel bien mais service au secours !
text: Nous venons de séjourner 5 jours dans cet hôtel. Au niveau des chambres cela est très correct mais au niveau du service cela est déplorable ! Nous avons eu la mauvaise surprise d’avoir été prélevé de 250 euros sur notre compte sans être prévenu juste car nous avons consommé au restaurant ! L’un de mes sacs n’avaient pas été mis à la bagagerie et aurait pu être volé par n’importe qui. Ce n’est pas un service 4 étoiles et c’est Dommage car l’hotel En lui même est très bien !

title: Très bon service
text: Personnel à l’écoute qui n’hésite pas à prendre beaucoup de temps pour vous aider dans vos démarches de touristes ! Chambres propres et bel hôtel dans l’ensemble : gros + pour l’emplacement et le restaurant La Boqueria qui est juste excellent qui se trouve dans l’enceinte de l’hôtel

title: Very modern and very nice
text: We stayed at this property during a quick trip to the Times Square area of Manhattan. It was off the main drag so a little quieter and a very pleasant stay. The property is in excellent condition and very solid (no outside noises). The rooftop bar was a little chaotic for our tastes.

title: Modern hotel, spacious rooms, conveniently located to many NYC tourist locations
text: We had 2 rooms of 3 women each.  Arrived about 12Noon on a Friday, rooms were not ready, but they assured us rooms were reserved on the 2nd floor next to each other.  Easily checked our luggage and headed out to see the city.  Returned about 5pm to get ready for our evening.  Took about 15-20 minutes as they said now our rooms were not near each other for everything to be sorted out.  Everything worked out to where we were next to each other on the 6th floor.  Rooms were clean, modern, and spacious but the lighting wasn't very bright.  2 mini bottles of water left in fridge and when we inquired with front desk, they said they were complimentary.  Nowhere was this listed, but we appreciated it.  Friday night we went up to the rooftop bar and looked around - it was nice, but we didn't stay.  We slept well and got up early the next day to start our day.  Left hotel about 9am - returned at 5pm and our rooms still hadn't been serviced!  As we were in rooms, housekeeping did knock and offer to redo rooms, but we asked them to come back after 7, which they did.  We checked out the next AM storing our luggage since we had an evening flight.  Overall, we were very pleased with all the hotel offered and would definitely come back

title: Poor service almost spoiled our trip
text:
From the start this hotel was a disappointment. 
No check in time - rooms not ready, when 1 room was ready the other took another 2 hours even though they were right next door to each other and was reluctantly handed over following complaints. 
Very poor lighting in the room, electrical sockets not working, 5 hangers for 3 people to hang clothes and when asked for more took 2 days and chasing up to get anything. 
Icing on the cake was the last night when the water was switched off to the entire hotel for "planned maintenance" but we weren't informed, were given no information and after being repeatedly ignored when calling to reception had to go and demand to see the manager to get a bucket of water to flush the loo! 
Throughout this the staff in the main couldn't care less and seemed totally uninterested. This is NYC where customer service was born - frankly in this hotel it's long been dead.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location
text:
Hotel is modern, uber clean, and located just right.   Roomy rooms for NYC,  great location just close enough to Broadway/Times Square/Bryant Park (5 minute walk) but far enough away.   Shopping is a few blocks away.  Penn Station is in walking distance so the train from EWR is reasonable and probably the fastest/cheapest way in and out of the city.  Long walk (15 minutes) to convention center but good for me.  Several nice restaurants nearby including the one attached to the hotel.   Inexpensive markets/restaurants nearby too.  Surrounding area appears safe.  
My room faced the back and the view was not more than an old brick building.  I checked in very early(8 am) after a red eye flight and they made me a strong cup of coffee at registration.   They allowed for a late checkout so I could have a business lunch and clean up before walking to Penn Station to get to the airport.  I am a priority member in Marriott program so  that may have allowed me some of the privileges.   Staff was very accommodating.

title: Excellent location and good wide rooms
text: One of the rarest things in NYC is to find decent sized hotel rooms, AC hotel did offer that. We had a 2 queen beds room and it was spacious and very new. The location is perfect - it is less than a block from Port Authority (a major plus for travel) and few short blocks from Penn Station. It is also 7 mins walk from Times Sq. Lots of eating options around the hotel - major plus again.

title: Good Stay Good Location
text:
My wife and I recently spent a long weekend at this property. The hotel is pretty centrally located in the Times Square area with easy access to the NYC subway system. 

We arrived around 8:45pm and guests were lined up to check in. There were two people working the front desk, however, one went on break even though we were lined up 4 deep to check in. Overall took about 20 minutes to get checked in. 

The rooms are nice. Decent size. The AC is a more European style minimalist hotel. Just the things you need to have a peaceful stay. 

The rooms are very quiet and was surprised to not have street noise, which is usually always the case at NYC hotels. 

Highly recommend the rooftop lounge. Great drinks, atmosphere and staff. Nice seating both in and outside. They serve small plate items only, but my wife and I split 3 small plates and that was plenty for us. 

Overall a good stay and would recommend this hotel when in the Times Square and theatre district.

title: Schönes neues Hotel, sehr gute Lage
text:
Bestes Hotel das wir in den letzten 4 Aufenthalten um den Times Square hatten. Neu, modern, schön eingerichtet. Leider hatten wir für 6 Nächte ( ist für NY ein langer Aufenthalt)das Zimmer 509, es war Tag und Nacht eine dunkle Kammer. Die Zimmer Reinigung war schlecht. Wasser und Toilettenartikel wurden nicht immer nachgefüllt, so dass wir selber neue kaufen mussten. Der Boden im Badezimmer wurde in der ganzen Zeit nicht gereinigt, um den Abfallkübel und das Spülbecken war die ganze Zeit der gleiche Schmutz.
Beheizte Dachterrasse und Aussicht Bar war sehr schön.
Werden aber trotzdem wieder kommen.

title: Tutto ok!
text:
Hotel rinnovato in posizione top! Con metro (Port Authority) a 30 mt, Times Square a 5 minuti a piedi e lo splendido Bryant Park altrettanto.
Siamo stati in una stanza quadrupla, che non era come dimensioni adeguata a 2 adulti con due adolescenti, ma i letti (alla francese) erano comodi e tutto sommato siamo stati bene. 
Il personale, contrariamente, a quanto ho letto qui, è sempre stato gentile ed efficiente. Bella la palestra e la vista dal rooftop bar.
Abbiamo provato per cena il ristorante Boqueria adiacente e ci è piaciuto. Subito fuori dall'hotel ci sono diversi locali dove fare una buona colazione e/ spuntino.

title: Spring Break Stay
text: Stayed for 3 nights.     I used to live in NYC, and Times Square was somewhere I avoided to go since it is so full of tourists and congested.    I was pleasantly surprised that it was more quiet than I expected.   Subway is half a block away, so it was very convenient to get around.   The room was big enough and the bathroom was rather spacious and nice.   Hotel staff were all very friendly.   For the price range, I felt the hotel was a good deal.    Did not try the restaurant in the hotel, but it looked like it was a popular place.   Flying into LGA, the traffic cross town was rather bad, but that is NY.

title: Great hotel and location
text: We decided to stay here for Easter weekend and very impressed. It was in a better location than I expected. I must say the staff at the front desk were beyond amazing. They were able to answer all of our questions, told us about the rooftop lounge which we did check out that Saturday night and were able to get some good city photos in the backdrop as well. They provided great recommendations. I did like the room setup, very clean, much easier with a family when you have a mini fridge and microwave. The bathroom size was better than any other hotel I have stayed at in the city in the same price range. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Business & Pleasure Trip Recommendation
text: I recently stayed at the AC Hotel Times Square. The front half of my trip was business and the back half pleasure. I organized a group of 8 for the business part. The hotel was extremely helpful in setting up rooms for our group and helping with all our requests. The service was excellent from beginning to end. Everyone I dealt with during my stay had a ready smile and went out of their way to help you. The spot was convenient from travel within the city and to Penn Station when we took the train out of the city for a day. My husband joined me for the weekend. We give this a big thumbs up.

title: Great location and clean rooms
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights, the location is absolutely the best, it is close to timesquare but far enough so it's not noisy. Subway is right downstairs and Port Authority is right across the street. 

Our room was clean, not the biggest room but not too small either. Given its Manhattan we felt the size was adequate. The washroom was generously large, it was great to have an amazing hot shower after a long day sightseeing. 

Looking forward to staying here again.

title: Hotel novo com design moderno, ótimo atendimento e quarto confortável com uma vista incrível!
text: Quando começamos a pesquisar hotéis para nos hospedar em NYC, descobrimos que o grupo @marriotthotels havia inaugurado há apenas 8 meses o @achotel_timessquare, entramos no site deles para conhecer o hotel e não tivemos dúvidas que nos hospedaríamos nele. Logo que chegamos, já nos deparamos com um lobby lindíssimo, com pé direito alto, design moderno e repleto de obras de arte que nos encheram os olhos. A recepção nos acolheu rapidamente, todos os funcionários muito solícitos e nosso check-in foi feito em poucos minutos. Subimos para nosso quarto com a expectativa alta do que estaria por vir e  fomos surpreendidos positivamente quando abrimos a porta. O quarto não era só lindo, era espaçoso, bem equipado, decoração clean, espaço de sobra para nossas malas, banheiro amplo com produtos @korres.skincare e com uma vista que definitivamente nos conquistou, a janela do nosso quarto ia do chão ao teto o que nos proporcionava uma senhora vista dessa selva de pedras que tanto amamos! Nosso quarto era composto por cores neutras, mobiliário elegante, pisos de madeira, iluminação natural, um oásis de design moderno com uma sensação sofisticada de espaço aberto muito agradável. Incrivelmente funcional, o quarto era equipado com TV widescreen, canais a cabo, ar condicionado, cafeteira, frigobar abastecido com água sem custo, lâmpadas de leitura ajustáveis, portas de carregamento USB espalhadas por todo o quarto e banheiro, persianas automatizadas, secador, tábua de passar, ferro e cofre. Lembrando que os quartos são acessíveis à mobilidade. O acesso à Internet de alta velocidade é gratuito. A roupa de cama e as toalhas eram extremamente macias, era quase uma missão impossível conseguir levantar daquela cama confortável no friozinho de NYC. O café da manhã tem uma taxa de 30 dólares por pessoa. Além dos quartos extremamente confortáveis, o @achotel_timessquare possui outras comodidades como  academia 24 horas por dia, 7 dias por semana, com equipamentos modernos, um business center e uma loja AC, que vende itens de origem local. O AC também conta com 4 salas para reuniões corporativas, sessões de treinamento, apresentações ou eventos perfeito para pequenos grupos. As conveniências incluem catering experiente, business center no local, serviço de fax e cópia, internet de alta velocidade e WiFi gratuito em todos os lugares. Entre os restaurantes pertencentes ao hotel estão o popular bar de tapas em estilo barcelonês @boqueria que abriu sua mais nova localização na 260 W 40th Street, adjacente ao lobby do AC. Amado por seu menu animado e espírito de convívio, o Boqueria West serve um café da manhã de assinatura AC com croissants preparados no dia, charcuterie feita à mão, queijos artesanais, tortas de ovos e pudim de chia feito na casa, além do almoço e jantar que incluem tapas, paella e especialidades sazonais e favoritas do chef catalão @marcvidalchef. Os pratos podem ser acompanhados de vinhos selecionados à mão, coquetéis e Sangría. E no 21º andar do AC está localizado o @castellnyc Rooftop, um lounge aconchegante com uma mescla de ambiente requintado e descontraído, que recaptura o espírito dos clássicos bares de coquetéis, com ênfase extra nos martinis. O menu é baseado em ótimas bebidas clássicas entre elas coquetéis, cervejas, vinhos e pratos para serem compartilhados, juntamente com uma linda vista de Manhattan. Mal voltamos para casa e já estamos com saudades desse hotel que ganhou nosso ❤️ Amamos muito nossa estadia impecável em NYC.

title: Hôtel assez satisfaisant dans l’ensemble.
text:
Hôtel très bien situé ( à même pas 10mn à pied de Times Square). Cet hôtel dispose d’un rooftop avec vu sur l’Empire State Bulding , il dispose également d’une terrasse chauffée. 
Le personnel très accueillant, très sympathique et poli. 
Néanmoins, nous étions deux adultes, et deux enfants dans la même chambre ( pas assez de place pour 4...) La propreté est à revoir c’est vraiment le gros point négatif!! 
Ainsi que beaucoup de bruits puisqu’on est situés juste à côté de la route ..

title: Great hotel in fab location
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in April 2019. The hotel had only been open 12 months it is nice and modern and clean with a lovely atmosphere. The reception & lobby staff are all really friendly n helpful. Roof top bar is a must to visit. The location is great easy walking distance to Times Square 5th Avenue Macy’s etc. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it. Thank you AC we really enjoyed our stay.

title: Nice Hotel and Location
text:
We just returned from 5 nights here and really enjoyed it. The hotel was clean and centrally located to Times Square, MSG, Theatre District.

Our room was right next to the elevator which wasn't as bad as it sounds, we enjoyed the black out curtains. 

Staff were helpful when needed and we used the rooftop bar a few times, prices were high but this seemed to be the norm for the city.

title: Unfriendly staff
text: To be honest the hotel is decent . However the staff at the front desk is very unpleasant including the management. Would not return here ever again. There’s too many options in Times Square to stay the night for the staff to not have a good attitude.

title: Don’t call us. We’ll call you.
text: Great hotel with a great location.  We would definitely stay here again. My only complaint is with the check in process. We were early, 9 AM, and got the standard “fully committed” response so we can’t give you a room since nothing is ready but we’ll call you when one is. We came back at 4 and got the room but never got that call or an update on the app. It doesn’t seem to matter what your reward status might be since there really aren’t any perks unless it was the card for a glass of cava at the bar. It wasn’t used.  There were two of us. We couldn’t be offered two glasses.

title: Great hotel!
text: We planned a bachelorette/bridal shower weekend in nyc for my sister. I had so many things to plan and coordinate and the staff at AC were so helpful! I had things delivered and they made sure they got to our room. Sharon at the front desk was also very attentive and made my sister a great cup of coffee! Douglas was also super helpful getting us checked out and packed in the car the day we left (we had so much stuff!). The hotel itself was very clean and modern (I’m very particular  about where I stay) and the room was the perfect size with a fridge too! They also happily obliged with a specific room request that I made. I will stay with them again when I return to nyc! Thank you so much for helping make my sister’s weekend so nice!

title: Central
text:
Nice enough hotel 
Very  convenient to shops and restaurants 
Staff very helpful 
Clean but basic 
Don’t expect breakfast they don’t do it
There is a restaurant attached to the hotel but be prepared $40 and it just was not great the staff did not explain how it works so really you are left on a limb 
For pure  convenience yes it a great location just a pity that they don’t offer more in the line of food

title: Worst hotel service in 10 years -stay away
text: Pulled into the hotel and parked in front of approx. 6 valet parking signs with the family around 10:55pm. Waited there for about 15 minutes with no sign of a valet then finally went in to see what the problem was.   Apparently valet stops at 11 PM. Not sure how guests are supposed to know this. So I unloaded the family and six bags of luggage because there is also no bellman or luggage assistance after 11 PM. Once the bags and family were inside I had to “self-park” which meant I had to drive to a parking garage two blocks away in seedy section at 11:30pm and walk back to the hotel.  The next day we were checking out and I had to walk back to the garage and wait 40 minutes for my car and then drive back. Whole process took over 1 hour with traffic.  Then, the cherry on top was the bellman was standing at the front desk watching my wife and two kids and myself struggle wheeling a luggage cart out to the side walk and loading the car and then walking the luggage cart back in.

title: Un hôtel idéalement situé
text:
Hôtel situé à deux pas de Broadway et de Time Square.
Les salles de spectacles sont également à proximité.
Des chambres sont propres, calmes et spacieuses.
Le petit déjeuner époustouflant avec choix et qualité.
Un accueil soigné et souriant de la part des réceptionnistes mais également des hôtesses d'accueil au restaurant.

title: Awesome Hotel Stay
text:
Stayed at this Marriott Branded Property AC Hotel Newyork Times Square in Dec 2018

Checkin was Smooth 

Rooms decor is excellent 

Beds are really comfy 

Free WiFi

Housekeeping Dept do there job in the best way they can & provide you all the extra amenities when ever you required.

Location is excellent just a few minutes of walk to times Square and all other major attractions near times Square.

Port Authority station is just on walking distance &  train terminal is also on few minutes walking distance.

Overall Experience was awesome & highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: Stayed for the weekend with a group of friends. Every employee was so accommodating and friendly! Our rooms were spotless, floor to ceiling windows with amazing views, awesome rooftop bar and centrally located to everything in the theater district. A must visit!!

title: New York Birthday
text:
