I cannot express how happy I was staying at this hotel. The staff were amazing especially Cheryl at the front desk. Whether we asked for directions, taxis, advice someone was on hand to help! 
It is a very clean hotel. Very well organised
Amazing location
No resort fees!
They looked after our baggage when we checked out at midday as we had a night flight

Without hesitation I would stay here again

title: First class modern and sleek hotel
text: Me and my son visited NYC for his 21st birthday and stayed at the AC. I let them know in advance our reason for coming and they greeted him with a high five and had left snacks, drinks and balloons in our room, a lovely and well appreciated welcome for us!  The rooms are clinical, clean, well furnished and well looked after, very modern and chic accommodation in midtown Manhattan. The staff at the front desk were extremely polite and accommodating which just enhanced our stay. We visited the rooftop bar once which was really cool and very stylish. In all, an extremely nice hotel in a brilliant location with great staff. Would definitely recommend and return here in future visits!!

title: Great location. Great stay
text: This is a new hotel thus all facilities are nice. Rooms are well decorated. Comfortable bed. Nice amenities. Good size shower. Conveniently located and being close to subway station. Friendly staff. Strongly recommended.

title: Impressive
text: I was very impressed with the room and the customer service at this hotel. Received texts several times regarding my visit to check in on the status of my room etc. The room was clean and the furnishings were new. The only negative about my stay was the loud noise. I was in room 1812 and I could hear a lot of street noise, especially early in the morning around 4am (trash trucks etc). Overall will stay here again vs the Hilton Times Square were I have stayed several other times.

title: Excellent location!
text: The AC Hotel Times Square is a gem. Clean, stylish, comfortable. Best of all, it's location is 2.5 blocks away from Times Square. As a matter of fact, we walked to wherever we wanted to go from this hotel, including from/to Penn Station and to the newest attraction, The Vessel at Hudson Yards. Of course, it was an easy walk to the theater, which was our main purpose for being in the city. Our only complaint, not enough hooks for towels, jackets, etc.

title: AC Hotel Times Square
text:
I have never stayed in a Hotel that does not know what they are doing. If i could have changed hotel, i would have. The staff are nice but don't know what's going on in their place of business.  We call from our room and they ask what room we are in.  Our room was not cleaned until 4:30 in the afternoon after we called 2x.
The rooftop bar is beautiful  but i have never met such a rude bartender.  Not just to me, but to0 all. A Friday night they close at 12 am. It is a full bar and they call last call at 11;30. We got there at 10:45. Did not get served till 11:15 and was told ypu better order 2 drinks since it's almost last call. 
We not recommend the hotel

title: Warm hospitality and excellent location
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location and in walking distance to the main areas of interest such as Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, etc. 

The subway and the bus station is very close by and these serves as good platforms to reach other attractions in New York and even Woodbury Commons in New Jersey. 

I enjoyed my stay here in cold cold December 2018. Thank you to the staff for the warm hospitality!

title: Excelente opción
text: Estuve alojada con 2 amigas en el mes de marzo y estamos muy satisfechas con la elección. El sitio es inmejorable y el hotel es nuevo. Habitaciones amplias, baño completo y nuevo, detalles como espejo con luz, secador de alta potencia, televisión de plasma con netflix, usb por las paredes para cargar los móviles.. además el agua y el café en la habitación son gratuitos. Nos invitaron a una copa de bienvenida en el bar situado en la azotea que es precioso y tiene unas vistas increíbles. Muy recomendable. La única pega es que estuvimos alojadas en la tercera planta y había un poco de ruido, pero es normal estando en pleno centro de la ciudad! Para mi no fue un problema, pero mis amigas se pusieron tapones para dormir. Aun así, lo recomendamos las 3!

title: Personale scortese, camera media, si salva solo la posizione.
text: Il personale è molto scortese, come già rilevato da altri utenti su Tripadvisor, inclusa la supervisor, non indossano neanche il badge con il nome di riconoscimento. Alla nostra lamentela perché alle 7 di sera la camera non era ancora stata fatta hanno risposto con uno sbuffo senza neanche scusarsi. La prima camera assegnataci era angusta affacciata sul cortile, solo dopo due giorni ci hanno trasferito in un’altra camera altrettanta piccola ma almeno in facciata. Il riscaldamento fancoil è rumorosissimo, bisogna spegnerlo di notte per poter dormire, quando acceso soffia aria calda in faccia stando a letto. Calice di benvenuto al rooftop bar in un ambiente dismesso, olive a pagamento. Mai più in questo albergo! Il ristorante cinese di fronte nella strada con cucina anche robata è eccezionale! Di fronte c’e un ottimo Dean & De Luca per la colazione e le scorte di cibo.

title: Location is central, rooms comfortable and small
text:
The stay here was just fine.  Service at the front desk was good and welcoming.  Our room was smallish with a bed that was slightly broken down on the side.  No view at all. 
At least it was very quiet at night.  The neighborhood is central to Times Square with lots of people on the streets and lots of filth (trash is everywhere).  Next time I will stay in another neighborhood.

title: Amazing service
text: We had such great service - Abraham - Allen & Ricardo helped us so much - such an awesome place - smaller yet has everything you need - friendly atmosphere- hospitality is their middle name - always thinking ahead for their customers-

title: Heart of Times square
text: Front desk not as exciting as other AC downtown. She kept say she needed my id and it was evident as I tunneled through my briefcase I was looking for it. Got no WiFi info. Went to room, smelled like strong Clemson chemicals. Bathroom has on wash rag but a million towels in awkward places. Like back of toilet, lights not working by front door. I called down, as it was late but seemed more irritated that I called. Might want to train them at downtown hotel for a ounce of hospitality. The best part was the bellman, they were on it and super attentive.

title: Excellent
text:
Situation idéal tout est à proximité, en face du New York Time l’hôtel est moderne propre personnel présent quand il faut.
Salle de sport très bien équipée et que dire du rooftop wahooo !!!
Plateau de courtoisie permettant de prendre un café ou thé le matin, et on peut garder la chambre jusqu’à midi.

title: Just fine
text: Really nice lobby.  Nice upstairs bar.  Our view was medium. Really nice people and they gave us early arrival room.  The room was the usual room.  The bedding was nice and the television lets your stream netflix and hulu so I was happy. Hallway was noisy -- always wish for more sound-proofing

title: A short weekend visit
text: The hotel is beautiful - clean, new, modern and everything worked well! Location is terrific. Check-in was fast and smooth, and all the staff we met during our stay were always smiling and very nice! The room had a very comfortable King bed, terrific A/C, large wall-mounted flatscreen TV,  and a bright white bathroom which was nicely decorated. The room itself was very small, even for Times Square standards, with a spartan display of furniture. But since we were only staying overnight after seeing 'The Book of Mormons,' we didn't care about room size or a view (none really, haha). But this hotel served our purpose perfectly and we'd definitely book here again.

title: Great Staff make this hotel worth staying at
text:
As AC hotel's go this is pretty average, but the staff is amazing.  They allowed me to check-in very early in the morning.  I am on crutches due to a leg injury and they were always looking out for me, holding doors open, etc
The room was clean and attractive.
The hotel breakfast has one of the best buffets that i ever had.  It was not your traditional breakfast buffet, they had some unique offerings. I would suggest trying their carmelized half grapefruit and chia breakfast pudding, and the bread.  All were delicious.

title: Hôtel 4 étoiles surcotés
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel en famille et nous avons pris une chambre pour 4 personnes ( 2 adultes et 2 enfants) avec 2 lits sensés être spacieux. Résultat les lits permettaient de coucher un adulte et un enfant tout juste sans se taper dessus durant la nuit. Nous avions une chambre en bout de couloir située au 2ème étage particulièrement bruyante car située au dessus du restaurant de l'établissement. En effet, nous entendions par la climatisation les chaises bouger et le fond sonore du restaurant. De plus, il y a une très mauvaise insonorisation au niveau de la séparation de la fenêtre par rapport à la chambre d'à côté ce qui fait que vous entendez tout ce qui s'y passe....
Nous avons dû demander 3 fois des serviettes pour en avoir pour 4 personnes, de même pour le gel douche et shampoing.
Côté positif, l'hôtel est très bien situé non loin de Times Square et à 10 mètres d'une station de métro. Personnel plutôt sympathique à une exception près. Bon restaurant de l'hôtel.

title: good location, terrible service
text: we travel to new york alot and most of the time we stay at westin or sheraton. this time because of new year they were all booked and then I looked into this hotel. The pictures looked good the price extrimley high for the type of hotel it was. we were staying in this hotel for 7 nights, two rooms. the rates came down from the time I reserved called the hotel , the would not adjust the price there was a difference of over $1,300. they said your are past cancellation, 3 days prior. I had other families and friend stay there too. 1st of all the hotel is new , rooms very small. being a long time spg member they wouldnt do anything  to accomidate you , maybe even upgrade.There is no concierge in the hotel , we had to go to westin or other hotels to get information on anything. Nobody was a help at all. paying close to 600-700 a night and not having that advantage. next the rooms few days in the row 1st wasnt being cleaned good then couple of nights rooms at 7pm when we returned to the  hotel wasnt even clean. very frustrating when its extremeley cold outside, we had to wait in the lobby where there was absolutely no security homeless were walking  in and walk around go to restroom , sit in the lobby , try to get into elevator. No security what soever, imagine how terrifying this was. and when you complaine to front desk no real answer. All together the staff not helpful , not friendly.kind of rude.  when I wrote the review for spg  survey,  the manager emailed me and said for me to contact him, he never responeded to me.  I have  never ever faced anything like this in all the years of my traveling  and never had the time to call. but I did it because it really effected our vacation as family and was told by other parties why I brought them to this junk hotel. And at one occasion the front desk said to me "we are europian company " I go to europe a lot and never faced anything like this there.  I would never stay there again and never refer this hotel to anyone. price of the hotel is about 120 to 140 a night now , not what we paid for at christmas and new year. that was way overpriced and not worth it.

title: Rien à dire, parfait !
text: Accueil chaleureux (le personnel toujours sympa et disponible), hôtel moderne impeccable de propreté, plateau de courtoisie dans les chambres (ça c'est cool), un super rooftop. Et pour ne rien gâcher, idéalement situé dans Times square. Franchement en plus de la folie de New York, on ne peut que recommander !

title: excellent restaurant, great service!
text: If you can get an upgraded room, go for it. The space is well worth it. Front desk staff are really accommodating and helpful. Location is good, just a few steps from the subway, and not directly on Times Square but really close so you have some semblance of peace vs being right on Times Square. The tapas restaurant at the hotel lobby is excellent -- definite must try!

title: Cancelled my reservation with no explanation
text:
I reserved (and pre-paid) a room for a single night for this hotel. They cancelled my reservation this morning without stating a reason. The only message (sent via email) was, "this reservation has been cancelled".

Wow. I would not recommend reserving this hotel. As a frequent traveler, I have never had a hotel cancel a reservation on me -- let alone one that I pre-paid for!

title: Overnight in NYC
text: Professional pleasant staff...very clean, great location,  close to all Broadway theaters and Boqueria is a great restaurant on site...Rooftop Bar is nice added attraction also,  would definitely stay again

title: Très bien situé
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé à Times Square. Proche de tout dans Manhattan.
En plus sa vue en roof top sur l’Empire State Bulding est imprenable!!!!
Hôtel que je conseille vivement pour ceux qui souhaitent être dans le coeur de NY

title: Quiet Zzzzzz
text: So clean and quiet!  Fast elevator service.  Perfectly located for subway access.  Walking distance to shopping, theatre, restaurants, etc. Shower was so awesome and clean.  Fun room lighting. Attached restaurant yummily fabulous!

title: Poor Management
text: I am a frequent traveler for both business and pleasure. I read a lot of reviews but never take the time to write any, but I was so insulted with the lack of courtesy from management at this hotel. You are nothing but a number to them, I was kept on hold trying to resolve an issue for over an hour before I was told there was nothing they could do for me. This was an issue with a change of plans due to business but still, why keep a customer on hold and keep asking for more information for over an hour just to say, no, nothing we can do for you. Very rude & disrespectful. I have stayed in many wonderful NY hotels that value customers, never again AC!

title: Great find
text:
Great value for money in a great location close to Times Square but far enough to be away from the madness.
Clean sufficient rooms, lovely roof top bar and excellent tapas restaurant where we had some of the best food in NY with friendly efficient service.
Quick check in and check out.
Noisy ac/heating which we had an engineer out to get it working but sadly did nt stop the intermittent noise of it switching on and off through the night. Did nt bother us but could potentially annoy others.
Also no info in room at all so had to work out what number to dial for front desk.
All said would definitely recommend for future travellers who want a good standard well positioned hotel with superb restaurant attached.

title: Great location and comfortable stay
text: The location of this hotel is on W. 40 St. & 8 Avenue which makes this an ideal location for both leisure and business travelers, as it is near Port Authority, Penn Station and 42nd street subway station that also connects you to the S train to go across town.  It is also within walking distance to Times Square, but far enough so you are not in the middle of the chaos.  Walking distance to the theaters, wonderful restaurants and shopping in the area.  There is a Dean & Delucca directly across the street.  The rooms are modern and comfortable.  I also enjoyed the roof top bar, which would probably be amazing in the warmer months.  Staff was also very friendly.

title: Modern hotel with a touch of class
text: If you are looking for a modern and charming hotel, this place is for you. Most of the rooms have the whole whole wall from floor to ceiling so that you have the view of the city, but it comes with a motorized curtain for privacy as well. For charming touch, they give out lavender pouches during the evening as a turndown service.

title: Great stay. So-so check in experience
text: My brother and I stayed for 3 nights and the property was great! Very clean throughout; modern. It’s about a block from all the activity and lights of Times Square and and bus terminal. Huge windows that you’re able to open. Also, a big screen smart tv. For the most part the staff was fantastic. Very caring and friendly. The reason I’m giving it 4 stars and not 5 is because of my check in experience. We arrived in the lobby with our bags and waited in line behind the family was checking in ahead of us. There was another front desk agent and another, I assume manager/ supervisor, behind her. He shouted “next guest” multiple times while my brother and I were trying to gather our belongings to head to the teller. After handing the young lady my credentials she tossed them on the counter top and handed me the keys and sent us on our way. Not giving us any information about the property, not to enjoy our stay, how to access the internet or anything. Didn’t even point us in the direction of the elevators. After we walked around the lobby for a few seconds we found them. Still, great hotel and most staff are nice. Everyone’s experience is different. It was really just those minor nuances that can make it break your stay.

title: Excellent value and good service but everything is  brown.
text: The less than $200 rate for a Thursday night In the middle of everything was too good to pass up and the reviews were excellent so I gave this hotel a try. I received an upgrade as a result of my Elite status and got a very large room with a sofa and sizeable bathroom.  The modern bathroom is beautiful and the room itself is extremely functional with a nice desk, plugs everywhere, good hairdryer, nice area to open my luggage, good lighting and — last but not least — great crisp sheets and feather pillows. The vinyl wood flooring was also a nice change from carpet. My biggest complaint? Everything, and I do mean everything, is a shade of depressing brown, with not a single splash of color anywhere. I really suggest putting some fake plant life in the room just to make it less drab. Also, there was no room service but that is to be expected at this price point. The gym was nice except there is no full length mirror so you can’t see yourself doing certain exercises. The Spanish restaurant did have nice croissants for breakfast.  I wish the hotel’s  grab and go had fruit. I did not have a chance to check out the cool rooftop bar as this was a quick trip. My conclusion is that this hotel is an excellent value and spotlessly clean with good service, but luxurious it is not. And if you need room service so you can stay on your room to do work, this is not the place to stay.  Next time I’m buying flowers to cheer up the place.

title: Good location and modern hotel
text:
I stayed here for 5 days on a business trip. The hotel is very modern and clean. It is well located for all the touristy bits. The main reason I stayed was one minute walk to my office.

The rooms are pretty small even for NY standards. You walk in and are almost standing on the bed. My room was located directly opposite the lift so could be a little loud at night with people coming back. Housekeeping is not the best here. Most days my towels were not done and I never had toilet paper replaced. On my final day I actually had to go and ask house keeping for toilet paper after they cleaned my room. The room has plenty of plug sockets and USB plugs. The lighting isn't great and you need to use your bed lamps. The TV is very large and there is quite a bit of wardrobe space. The actual bed is large and very comfortable. 

The wifi is good in all areas of the hotel. The roof top bar is not great and but you do get a free drink token when you check in. The gym is pretty good for a small hotel.

All in all, I would stay here again for business due to the location to my office. But not so sure I would stay for a personal holiday as it's not quite up to scratch for that.

title: I really enjoyed my stay.
text:
I recently stayed here for four days, and here are my observations:
1.  The location is excellent.  It is a 10-15 minute walk from Penn Station directly up 8th Avenue.  It is close to the New York Public Library, Bryant Park, and, according to my daughter who lives in NYC,  many trains.  It is obviously near 100's of fine restaurants, but cheap places like Dunkin Doughnuts and Kiss My Slice, are a minute's walk.  
2.  Check-in was a touch slow, but the clerk was friendly and gave us water and a complimentary drink ticket.  
3.  My room is very sleek and modern with a large window facing 40th Street.  I don't really like the sliding glass door for the bathroom.  It saves space, but it does not afford privacy.  I wish the room had an overhead light.  The shower is fantastic.
4.  The exercize room is located below the lobby, and it is very nice.  The bikes seem a bit balky, but you have many choices.
5.  The elevators really zoom, but I periodically forgot to use my room key, and the elevator will not move without it.  It is a good safety feature.
6.  I did not visit the rooftop bar, but my daughter and I had had drinks in the tapas restaurant in the lobby.  It is a touch swanky for me, but the beer was excellent and the server polite and friendly.
      I hope to stay here again.

title: Clean, new and hip
text:
You feel the vibe the minute you walk through the large revolving door.  The bell staff right there to greet you.  The front desk staff, welcoming and professional.   We arrived on a red eye flight from the West Coast - they were able to check us in early although we were prepared to check our bags in case the room wasn’t ready.
Sat in the comfy lobby, thumbing through some cool art books that were on the table. (My hotel protege would’ve loved this if he were alive today) 
The room was spotless - Top to bottom.   The bed was super comfy and equipped with amazing Marriott pillows.   I slept like a baby both nights.   
The bathroom & shower well appointed - nice soaps and shampoos.   Love the complimentary waters and nice little fridge. 
We ate breakfast both days in the adjacent restaurant Boqueria.  Some of the best food we had in NYC.  We’ll be doing a separate review for them.   
Nice job AC - I love this European Marriot concept.   It’s clean, fresh & hip and the staff pulled that off nicely.

title: Brand new hotel
text: New hotel and you can feel it. (in a good way). Modern rooms, enough room, good beds and shower. The adjacent hotel restaurant for tapas is really good. Don't forget the rooftop bar. Great view and beautiful outdoor too. Staff is perfect!

title: Location, yes, Staff, double yes
text: With a somewhat new establishment there are kinks to be worked out and the staff I interacted with absolutely met the challenge. Members of management that I interacted with have set the standard for staff responsiveness.  The midtown location is ideal. Great for tourists as well as business.

title: Hôtel neuf et situé au cœur de Times Square
text:
Nous avons passé 3 nuits dans cet hôtel récent (ouverture en Avril 2018), idéalement situé: moins de 10 min à pied pour rejoindre l’Empire State Building, les théâtres de Broadway et le quartier euphorique de Times Square!!!
Les chambres sont spacieuses et offrent tout le confort nécessaire. Allez boire un verre au 21eme étage, sur le roof top avec une vue imprenable sur l’empire State building!!!
Le personnel est vraiment aux petits soins. Je recommande vivement!!!

title: Great hotel away from the hordes
text:
We stayed at the AC Hotel January 26/27.  We are Marriott Platinum and the room was available for half the points of the Marquis or other properties.  Very happy with our stay. The staff was excellent, even to the point of a maintance person stopping what she was doing to key in the elevator for me.  We arrived early and they checked our bags so we could go walk around.  The location is excellent - away from all the Times Square insanity but only a few blocks away.  We walked from Penn Station - 6 short blocks.  Port Authority is at the end of the street.  The hotel is very clean and modern, not over-decorated, and has a comfortable, bright lobby.  Our room was on the 19th floor and had a perfect view of the Empire State Building! We didn't eat at either of the restaurants but I appreciated the little coffee maker in the room so I could make tea. The room was clean and comfortable, but the best part was the engineered-wood floors!  No scuzzy disgusting hotel carpeting where you get your socks black just by walking on it.  I expect the hard surfacing is also a plus for anyone with allergies, as well.  So much easier to keep clean and sanitary.  Rooms are very well-insulated - there was a group with teenagers on our floor, but did not hear a peep while in the room.  

Nice big shower with both a "rain" shower head as well as a hand-held type. USB outlets on both sides of the bed as well as the desk.  Oh, AND THE WINDOW OPENS! 

This hotel is a find.  I will plan future trips to NYC around their availability.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: First time staying in NYC and received the best hotel service I have ever had. We were able to check in early and kindly ask if an upgrade to a room with a view was possible and they generously offered. The staff politely always answered questions even if they may not have fully known the answers but they mostly did. Even when we missed out on the lavender bags at night, staff member, Alan, went above and beyond to get us a few lavender bags before we left. The hotel was super clean, relaxing, and beautiful! Wish I had made it to the rooftop before leaving. Overall, the experience was wonderful, location is great, and would definitely go back to stay there again.

title: Excellent new hotel near Time Square
text:
AC Hotel is a very nice new boutique near Time Square. Right across the street of the New York Time Building. Perfect for business or tourist.

Spacious, clean and new rooms. Nice big TV. You will have everything you need. 24-hour gym and a nice Spanish tapas restaurant Boqueria at the property. Very nice roof top bar.

Good service and friendly staff. This will be my go-to hotel next time in town.

title: Front desk Alexis was awesome
text: let me first say this I am huge when it comes to customer service and the level of service I got from Alexis was absolutely amazing she was fast she was courteous and more over her energy was inviting I always say that when you leave your home to come to a hotel hopefully your experience is great she made everything super . I also want to commend Shanice who help check me as well  these two are a breath of fresh air. I really love the rooms they are absolutely clean as I am a neat freak very posh and the level of service the second to none I recommend that you check out the bar on the top floor which was very surprising to me when I first entered the waiters the staff also we’re just warm. I am a huge hotel snob and this hotel is now at the top of my list of great hotels in New York

title: Amazing Stay!!!  Best hotel in Times Square.  Carolynn was amazing!!!!!!!
text: Amazing hotel experience.  Carolynn checked me in early after a really bad experience at Intercontinental Times Square Hotel.  The staff here at AC was amazing.  Everything was clean on my arrival and overall great experience.  Modern and clean rooms are a plus in NYC.  Room 810 was great with an awesome view.  Stayed again two days later and room was average cleaning but Carolynn was there and welcomed me back.

title: Mrs Sorensen
text: I was absolutely pleased with a costumer service provided by Lynn Romes . I am resident of Boston, my daughter in college Washington DC. Dec23 my daughter b-day..It’s a traditional spend a day in NYC  And unfortunately I was late to met my daughter on time... I was frantic, desperate . I called AC hotel let them know my daughter will check in before me, but reservations under my name.. and I don’t want her to wait for me in a local shop. Respond from Lynn was amazing! She said “Mrs Sorensen, no worries, we will take care of everything “ .... And she did , we had a fantastic stay. Room was very enjoyable and clean:)

title: スタイリッシュな都会的なホテル
text:
タイムズスクエア、ペンステーション、ポートオーソリティバスステーション、どこへも徒歩圏内で大変便利な立地でした。
ＪＦＫ空港へは、ペンステーションからLRIR(ロングアイランドレール）を使えば、地下鉄よりも早いし、地上を走るので景色も楽しめるし、地下鉄よりも空いているしで、大変便利。
ホテル自体は、最新のオフィスビルのようなスタイリッシュさ。おしゃれ、スタイリッシュ、無機質、清潔、そんな言葉が合うのでしょうか。
とにかく、大変、快適に過ごせました。
周辺には、デリやコンビニも多く、ちょっとした食事にも便利でした。

早くに着いたのですが、部屋が空いているからと、12時頃にはチェックインをさせてくれて、融通も効かせてくれてうれしかったです。

title: Very good option for Broadway area
text: Hotel is newish which means rooms are modern and still in great condition - albeit on the small side (but standard for nyc standards). Check in was seamless and professional. The staff were welcoming and friendly from the door to the reception.  The adjacent Boqueria was a huge plus a great tapas scene and bar. Beware it gets VERY busy in the evening. It was cold and rainy so we did not utilize the rooftop bar. Go elsewhere for breakfast - the boqueria has breakfast but is outrageously overpriced and limited options. Also avoid the Dean & Deluca across the street - it’s awful (dirty, and terrible service). The location is ideal for the Broadway area - walkable to the theatres and a few blocks from the tourist trap that is time square!

title: Lovely hotel, great location!
text: Absolutely loved this hotel. Staff was courteous, helpful and just full of pleasantries! The location if amazing you can pretty much walk anywhere in midtown from here. The rooms are modern and very well appointed and I loved the blackout screens!

title: Great location to subways and Times Square
text:
This newer hotel in Times Square is always clean and the staff is overly helpful and kind.  Rooms are clean and typical size for NYC.  Great for business.  Lots of food options both in and around the hotel.  Rooftop bar is always fun.

I had a billing error which the hotel front desk was quick to address and ensure resolution.  Kudos to Sharon and the team at the AC.

title: Super Staff
text: We had a wonderful 4 night stay in this new property with a quieter location, and yet  walking distance to Times Square. Every staff member we encountered was incredibly helpful and a special thank you to Chris Lamarche for being very accommodating so we could have a truly memorable stay.

title: Just came up a little short
text:
Stayed at the new AC Hotel NYC.  The hotel is beautiful and the rooftop bar/restaurant is awesome.  Great midtown location. 

Rooms are new, clean and beautiful. Location is quiet.  Only room negative is the blinds, it’s either 100 % dark or wide open floor to ceiling windows.  Need shades 

I checked in at 3:30 PM and asked for an upgrade based on LTPPEAMBADSSADOR status.   My profile says high floor away from elevator.  Lynn said she had me taken care of after I asked for an upgrade.  NOT- room on 12 of 20 and facing the NYT building.   Ask for the manager to upgrade or use the Marriott Ambassador.  No recognition of my status and 175 nights in a Marriott last year.   Could have done better.

title: Great Location, Great Staff
text: We stayed here over 12/27-12/30 and were very pleased with the location and property, in general.  It seems like a new hotel, and everything is pristine.  The lobby is very bright and modern but also welcoming.  We enjoyed our complementary champagne at the rooftop bar and our room had floor to ceiling windows.  It was a little tight for four, but we were expecting this in NYC.  Service was excellent and attentive, and a snafu of being charged for umbrellas that we had returned was straightened out right away.  Being steps away from the theatre district made this a great choice for us. I hope to return someday.

title: Poor customer service
text:
Dear Ari, I have not heard anything back from you despise numerous emails to GM email and phone calls to receiption for You to return my call or anyone in management 

I would like to express my feedback from my current stay at your hotel.

I have been coming to New York for the past five years during the Christmas and new year period and also it is my birthday today, nevertheless the usual hotel I opt to stay in was fully booked for the the dates specified dates.

1) TV remote not working 
2) no bottled water this morning ( this is a standard for any Marriott regardless if it is a sister company) as I have to take medication in morning.
3) no plug adaptor ( in an international city like New York you’d expect guests from all over the world who have different plug sockets in their home nation. Even a standard 2 star hotel has this.
4) no scissors available? 
5)corridors smell of cannabis on 15th floor
6) rude hotel staff especially SHANICE

title: Great central location steps to 42nd st
text:
Great location which is steps to Time Square. Really close to many many restaurants and activities, even Broadway show. 
$1 pizza slices about 100 ft over from hotel is really good pizza for a great price!
Hotel has very nice comfortable modern rooms. Typically small rooms but well appointed with comfortable beds. 
Wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.

title: Great Location, better staff
text:
Proximity to Times Square is great (no view over the square) only a few min walk. The rooms can fill a little cramped if your staying for a while but offer everything you would expect, modern bathroom (good shower pressure) comfy bed and a huge TV. 
- stayed in two rooms on of the 15th floor (smaller) and one the 18th(huge) if you can afford the bigger room on a higher floor stretch to it. It is definitely worth the extra bucks.

The staff here are excellent. They are friendly and happy to help with anything. If they read this a massive thank you to them for a great stay.

title: Excellent experience in centrally located new property
text: We had a wonderful stay at the a/c hotel. upon arrival we were treated to champagne at the rooftop bar. The staff were consistently accommodating and warm. Our room was spacious and clean. Our experience with this hotel made our night in Manhattan extra special!

title: New modern hotel in a great location
text: Stayed at this hotel on a last minute trip to NYC. Brand new hotel close to Times Square but far enough so that it was quiet at night. Front desk staff was great. Rooms were new and clean, though small. But bathroom was spacious with a good size shower. Definitely more better than 3.5 star! And the price was great for the holiday weekend. Just a note- had a room w 2 double beds - they were full beds, so if there are 4 of you (like us), you will be close!

title: Avrei messo ZERO.
text: Sono ancora in hotel. Una settimana a nyc. Oggi è il mio quinto giorno qui, esco ogni giorno alle 8 del mattino, torno in hotel alle 18/19 giusto il tempo di fare una doccia, riposare e uscire di nuovo, TUTTI i giorni ho trovato alle 6pm la cameriera che faceva la camera, TUTTI i giorni devo aspettare fuori dalla camera per mezz’ora, tutti i giorni ho fatto presente questo disagio e tutti i giorni mi è stato promesso che non sarebbe più accaduto e che la camera sarebbe stata rifatta nelle DIECI ore in cui era libera. Oggi, sono le 6:15, sono in una camera non fatta, la cameriera non si vede e tra un’ora e mezza dovrei uscire. Come non avere una camera d’albergo.

title: Overall Average
text:
Overall I would rate this as average, probably contrary to most reviewers here. Would have liked a better rooms as Marriott gold member (which is essentially worthless now since the merger). 

Plus:
- clean, modern Euro feel
- staff was very welcoming
- comfy beds
- good shower
- location (relative to subway, TS)

Minus:
- very small rooms
- surcharge for additional persons
- room serviced too late in day 
- Ice machine is incredibly annoying to use
- noisy, both outside (3rd floor room) & neighbor/halls
- window shades are PITA and super noisy
- location (too close to bus terminal)

title: Hotelazo muy bien situado
text:
Hotel espectacular por todo; decoración actual,sobria y elegante. Instalaciones nuevas. Ubicación inmejorable a 3 minutos andando de times square. Tiendas, restaurantes, bocas de metro, estación de autobuses port authority a 4 pasos, estación de tren penn station (madison square garden) a 10 min andando. 
En la planta 21 está el bar/restaurante con un mirador espectacular al empire.
La habitación es amplia y completamente equipada (plancha y tabla de planchar) la cama muy grande y comodísima. Muy bien insonorizada. 
Tiene conexiones usb en varios puntos de la habitación por lo que no es necesario el adaptador de enchufe para cargar los móviles.
El personal súper atento y profesional.

title: Great location, Excellent Service and New Hotel
text:
This hotel is awesome! Very short cab ride from Penn Station and MSG. Short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, shopping and restaurants. Easy access to the subway. 
The staff is very friendly, the bellman is very helpful with providing options for transportation to the airport, the car service was perfect. The front desk staff was very friendly as well. 
The only disappointment was the staff at the rooftop bar, they had been short staffed the evening we tried to grab a drink and a appetizer, so we did not stay. 
The restaurant adjacent to the hotel made up for the lack of service at the rooftop bar. The menu, drinks, service and atmosphere was excellent. 
The hotel is new, rooms are clean and spacious for the city. 
I will return to this hotel and recommend.

title: Christmas 18 Visit
text: A really nice hotel in mid town Manhatton, very close to Times Square. The hotel is modern, well appointed, clean and hospitable. The rooms are typical business style rooms, very clean and modern although not huge. The batroom is again very clean and modern with an excellent shower. The in room tea and coffee was a bit hit and miss with daily stocking up but supplies were always available from reception. Would definately recommend for location, cleanliness and modern facilities.

title: Couldn’t have been more perfect
text:
From the moment we arrived until the second we left everyone and everything was perfect.  The room with floor to ceiling windows make the room seem so much larger.  Bed and shower all new with that contemporary vibe.  Being a Platinum Elite member, I travel a lot, this was an hidden secret that turned out perfectly.  We will be back.
Laurie B
Lookout Mountain, Ga.

title: Fabulous
text: It was fabulous.  We had issues with the TV which they promptly fixed. Everyone was polite and attentive.  Very nice and the price and location couldn't be beat. The room was HUGE by NYC standards.  We even had a view. It was $200/ night which was super cheap by NYC times square standards.

title: Very Happy with my Stay!
text: Just stayed at the property a couple of nights ago for one night. Had two rooms, one of them with points. Room decor is minimalist, bathroom very modern. The best part of it? The hotel is new, inaugurated just this last April. Service couldnt have been nicer! In a 24 hrs time period I received a couple of texts from hotel staff asking if everything was going ok. Had never had that in any other hotel stay! Dont miss visiting the rooftop lounge, fabulous view of the Empire State building , plus lovely service!I had a room on the 5th floor, facing 40th street. No problem with noise whatsoever. Highly recommend this hotel, great price point for what you get.

title: Amazing Service by Chris Astudillo
text: I never wrote any review to any services, hotels, airlines, restaurants, etc. This is the first time I am writing this because the service Chris Astudillo has provided is truly exceptional. We have a guest staying in the hotel and he has problems with his emails because he's traveling from another country. We have some documents we need to send to him by tonight, 12/21/2018. We called the hotel and Chris helped us get the documents and print them all out and send to the guest room in a timely fashion. He's very responsive and very pleasant to work with. He truly has given me the peace of mind knowing my guest will get all these document tonight. Thank you so much Chris!! Also, I want to thank the young lady who gave me Chris's email address. She repeated it patiently twice with me since it was quite long and I am not a native English speaker. Excellent service!! Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

title: Wonderful location
text:
This hotel is a fabulous location, close to so many attractions.
The staff is tremendous.They sent a text during my stay to assure that my family was well taken care of.Nice touch.
  We will absolutely stay there again.

title: Bien situado y muy nuevo
text:
El hotel se nota que está recién reformado. 
La habitación era de tamaño normal con un ventanal enorme con vistas a The New York Times. Bastante bien insonorizado.
Las camas comodísimas, con almohadas suficientes.
El baño con suficientes amenities y toallas, a destacar la escasa fuerza de la ducha al salir el agua como algo mejorable.
La calefacción suena una barbaridad cuando se enciende, de hecho por la noche me despertaba y tuve que apagarla.
Los desayunos con alimentos de calidad aunque poca variedad. Tardaban mucho en servirte si pedías huevos o algo que no estuviera ya preparado.

El personal muy amable y profesional.

title: アクセス抜群です
text: ほぼ新築でとてもきれい。近所には飲食店多数。特におすすめは地下鉄入り口付近にあるピザ屋です。ホテルから徒歩1分。ミュージカルで夜遅くなっても治安はまったく問題ありません。スタッフも若くてとても親切です。

title: Excellent
text: Hôtel très bien situé à 5min à pieds de Times Square. Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres. Le service est au niveau du standing. Il y a un magnifique bar sur le rooftop pour boire un verre. Le restaurant le boqueria au rez de chaussee est très bien pour le petit dej ou plus. Je vous le recommande excellent rapport qualité prix.

title: Many Positive Aspects:  Modern Design, Great Location
text:
This hotel has many positive aspects and is in a great location for theater-goers and those seeking a midtown address away from the craziness. These include: contemporary, unfussy design; super quiet room (14th floor); fridge; welcoming front desk personnel; comfortable bed; Korres bath products; rain shower.

In room amenities include what one needs to make one c. black tea and one c. herbal, one coffee, and one decaf coffee. But Cremora? Horrible! At least supply non-refrigerated milk, now widely available. 

Platinum Marriott rewards members may be disappointed to get no included breakfast at the attached Boqueria Restaurant. That’s how it goes w/Marriott and its U.S. A/C properties. For the price many will pay, it would be a plus to include at least a hot beverage and a croissant.  Coffee from a pod was available on the lobby, but at $3.50/cup this seems worse than nickel-and-diming.

Overall, the stay is very nice- kind of like a modernized, upscale Courtyard with Euro touches. With a rack rate over $550/night on the night we were there, I wish the powers that be would ditch the dreaded Cremora and perhaps add a few flourishes, like a Spanish chocolate on the pillow or something else that says, “Welcome.”

title: 'Modern Basic'
text: Location is close to Broadway shows and Times Square.  Rooms have a modern, but inexpensive, decor.  The place is good for a one or two night stay.  Housekeeping is very slow to respond.  I think the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Central on 42nd Street is a nicer hotel for the same price.

title: A TRULY CENTRAL HOTEL
text:
I have been visiting/staying at this hotel several dozens of times. It is a good hotel but time is passing and it starts to need some maintenance especially in bathtubs. Mine was absolutely far from perfect.
Also, the pick-up and taxi stand need some attention. Unless you are ready to give a conspicuous tip you risk missing your flight.

title: موقع ممتاز جدااا
text:
سكنت في هذا الفندق خلال زيارتي لنيويورك وكان خيار ممتاز جدا.
الفندق جديد واللي يميزه انه قريب جدا جدا من التايمز سكوير والمنطقة اللي تحته حيه طوال اليوم.
الغرف كبير ونظيفة واطلالتها كانت جميلة.
الموظفين وتعاملهم كان ممتاز.

title: Very rude supervisor
text:
My girlfriend arrived and checked in earlier than me. I had already put her name on the reservation but the desk staff couldn’t find it. So the reception supervisor, Sharon, came over and started berating my girlfriend and wouldn’t even let her explain! All the other desk staff just froze and my girlfriend was humiliated! It’s unbelievable for any hotel staff to talk this way to a guest let alone a reception supervisor.

Luckily, another desk staff, Chris, stepped in and helped. My girlfriend got me on the phone and Chris calmly took my information down and found the reservation. And lo and behold, her name WAS on there so it was just a simple mixup and miscommunication. It was so easily resolved by Chris, but the supervisor Sharon should be fired instead for not even trying to help but instead treating a guest with humiliation!

The rest of the stay was very nice, the room was clean and well designed and my favorite was the walk-in shower with rainfall shower-head. And our breakfast the next morning at the restaurant downstairs was splendid!

This should’ve been 5 stars but because of a horrible supervisor, the whole stay was almost ruined.

title: Estada excelente!!!
text:
Estivemos no Hotel entre 01/11/2018 a 10/11/2018 e nossa estada foi excelente!!!
Reservamos um quarto para 3 pessoas, com duas camas de casal. O quarto tem um tamanho muito bom, decoração moderna, piso vinílico, sem carpetes, o que considero importante porque eu e meu filho temos rinite alérgica... O serviço de limpeza e arrumação também é muito bom!!! O banheiro também tem um bom espaço e o box é grande. Tudo funcionou muito bem, desde chuveiro, iluminação, ar condicionado!!
Os funcionários da recepção são muito educados e prestativos, embora não falássemos inglês, foram muito prestativos, falando um pouco de espanhol para que pudéssemos compreender!  A localização é excelente, muito perto da Times Square, da Brodway, Bryant Park, restaurantes da 8a. Avenida!!! Recomendo muito!!!

title: Excelente Ubicación
text: Muy bien ubicado para quienes buscan una opción cerca de todo. Habitaciones amplias para la medidas standard de New York. WIFI gratis y de buena calidad. Si envías paquetes el costo es de 1 dólar x libra de peso (1kg: 2.2libras) la atención del personal es excelente. Las instalaciones son nuevas. Recomendable.

title: My Second Home - Best Hotel Ever!
text:
I have been staying here every week for months - the staff will know who I am. I remember staying here since it opened and I am always pleasantly surprised with the incredible people who work here, the design, hotel cleanliness, space, modern touch, rooftop, restaurant, and all of their amenities. 

Staff:
To Lynn, Sharon, Jeremy, David, Benny, Sofia, Ricardo, Angelo and the many others whose names escape me right now - THANK YOU. Every time I stay with you, you guys make me feel like I'm at home. From upgrading my rooms, to helping me with my bags, directions, food recs, and more, you always make me feel so comfortable and at home. I was sick one day, and Lynn and Sharon sent cookies, water bottles, lavender pouches and a sweet card to my room! So kind.

Design:
The architecture and modern design is beautiful and the hotel is one of my favourite in the city. New York can be super daunting in how big everything is. This modern marble with hints of greenery hotel is beautifully designed and you'll feel super relaxed.

Rooftop & Restaurant:
Check out the rooftop and the restaurant which are both gorgeous. Order the "Pulpo" or grilled octopus at Boqueria - so good! Miguel at Boqueria is the coolest barman too - he'll hook you up!

Location:
Times Square and 1 min (not even) away from the subway, and NY Port Authority (buses). Perfectly well located! 

Extras:
Lavender pouches are given to guests and eucalyptus towels to relax. 

I honestly can go on and on about this hotel. You have to check it out. If you're platinum - try one of the suites either with the balcony or the ones with large windows with James Bond blinds. Amazing.

title: Absolutely wonderful!
text: Modern hotel offering clean, spacious rooms.  Extremely friendly staff on all shifts.  Fast elevators.  Just steps from the subway entrance.  Inviting lobby.  Excellent onsite restaurant. My new favorite hotel in New York City.

title: Simple and Simply Fantastic!
text:
The AC Hotel is a gem of a find.  Right off of Broadway - not a crazy lobby.  Rooms are simple and just what you need.  Close to everything.  

I’m not one to give out 5 stars unless an establishment ‘checks’ off all the boxes.  AC Hotel checks ‘em all!  

This is a definite add to the MRL!  (Maria’s Return List)

Happy Travels

title: Para repetir
text:
Lo tiene todo!nuevo, moderno y muy bien ubicado. Las habitaciones bien insonorizadas, con reposición diaria de botellas de agua.
Por ponerle un pero, estábamos en la planta 14 y la presión de la ducha era floja.
Volveremos!

title: Quality Basic Hotel
text: Spent one night here in November before moving over to The Langham (that was booked that evening). First time staring at an AC Brand Hotel and I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby was activated and the staff friendly. The location was prime but set back from the craze of Times Square. We were upgraded to a city view room that had nice large windows that faces towards the NYT building. The room was cozy, but have everything you need. I personally liked how the entire room was flooring and not carpet. Made it feel larger and modern. The bathroom had a great shower head and korres brand products. My only complaint was the breakfast at Boqueria. The service was terrible and the food even worse. Stay away from there and head to another spot in the city to eat. On the contrary to Castell rooftop which had great drinks with awesome views. So to summarize, great spot to rest your head in an excellent location.

title: Mostly pleasant stay with a few issues
text:
First Impression: I like the layout of the lobby. High ceilings, spacious, pleasing to the eye. I walked up to the desk to check in, the two desk associates (man and woman) were involved in happy chat and didn't pay me any attention even though I was standing there with a large suitcase and made direct eye contact with the man who went right on with his conversation. So I said "Hi, is this where I check in?" The man, who's name is  Christopher, replies, "yea, what's your last name"? I have to tell you, I have stayed at many Marriotts (I'm a rewards member) and this is definitely the worst welcome I ever received which is surprising considering this is New York City. 

So anyway, the elevators were fast and well lit, the room was clean with a simple yet modern decor. The television was pretty large for a hotel and the bed was very comfortable. 

On my second night, I went out for dinner and Ricardo was very helpful in getting me a cab and making sure everyone in the lobby was taken care of. He's awesome. There was also a woman with blond curly hair who was also very attentive and pleasant. I regret that I didn't get her name. 

I was disappointed that the TV didn't always work. It would be a scramble of pixels with audio. I tried calling the front desk about it but there was no instructions on how to dial the front desk and dialing "0" and even dialing the general number for the hotel got me nowhere. I ended up watching Netflix on my phone. At least the wifi worked. 

Upon checkout, I was ignored yet again by Christopher and helped by Sharon who I told about the TV issue and showed the picture I took. She seemed genuinely concerned and apologetic and asked me to email the picture to her which I did right on the spot. After checkout, Ricardo once again held the door opened and offered to help with transportation. The next day, Sharon sent an email apologizing once again for the TV issue and assuring me that they are addressing it. I appreciated that very much.

Given the inconsistent customer service and the price, I would likely consider a different option if ever I need to stay in the city for work. I've grown accustomed to a certain level of service from Marriott that just missed the mark in areas where it's too easy to get it right (like stop your conversation and attend to arriving guests) . This is what kept me from rating this hotel a 4 or 5 though the potential is definitely there. 

I should also mention that my colleagues thought the rooftop bar was great though I didn't get a chance to make it up there. Also a prime location in the heart of the times square action.

title: Una estancia de 10 gracias a Alexis, una recepcionista del hotel que nos hizo la estancia inolvidable.
text: Estuvimos hospedadas en el hotel 10 dias. Con respecto a las instalaciones, el hotel está genial, pero tiene que mejorar la presión de la ducha, la limpieza de las habitaciones y los atascos del inodoro, un problema que fue frecuente durante nuestra estancia. Las habitaciones no podían ser más confortables y las camas comodísimas. El hotel está muy bien situado para conocer la ciudad. Pero lo mejor de nuestra estancia sin lugar a dudas fue haber conocido a Alexis. Ella fue la que estuvo pendiente de nosotras en todo momento y solucionándonos cualquier problema que nos pudiese surgir. La verdad es que como persona y profesional no tenemos palabras para describirla, es impresionante su eficacia en su trabajo y como se preocupa por los huéspedes. Si volvemos a Nueva York, iremos a este hotel pero sobretodo por Alexis.

title: A home away from home
text: We stayed for 7 nights. Special thanks to Stephanie and Rodica for arranging last minute airport pick up. It a  brand new property walking distance from Times Square,  tucked away in a small street with no noice. Has a lovely bar on (I think) on 22 floor. Its one of the hotels in NYC with floor to roof windows. The front desk staff is extremly helpful and make you feel at home. Next to the hotel is a great cafe where I used to buy my coffee every morning - dont waste your time going to Dean and Deluca across the road. The hotel has a nice lobby where you can sit and work. Will stay again on the next visit.

title: 깔끔함.
text:
9박정도 했는데 새로 리뉴얼해서 그런지 깔끔했음. 
타임스퀘어 주변이라 전철도 타기 쉽고 거의 갈아타지않고 다녀서 편했음. 
버스터미널도 가까워서 교외로 나갈때 편했음. 하지만 버스터미널이라 호텔을 빼놓은 그 주변은 굉장히 더러움. 홈리스도 좀 보이고 호텔 정문을 나가자마자 바퀴벌레가 보임 ㅋ
호텔 시설은 깔끔하고 다 신식이었음. 수압도 나쁘지 않았음. 타임스퀘어 주변이라 그런지 시끄러운건 어쩔수없음. 친절함은 느끼지 못함. 9박이나 머무는데도 배려없이 엘리베이터 옆에 방을 배정해줌.. 너무 시끄러웠음.
루프탑 바에서 와인마시는데 테라스에 앉았더니 계속 벌레가 컵에 들어감.. 말했더니 벌레만 빼줌.. ㅋ 무난한 호텔 이었음.

title: Great location, price, and staff
text: We stayed at the AC Nov 10 -12 2018 and had a great experience.  The Hotel is not right in the middle of Times Square which is a bonus, I think.  It is about a block away which is perfect as you don't have to deal with all the noise and crowds.  The room was modern and seemed to be recently renovated.  Loved the wood (or maybe laminate?) flooring as it seemed really clean.  The bathrooms are modern and updated, rain-fall or regular shower head, nice amenities, regular size hair dryer.  The room was equipped with a coffee maker, mini fridge. charging port and a large TV (though we never turned it on).  We ate at Boqueria which was a great tapas restaurant in the hotel and also had a drink at the rooftop lounge.  My favorite part of the hotel, though, was the staff who were friendly and helpful.  That doesn't always happen in NYC!

title: Good hotel, nice staff
text: My wife and I stayed here in September.  It was a good location and the rooms were nice.  We also liked that there was a restaurant and bar on the roof (half indoor/half outdoor).  The hotel was close to the theaters so the walk was easy.  The price was pretty competitive compared to other hotels.  There is nothing cheap in NY so you just have to compare to other hotel prices.  There was not place to put our car so we paid about $60 per night to valet our car.  No idea where they put it.

title: Wonderful Location, Clean Rooms, Lovely Staff
text: My wife and I went into NYC for 3 days to see friends and go to shows and selected the AC here because of the location which turned out to be spectacular. The rooms are simple and very good. Our room 1708 had a nice view for a NY hotel. Linens were very nice as were the towels. The rooms had plenty of plugs for all the tech we travel with today. I don't care for any of the Marriott properties shampoos, lotions, etc because it's ridiculously difficult to get the contains out. SPG hotels are much better. The guy downstairs is delightful with plenty of equipment. Great location, clean rooms, and nice people make this AC worth staying at.

title: Best stay ever!
text: My husband and I traveled to NYC for my 40th birthday last weekend.  It was our first trip away from the kids.  We had a BLAST.  But, the best part of the trip was the hotel staff.  We worked with Joanna in sales to set up the reservation.  She was phenomenal!  In addition to making sure that our room was ready after our LONG red-eye flight, she delivered a few birthday treats to the room.  When we checked in a 6am, Cheryl greeted us with the friendliest smile.  She said "I know you've had a long night of travel, so I'm going to check you in as quickly as I can."  And, she did.  As we were heading up to our room, Cheryl said "I notice that you have the sniffles.  Can I send some hot tea up to your room?"  WOW.  Cheryl - you have made me a fan for life.  Finally, Boqueria was amazing for breakfast (I highly recommend the mushroom omelet) and the Castell Rooftop Lounge was OUT OF THIS WORLD.  I felt like a movie star.  Thank you, AC Hotel Times Square, for making my 40th birthday weekend so special!!!

title: Great rooms and very comfortable.
text: Hotel is located in the heart of time square and the rooms are amazing. I stayed four nights. Rooms are nice, clean and the bed was very comfortable. There is also a solid rooftop bar with good wine and okay food.

title: Bait and Switch
text: First got an email stating that I could use cell phone in via Marriott app to check in and unlock door to hotel room.  Tried to use app but did not even have my reservation to this hotel.  (I was able to pick my room and get in the room and bypass the hotel desk with the HIlton app in Austin, TX). Then  was handed an elite member key card when I checked in the hotel.  I signed to the hotel wifi assuming that it was free with the card but then was charged the $9.99 wifi fee.  In this day and age would never pay for wifi service since I have a hotspot on my phone. Tried to rectify the situation with the hotel directly and they did not reverse the charges. Will definitely avoid the Marriott brand in the future since they are not upfront with their charges.

title: One night stay when I didn’t get on my flight
text: I stayed here for one night when I did not get on my flight at LGA.  I took bus 70 to the subway and got on the subway and got off at 42nd Street I think.  When I came up from the Subway, the hotel was right there!  The staff was excellent.  The location was great and the room cool and modern.  The bathroom was great and the bed was comfy.  The only problem was it was noisy at night with the subway and buses.  I normally sleep with white noise but I had a early flight and was afraid I would not wake up.  If you stay here, the Hotel and location are great but there is a lot of street noise so have ear plugs or ask to be on the quiet side.  I would stay here again though.  Coffee in rooms, nice plugs for phones and watches, nice toiletries.  Rooftop bar too!

title: Good Location
text: A new hotel in NYC with a good location to walk to main sites and transportation. Nice size room and very clean bathrooms.  Front desk was very helpful  and friendly. Also helpful on restaurant recommendations.

title: Fantastic hotel -Best place I’ve stayed in NYC
text: Loved everything about our stay here. The hotel staff are very nice and helpful. Everyone from housekeeping to the check in staff were pleasant. We loved the modern design, with a new hotel everything was clean and didn’t smell musty or stale at all. We loved the laminate floor and minimalist design. There are really no complimentary perks here even for Marriott rewards members. We loved the gym!!! Very spacious unlike most hotels, the equipment was brand new and worked well. Kettlebells, Wright’s, a multi use cable machine that actually worked, stability ball, several treadmills and ellipticals. It was perfect for us and well lit. They could add a bosu ball. We had one of the rooms with floor to ceiling windows that was gorgeous! The air conditioning actually worked to the temperature it was set to, not common for most hotels. The WiFi access was very good and sufficient to stream amazon prime. The smart TV also had streaming services for login. The hotel isn’t a budget hotel by any means, so not cheap. New York is expensive, so that wasn’t surprising.

title: Esperienza positiva
text:
Siamo tornati ieri dopo 4 giorni trascorsi a New York e siamo stati contenti di aver scelto questo hotel per il soggiorno. 
Il soggiorno in questo hotel è stata un’ottima esperienza.
Struttura nuova, ristrutturata da poco, pulizia ottima, sia negli spazi comuni che nella camera, hall incantevole con musica di ambiente in sottofondo, finiture e salottini con arredo di design, camere non molto grandi ma i due letti queen size veramente molto comodi, arredo design minimal con tutto quello che serve, diverse prese usb per ricaricare i vari dispositivi, cassaforte, niente moquette ma un bel pavimento doghe con trama legno, TV LCD enorme penso 55” , doppio tendone verticale molto oscurante infatti non entrava dall’esterno neanche un filo di luce, bagno con doccia molto ampia pulitissima, la nostra era una camera con vista sulla città e finestra a tutta parete, spettacolo, servizio pulizia camera perfetto, unico neo il rumore della ventilazione un po’ fastidioso.
Roof top bar molto elegante.
Personale molto gentile e disponibile, parlano anche Italiano.
Abbiamo prenotato la camera comprensiva di prima colazione e non potevamo trovare di meglio.
Viene servita al mattino nella Boqueria il piccolo ristorante annesso a piano terreno con cucina a vista al quale si accede direttamente dalla hall.
Colazione parzialmente a buffet super, vero caffè espresso, cappuccino, caffè americano, the, spremute fresche, succhi di frutta, pane di diversi tipi fresco, cornetti caldi, muffin, burro, vera nutella, marmellate, torta, yogurt, frutta fresca, frutti di bosco, frutta secca e disidratata, cereali vari, torte salate, affettati, formaggi, uova strapazzate o omelette fatte al momento davanti agli occhi servite in terrina calda con pane tostato su piastra (squisite) ordinate al momento e sicuramente altro ma ci è bastato tutto ciò.
Al piano inferiore si trovano i servizi, la palestra il bancomat e la stazione di idratazione dove poter riempire le bottiglie di acqua gratis.
Ogni giorno nel frigo bar della camera venivano lasciate 2 bottigliette piccole di acqua naturale.
3 ascensori molto grandi e servizio deposito bagagli molto ben organizzato e sorvegliato.
Sicuramente consiglierò questo hotel.

title: Great hotel wonderful week
text: My wife and two teenage girls stayed here for 5 nights and had a great time. The hotel was perfectly located close to the subway and access to plenty of places to eat and get to on foot. The staff were all very helpful and fun making our stay a really great one. The rooms were bigger than expected and four of us in two doubles for 5 nts was fine. Nice bathrooms, great rooftop bar, late check till 1pm and baggage store and coordinated a car to jfk. The very popular and trendy Boqueria Bar as part of hotel was also good. Only downsides we’re maybe AC being a bit loud, and shower water and temperature not great in mornings but probably everyone in NY hotels using them! Breakfast was expensive so our tip is go to the Telecom Cafe next door for pastries, bagels, coffee, fruit etc and eat in your room! Evenings it was very hot! Would recommend to anyone.

title: Veterans and military don't give them your business
text: I made the mistake of booking a room at this place for a day after a military school reunion, which we could not attend due to the hurricane and other events. Even though I gave them weeks' notice in advance and explanation, they refused to allow me to cancel the room. I challenged the charge through my credit card company and they had the audacity to send documents to my credit card company that made it look like I actually stayed there when I did not. They don't deserve your money or your business, fellow veterans and military.

title: Great theater location
text: The hotel is well located and an easy walk to theaters and many restaurants. We had a good sized room with floor to ceiling windows which I particularly like. The rooms are very clean and new, bathrooms are large and the beds are comfortable. The rooms are well equipped with USB ports and plugs. The hotel has a modern vibe and the staff is excellent. Sharon at the front desk was great. She not only suggested excellent places to eat but sent two yummy cupcakes to our room. There is a very nice rooftop bar with space outside and in. I would definitely stay again

title: This is the Place to Stay
text:
My family loved this hotel.  They have only been open since April of 2018.  The rooms and entire property is very nice.The rooms are well-equipped, roomy (by NYC standards), clean, and comfortable.  We found the location to be very convenient for everything we wanted to see and do in NYC.  The staff was wonderful...friendly in every interaction.This hotel has a rooftop bar, exercise room, meeting rooms, and a business area.

I highly recommend this hotel.  I know we will be staying here on all future trips to NYC.

title: Situation géographique idéale
text:
Chambre spacieuse. Literie large et de haute qualité. Décoration épurée, branchée,  calme . Personnel aux petits soins. Emplacement idéal pour visiter new York. Ne pas hésiter une seconde.
Métro à deux pas.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Hemos pasado un grupo cinco noches en este hotel y no hemos disfrutado de todas las comodidades pero de lo que hemos disfrutado le ponemos todos un 10. Localización estupenda en la calle 40 a cinco minutos de Times Square. Personal de recepción muy amable, habitaciones grandes, baño grande con una ducha enorme y todo con un estilo muy moderno, lo único malo es que no teníamos armario solo unas pocas perchas y si podéis elegir y no os gusta el ruido pedid una habitación que no de a la misma calle 40. Lo primero que destacamos todos fue lo comodísimas que eran la cama y las almohadas. Un hotel moderno que si no es nuevo está reformado recientemente

title: Just an ok stay...
text: The rooms are not warm or cozy feeling but very modern in design with hard laminate flooring. Very clean but minimal closet and drawer space. Good for a short stay. The bathroom with its frosted glass sliding door was short on privacy. The free bottled water was a nice touch but I had to call for my room to be made up both nights. Nice bathroom amenities and friendly front desk. Cool rooftop bar but the service up there is slow. Great location very close to several subway lines. Lots of food and beverage options close by too.

title: New property - very nice
text:
I stayed for three nights at the AC Hotel after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel has been open since the spring and the staff seem very proud of the ambience of the property. I found the staff friendly and helpful, the room more than adequate size for NYC with a modern look and feel.  There is a small fitness centre with nice modern equipment that is in good working order.  It is located in the basement of the hotel so no natural light but lots of connectivity for streaming devices. 
We had breakfast in the hotel each morning and it was reasonably priced.   There were wifi issues that were not resolved within an 18 hour period but apparently the issue was not local but network driven - an unfortunate inconvenience for international visitors not wanting to incur roaming charges for devices while in the hotel.  On the third night the fire alarm went off at 2:45 am. After about 5 minutes of bell running the fire and safety officer did announce over the intercom that there was no need to vacate. However the alarm re-engaged three additional times and we were without the benefit of a follow up voice to confirm that we were all safe. Word of mouth spread to say it was an all clear - a very good thing - but it was a tense 15 minutes in the middle of the night. I recommend the property and commend the staff that we interacted with - we found them warm, friendly and helpful.

title: Great location, new as of April 2018
text:
Pros: The hotel was new, clean and in a great location within walking distance to the theater and Times Square. Plenty of restaurants on same block as well as on onsite. Hotel has a Rooftop terrace.  Beautiful floor to ceiling windows. Front desk Staff was friendly.
Cons: No room service and rooftop terrace doesn’t open until 4pm so I didn’t see it. Thermostat didn’t go higher than 73 and I was cold, but they brought me a portable heater and resolved my issue.

I had an 8th floor room with a view of 40th Street. Hotel is between 7/8th. Subway entrance on same block. Walked to Macy’s, Madison Square Garden, Times Square and the theater district. I would stay at this hotel again because the location is great. Walk to Best Bagel on 35th Street/7th Ave for great NY bagels.

title: Birthday trip
text:
We just checked in today and have not yet spent the night but I was itching to write a positive review about our experience so far. Sharon, who checked us in, was so warm and welcoming. When we told her we were here for a surprise 10th birthday trip for our daughter, she upgraded our room. She was even kind enough to print out some items I needed and get them to me quickly. After dropping our bags we went out to do some sight seeing. We came back to 3 beautiful cupcakes and a kind note from Sharon. Above and beyond. 

The rooms are well-sized for Times Square with a roomy bathroom. The rooms are sleek and modern and the beds comfortable. We have a beautiful floor to ceiling window view in our room. We couldn’t be more pleased. Already this has been a trip of a lifetime for our daughter.

title: Waouh !
text: Très bel hôtel , superbement situé . Nous avons eu une chambre grandiose (55m2) , avec vue sur la rue , pas de bruit , très bien isolé niveau vitrage . Très grande douche , possède un frigo bien remplie . Personnel au top . Ne pas hésité à monter au 21è étage boire un verre sur la terrasse , vue superbe sur les autres immeubles . Je recommande sans hésitation ....

title: 4.5 Stars, Good Hotel with no real issues
text:
Pro:   Location, large bathroom, comfortable beds
Con:  Lights, maintenance 
Price: $305/night

Stayed on the 6th floor at the AC Hotel.  Front desk staff at check in were helpful and attentive.  Although the original set of keys I received did not work, they quickly resolved this issue.  

The room was typical for NYC but had a large bathroom by NYC standards.  The beds were comfortable.  While you could hear the occasional sound from the hall, it was minimal.  

The only negatives I would say are the lights.  When coming into the room (which was dark), the wall light switches did not turn on any of the lights except for the one near the door. We even hit the switches between the bed but that didn't turn the light on.  Only after using our phones did we see the small black switches on the side.  Maybe we were just dense but the wall switches should turn on the lights.  The other negative was when my friend in an effort to find a light switch opened the area where the air filter was for the air conditioner.  Apparently the filter was very dirty and was due for a change.

The location of this hotel was great.  The hotel is between two main subway stops (Port Authority (A,C,E lines) and Times Square (1,2,3, N,Q,R,W lines)  With these lines to choose from, we were able to get almost everywhere we needed.  

Dean and Deluca is across the street too if you want a quick breakfast and coffee.

title: Theater District
text: This is a new hotel close to theaters and Times Square. It is on 40th street between 7th and 8th Avenues. An entrance to the subway is a few hundred feet away. The rooftop bar and tapas grill has indoor and outdoor seating. The views are nice at sunset. The ground floor bar and restaurant serves drinks until late. The wine selection is small for glasses but much larger for bottles. The rooms are small, modern and clean.

title: Prisvärt om du vill ha promenad avstånd till det mesta
text: Läget på hotellet är perfekt särskilt om du är föratagångs besökare i New York, du har promenad avstånd till det mesta på Manhattan. Även tunnelbana samt busstation ligger precis bredvid hotellet. Hela kvarteret kryllar av restauranger och affärer.

title: I was satisfied with this hotel
text: I booked two nights at AC Hotel and I wasn’t disappointed.   The check in was easy.  We got room 508 with the view overlooking the street.   I was worried this hotel would be noisy because it’s close to Times Square however it wasn’t so bad.   On Tuesday morning when everybody was back at work I have to say it was a bit more noisy earlier than expected however I still had a good night sleep.   From the moment you walk everybody is extremely nice and helpful.   One day early morning I was coming out of my room and there was Chinese rice on the floor next to my room, it wasn’t a pretty sight!  I told the staff at reception, went for my breakfast and when I came back to the room probably about 30 minutes later it was all cleaned up!   They were grateful I told them and the staff took care of it immediately; I definitely was impressed.  The rooms are bit small, comfortable beds and clean.   Nice size bathrooms with two shower heads.    Overall I was very happy with my choice as this hotel is located in a great location if you are coming to see shows.   There is a staff member that I really appreciated; her name was Sharon.   She helped me with a lot of things, like setting up my Uber application and teaching me how to use it.    She also gave me many suggestions of things to do.    I must let you know that they have a beautiful terrace on the 21st floor; after 7pm it is only for 21 and older.    A Spanish tapas restaurant with a beautiful view of the New York Skyline, I sincerely appreciate my experience.   The food menu was very simple and not too many choices however it’s a perfect restaurant for drinks and get together with friends or family.

title: New York Vacation
text:
My husband and I found the room to be exactly what we were looking for. Friendly, helpful staff, clean room, and a very, very comfortable bed. It was centrally located with many restaurants nearby. If we had any questions about how to get around or where and how to get to an attraction they were amazing at helping us out of towners  getting around. The roof top bar is amazing, and well worth a nibble. Thank you AC Hotel for keeping us comfortable away from home.
Sincerely,
The Monroes.

title: Bel hôtel!
text:
Comme première visite à New-York,nous ne pouvions mieux tomber. Hôtel neuf,bar lounge avec terrasse au 21ieme étage,vue sur l’empire state building ,quoi demander de plus!
Situé sur la 40th avenue,entre la 7th et 8th avenue,quelques minutes à pieds de l’effervescence de Times Square et des nombreux théâtres du quartier des spectacles.
Impeccable et tranquille

title: New hotel, outstanding location
text: This hotel’s location is hard to beat, only a two minute walk to Times Square, right in the heart of the theater district, with lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff was helpful and accommodating, while remaining professional. The hotel still has a very new feel, and the rooms are adequately designed. We loved having drinks on the rooftop bar sitting outside. Inside the bar was rather noisy. The price is high, but it’s NYC, so that’s to be expected. A little too strong of an AC hotel aroma in the lobby. We would definitely stay here again.

title: New and Solid; would stay again!
text: This is a freshly looking and feeling hotel right near times square (which can be good or bad or just annoying).  Rooms were great.  The rooftop bar was pretty amazing.  Slept well.  There is obvious street noise, but if you want peace and quiet, don't come to NYC.  I had no problems sleeping.  It is a Marriott type property if that is your thing.  Had no issues.  Nice workout facilities and plenty of places to eat nearby.

title: Wonderful experience
text: This is in an excellent location close to many of NYC’s sights. Very gracious staff eager to accommodate guests. Hotel is designed with contemporary appointments and AC’s signature fragrance greets you.

title: posizione centrale
text: a pochi passi da time square, moderno e funzionale, senza fronzoli il resto è tutto fuori dalla porta, da considerarsi di lusso negli standard del gruppo marriott, non economico, adeguato alla posizione e allo standard

title: Super séjour
text: Hôtel très bien situé et facile d’accès, WIFI fonctionnant très bien, personnel agréable et avenant, chambre spacieuse, joliment décoré et propre. Tout était réuni afin de passer un séjour dans d’excellents conditions et recommande vivement cet établissement.

title: Geweldig New York
text:
Prima hotel op een geweldig plek! Vlakbij time square en Broadway.
Ontbijt moest je apart betalen.Was veel te duur voor wat je kreeg.
Wij hebben iedere morgen bij een frans bakkertje gegeten. Dat scheelde de helft.

title: Highly recommend
text: Very nice new hotel.  Checkin staff was great.  Christopher checked us in and couldnt be more helpful. Got is in our room early.  Rooms are very clean.  Small,  but clean and new. Good location for penn station and port authority. Going to hit the rooftop bar later just to check it out

title: Rude front desk agent
text: The rooms are clean and comfortable and the rooftop lounge is beautiful.  I stayed there on 9/30/18. Everything was great until check out.  A front desk agent Christopher was very rude to me after asking me what email address to send the receipt.  After confirming the email address  he typed it into the computer and then walked away leaving me standing there wondering if I was done. One agent who saw this said I'm sorry . Never asked me if I enjoyed my stay or thank me for staying he just freaking walked away.  I was so angry I went back to him a few minutes later and told him I thought his behavior was rude. He said, and I kid you not, "sorry I didn't see you standing there,  I thought you had walked away" REALLY??? Maybe he was rude because I used points for my stay, but you know what. I have points because my husband travels a lot and is a Marriot rewards member. I will also make a complaint to corporate.

title: restaurant panoramique hotel Marriott
text: superbe vue de tout New York en allant au restaurant tournant 48° étage de l’hôtel. Marriott. Vous pouvez y aller pour prendre un verre c'est vraiment magnifique. Prendre l'ascenseur est déjà très impressionnant car direct et avec baie vitrée.

title: Perfect for bus traveling theater goers
