text: We took the bus to Port Authority for a quick 1 night trip to see a show (Waitress).  This was the perfect location.  Stepped off bus and were in our room in less then 2- minutes.  We arrived early and a room was ready.  Got late checkout the next day so we relaxed before heading back to the Port Authority.  What a nice perk.  This was our 1st time staying at an AC.   Room was small but worked well for us.  Spacious bathroom with a shower.  Wish it had a night light behind the mirror.  The rooftop bar was cool though we got back too late to have a drink there (closes at midnight).  DId not try the restaurant as there were lots of eateries in the neighborhood (hello, Gray's Papaya, Little Beet, and Yeero).  Nice gym in the basement fairly large for a limited service hotel, though I didn't have time to use.  I would stay here again.

title: Newer hotel ...will return!
text: This relatively new Marriott was so convenient for accessing this part of Manhattan. Walked to several sights and Hamilton at the Rogers theater. Very close to Port Authority. On the 12 th floor ...room was adequate size, clean, quiet and loved the floor to ceiling windows and shower. Small fridge was good  to have for drinks and water. Had a nice dinner at the attached Tapas restaurant and a drink at the roof top bar. Nice to have this convenience as well. Restaurant also serves breakfast and lunch. There is a Dean and Deluca across the street. Last but not least, the desk staff, valet and housekeeping were all helpful and pleasant.

title: Centrico
text: Primera vez que viajo a nueva york! El hotel muy centrico, justo en times square. Al lado del hotel a dos paso tienes una boca de metro, linea azul, que comunica muy bien con toda la ciudad. La recepcion muy buena, tienes recepcionistas que hablan español. En cuanto a la habitacion, no es muy grande, pero eso eso si, muy moderna. Esta muy bien insonorizada, limpia, cama muy amplia y muy comoda, tv muy grande, baño muy limpio y moderno, caja fuerte, y lo mejor de todo wifi gratis 24h y que funciona muy bien. Dentro del hotel, en la planta 27 hay una terraza muy bonita con unas vistas preciosas del empire state, mejor subir de noche. Tiene una bar de pago, un poco caro, pero si quieres  darte un capricho, merece la pena.  En la misma calle del hotel, tienes para desayunar y comer muy barato. Muy recomendable.

title: Hotel renovado
text:
Ha sido una sorpresa conocer este hotel, está nuevo y por nuevo me refiero a baños modernos, no hay moqueta y si nevera, toda una sorpresa teniendo en cuenta otras experiencias que he tenido en hoteles de Nueva York.
Muy limpio y el personal muy profesional y amable, el único pero el aire acondicionado que o bien no supimos controlarlo o que realmente funcionaba así ya que hacía mucho ruido.
También tengo que decir que no les dijimos nada del aire, quizás si lo hubiesemos comentado nos hubiesen enseñado a manejarlo.
Mención aparte la terraza o roof top del hotel, impresionante.
Repetiré sin duda.

title: Horrible Service
text: Platinum member, when checking in, Christoper was extremely rude. No platinum upgrade! Even though there were several room types avilable. “Those rooms are available if you pay for it”. I guess that’s how you treat your loyal customers. Stay else where!

title: AWESOME VIEW
text: I booked this hotel for my Birthday and It was really cool of the staff to take notice to that. The hotel is relatively new so it still had that vibe upon check-in. The room was clean and decor was very modern (being from New Hampshire) this left me super impressed. The view of the city was amazing especially with the floor to ceiling windows. It really gave me that NYC vibe. My ONLY critique would be the ICE machine being several floors done. But I would definitely recommend this place.

title: Not impressed
text: I am a SPG/Marriott platinum guest, and I would not recommend this hotel if you care about service. I agree with the previous reviews that the service is not their metier - the staff is not super friendly, and do not really seem to care about their job. The rooms are modern, but quite small, and not cozy at all. The only positive thing: the rooms are clean, location is fine, and the roof top bare is nice as well. Will not come there again unless other hotels are booked out.

title: Bella settimana a New York
text:
Ho trascorso sei giorni in questo hotel dal 1 al 7 settembre 2018.
L'albergo è in ottima posizione fuori dal frastuono di Times square, che a mio avviso è invivibile!
Ottimo personale alla reception, la struttura è stata integralmente rinnovata ed è nuova.
Mi associo a quanto scritto da altri viaggiatori... va migliorata la pulizia della camera e consiglio al direttore di cambiare il personale preposto.
Struttura consigliata.

title: Hospitality is not their focus
text:
The hotel itself is fine. It's in a great location and is clean. Nothing to write home about. 

I was disappointed with was the hospitality, Marriott usually sets such a high bar. When I called a week ahead of time to ask for restaurant recommendations, I asked for the concierge, the girl I spoke with said she was capable of making some recommendations and would not transfer me to the concierge. She recommended the hotel restaurant (of course, I understand why) and when I asked for others, she put me on hold for 5 minutes and then the line disconnected. 

The day we checked out, we were storing our bags and I needed to get into it a few hours later. The valet was busy and not able to help right away. The front desk guy basically said that wasn't his job and just stood there doing nothing (actually nothing, snapping and pumping his fists together and looking around) while the poor valet ran around like crazy. Another front desk worker walked up a few minutes later and she did help us with our bags. 

I do not plan to return to this location.

title: Ubicación perfecta, hotel muy limpio y personal encantador
text:
Ubicado en el centro, se puede ir andando a todas partes, magnífico rooftop en el que tomar algo al atardecer, habitación normal y personal muy amable y simpatico.
El bar de tapas de la entrada muy caro y no recomendable, mejor cualquiera de los muchos restaurantes que hay por los alrededores

title: I had mixed feeling about my stay here.
text: The location is good if you want to be near Times Square and clearly this is a newer hotel. However the hallways already had stains and the bathroom vent was caked in dust. As a platinum member I wasn't offered an upgrade, breakfast or anything else and was told at the counter this is a minimal service hotel. Nice to stay in a newer place, but with so many Marriott's in town not sure I would stay at this one again. again.

title: Avoid breakfast; use rooftop bar
text:
Used two free night certificates from a marriott credit cards and from hitting 75 nights at marriott this year.
As a marriott platinum they gave me $10 per day per guest coupons for food and beverage. These were painful to use at breakfast, went with my wife thinking i could use one for each of us. The restaurant would only let us use one! After speaking and insisting with the manager that this was crazy, they eventually took both. Didn’t have this issue using the other two certificates at the rooftop bar though. The rooftop bar around 430 i think had a champagne show, we got a free glass afterward! So i would highly recommend avoiding the overpriced breakfast especially if you are a party of 2 and heading to the rooftop bar.

The rooms were fine. Very clean and contemporary but on the small side. The hotel common areas were nicely decorated too. Overall a good stay

title: Retornando
text: Retornando ao hotel, continua muito prático, limpo e com excelente atendimento. O ar condicionado é um pouco barulhento para um hotel novo, mas nada demais. Sua localização é excelente, com muitas opções de café da manhã por perto, além de uma estação de metrô a uns 15 metros da entrada do hotel. Seus preços são melhores se a reserva for feita com antecedência de pelos menos 2 meses. Em cima da hora são bem salgados. As opções de andar mais alto só valem a pena se você for fanático(a) pela vista da cidade, mas visite um mirante ao invés de pagar mais por um quarto. A academia é moderna e bem equipada.

title: Location, Location,Location!!
text: This is the second time we’ve tried one of these relatively new Marriott AC hotels and the second excellent experience!!  We love the overall design and the decor.  Rooms are very functional and modern. This being a new hotel, rooms and common areas were spotlessly clean.  The staff was very welcoming and also very helpful with a couple of small issues that we had.  The thing we really liked about this place was the location.  Nearby to all of the Times Square and Broadway activities but also slightly removed to get it out of the throng. Highly recommend!!

title: Recepcionista Shanice não condiz com o hotel.
text: Maravilhoso! Ótima localização, quarto de tamanho bom para NY. Cama extremamente confortável e tudo muito limpo. Bar do hotel no 21° andar Fantástico, não deixe de ir tbm no bar ao lado do hotel, ótimo tbm. O único  inconveniente foi no check in , a recepcionista Shanice não condiz com a educação dos outros funcionários do hotel, péssima!

title: Euro Style; Great Rooftop
text:
Stayed here for one night on a weekend. The hotel has recently opened so everything is quite clean and fresh. Decor is minimalist and tranquil - lots of brown, cream, and grey. Room is decent size by NYC standards, as is the bathroom (shower only, but a large showering area.) Korres amenities in the room. No carpet on the floor (yay!), which added to the modern feel.

I’m not sure if all the rooms are the same way but ours, which faced 40th, had an entire wall of glass as the exterior wall. This lent the room a very open feel and I loved the floor-to-ceiling glass. There are two shades, one sheer and one blackout, that operate electronically and will cover the entirety of the glass. Really great feature! 

Rooftop bar is excellent. Carefully hand-crafted cocktails (NYC hotel prices, $18), and just an all-around wonderful space to be in. It manages to be open and intimate at the same time.

Service at the front desk and the rooftop bar was very good.

The location is great for the Times Square area. You’re just steps away but it doesn’t feel like you’re in the madness. And there was almost no street noise at all.

title: Great Hotel in Times Square
text: Very nice hotel in a good location.  Near Subways, Times Square and many good restaurants and shopping. Watch for deals and you can get good pricing. Rooms nice and clean and the hotel is relatively new.  Personnel was very nice and helpful.  Has a great rooftop bar with great views.  Restaurant attached with great and expensive food.

title: Great location BUT ..........
text:
Great location, nice modern rooms but service and security issues for sure.

In terms of service I spoke to the Hotel Operator about a couple of things including a charger and ice and they said they would call back and they just never bothered.  And during the call there was definitely a feeling I was inconveniencing them.  The next day I referenced the issue again and while the person was nicer, it was too late.

In terms of security I always worry when a hotel in a city like NYC, Chicago, Boston etc. doesn't require a key card to get to hotel floors.  If I walked through the lobby 7-8 to get in the elevators, at least 50% of the time no-one noticed me.  Plus having a bar on the top floor is nice, but when people in the bar who aren't hotel guest can get straight to someone's floor its an issue.  I am fine but wouldn't want my wife or daughter staying there.

That being said location is amazing and the rooms are very nice.  Just wish as a Platinum you could get the upgrade without having to beg for it!!

title: ES UN HOTEL PARA RECOMENDAR
text:
He estado siete noches y he tenido una habitación grande limpia y silenciosa. 
Personal de recepción y el de limpieza han sido agradables y serviciales.
Andando, está situado a 9 minutos de Times Square y a 8 minutos de varios teatros de Broadway. 
Botellas de agua como cortesía en el frigo bar.
Tiene dos entradas de metro en la misma calle (entre la 7ª y la 8ª Av.)
Cuando vuelva a NY repetiré.

title: Celebrating Anniversary with Double Beds!
text: Me and my husband stayed at the hotel only for one night and it was a disaster. We arrived at the property directly tothe front desk area and no even a “Hello” or “Welcome” from the front desk clerk just ask for last name and credit card. And for our suprise NO KING SIZE BED available. The clerk didnt even ask. She just gave room keys and thats it. We werent very happy about it. Rooms were not the best and cleaness was nasty. The only good thing was the “view”  the street city. Horrible experience ever.

title: Rooftop Bar Heaven
text: After a long day in the city, there’s nothing better than a cocktail on the patio with the view of the city bathed in lights.  Our waitress was delightful, the drinks perfect and the ambiance outstanding.  This is what a city rooftop bar should be.

title: Cozy Place near Times Square
text:
We stayed here for labor day weekend to watch the US Open. The hotel is very accessible since it just a walking distance from Port Authority and Times Square. 

The facilities are modern and the room is very clean. There is also a rooftop bar if you want to end the day with a couple of drinks. This is not a full service hotel so don’t expect a breakfast buffet and an indoor pool.

I recommend that you get a room with an even number in order to get a nicer view.

title: Super
text:
Bonjour,
Un séjour du 27/8 au 02/9
Hôtel propre et au niveau des attentes de ceux qui souhaitent visiter New York !
Les chambres sont propres, le Wifi est excellent et l'accueil est au TOP, 
Rien à dire et tout est à côté, transports, restaurants, animations......
Je recommande et j'y retournerai

title: Very nice hotel.
text: Just came back after staying here for 5 nights. Hotel was very clean, bed was very comfy and hotel room was spacious and modern. Staff were very friendly. Excellent location. Only disappointment was that AC was noisy.

title: NYC Vacation
text: Very friendly staff. Comfortable beds. Close to everything you want to see. Restaurant on site was good food but expensive. The staff was helpful with information and suggestions of local eateries and sites to see. Would definitely stay here again. Also recommended it to friends and family.

title: turismo 4 noches
text: Bueno in a pesadilla. número uno perdí mi vuelo y llegue una noche después. hablé si me consideraban una noche más por la noche pérdida. me dijeron que no .ok . luego pregunte y me dijeron que mi reserva terminaba el 30 agosto el propio empleado me dijo .por lo decidí quedarme una noche más . cuando me retiro el 30 de agosto me dijeron que cargarán una noche más a mi tarjeta yo en ningún momento pedi una noche más pagada de mi persona sino que si había la posiblidad de pasar la noche pérdida el día 25 y resulta que me cobran la noche de más. pues resulta que tenía alquilado un carro para 29 de agosto fecha de mi original check out tuve que pagar como 60 dólares de más de parking y para colmo me cobran la noche extra a precio regular .ósea un 50 porciento  más caro que en regular. además la puerta de baño se trababa y ahora había que llamar a mantenimiento y las cortinas se trababan entraba luz tuvieron que repararlas.ademas están haciendo trabajo ruidoso en lobby y todavía son pocos amables y considerados.si me hubieran dicho su check out es el 29 me hubiera ido pero ellos mismos me dijeron que era 30 y después salen cobradon a noche a más 350 dólares muy mal.

title: Just Behind The New York Times Corporate Office
text:
The only problem is that their check-in starts at 3 p.m. when the checkout time is noon. With more staffing or funds spent on labor - this could easily be rectified to 1 or 2 p.m. to offer better service to the guests. 
Either that or they could have options for an early check in package for a fee. Apart from the check in the hotel itself is fantastic and is right in midtown Manhattan, just a few steps from PABT. 
The rooms are well maintained and has floor to ceiling glass windows  which makes it a very modern New York City hotel and you will get your money's worth at it.

title: Fantastic staff
text: We have just spent 5 nights at this hotel on a family holiday to NY. The hotel is new and modern with lovely rooms and bathrooms. The downside in the rooms is the overpoweringly loud air conditioning, it is so loud you can't hear anything over it and bearing in mind we visited during a heatwave this was an issue. The housekeeping was hit and miss. Although the room and bathroom were always clean, the amount of towels and toiletries we received varied day to day. The biggest asset to the AC is the fantastic staff. Every single one was polite, helpful and cheerful at all times. Lynn was a particular help on the couple of occasions we made an enquiry. I would recommend this hotel to anyone having a trip to NY.

title: Great place to stay and would stay again
text: What a great new and clean place to stay.  I was so happy with my stay.  The halls, the lobby, the room, everything is so nice.  Be sure to take a trip to the roof-top bar.  So nice and not well known just yet.  We loved it and recommend.  What a great find.

title: Au coeur de la Pomme
text:
Au centre de NY et entre les Aéroport de La Guardia et JFK accessible en metro, l'établissement est à la hauteur ; très bon accueil et très propre avec des équipements de qualité.
Avec une station de métro très proche il est facile de circuler dans tout NY même pour 3 jours il est judicieux de prendre l'abonnement subway à la semaine.
Evidement côté rue la vue est belle mais il y a un petit peu de bruit au matin mais nous étions en plein coeur de NY et ça c'est le top.
En cas de manque d'oxygène, central park est proche.

title: Ideal
text: Bien placé, sans être dans le flot de la 5 ème, d une propreté irréprochable, le personnel au petit soin. Le breakfast au pied de l hotel permet d attaquer la journée sereinement. Pour le retour à JFK, demander à l accueil de vous commander une navette ( 75 dollars )

title: Beautiful new hotel in the heart of Manhattan!
text: I stayed here with my family for three nights last week. It is an ideal location, walking distance to Times Square and all the great Broadway shows! The hotel is beautiful and comfortable with great service. As mentioned in a previous review, we did experience a clogged toilet one evening, but the gentleman who came and fixed it was prompt and polite and refused the tip we offered him. All of the service we experienced was exceptional. Every employee we encountered was kind and helpful. The view was beautiful and our experience couldn't have been better. Highly recommended!

title: Bello - centrale ma non basta
text: Ottimo in hotel in zona centralissima di Times Square, struttura appena rinnovata con camere e bagno niente male, ma ahimè, personale delle pulizie da seguire con attenzione, a mio avviso poco inclini al lavoro. Non ho mai lamentato nulla alla direzione, ma ho visto cose non proprio carine, per il restante personale buon livello di professionalità. Ultima pecca la totale assenza di armadio, forse la struttura è stata progettata x una clientela business, mah...

title: Hôtel bien situé, services de qualité
text: Très bon accueil à notre arrivée, le personnel a été adorable et patient avec notre maîtrise limitée de l'anglais. Très bons conseils. Chambre pas trop grande et plutôt sombre mais calme, tout à fait satisfaisante! Cafe et thé tisanes tous les jours, très pratique à NY. Hôtel situé à Times Square mais dans une rue moins fréquentée : parfait pour le repos. Le métro est dans la rue à 100m. On peut manger aux alentours sans problème. Service de navette privée vers l'aéroport (75$ttc). Et surtout un rooftop très sympa avec une très belle vue ! Les consommations paraissent un peu chères au début, mais ce sont les prix dans tout Manhattan. En bref: je recommande, très bon emplacement pour visiter NY: Times Square a un autre visage selon les heures de la journée, c bien d'y séjourner!

title: Clean, Comfortable, and Consistent
text:
I've started to stay at more AC hotels as I've found them to deliver on two key metrics, cleanliness and comfort, and this one did not disappoint. Great location with a short walk to Midtown meetings as well as Times Square but just far enough to not get all the foot traffic outside of the hotel. Convenient to subway, as well.

I'm finding that this brand is consistent across its many locations which may appeal to travelers with new and existing loyalty to Marriott/SPG.

title: Clean, contemporary & convenient
text: Our family of four stayed during our 3 night visit to NY.  The hotel rooms are updated and spacious compared to other hotels we’ve stayed at in Manhattan.  And no carpets, so you know the floors are clean! The view facing 40th street is great & not too noisy (we were on the 9th floor).   A breakfast place is directly next door for morning latte and bagels & eggs.

title: Gem in the heart of Time Square
text: Came into the city from Jersey for a night out and decided to stay over at this new hotel.  Staff was accommodating and thoughtful.  This may sound weird but the lobby smells fantastic.  Walking around the city for the day on hot summer day and you notice these things.  The room was clean and orderly.  Spacious for NYC and appreciated the cold fridge and ice cold waters and glasses waiting.  Stayed on the 10th floor and it was nice and quiet.  Centrally located for the theatre and great Japanese restaurant directly across the street as well as a Dean and DeLuca and Muji if you forgot anything.  Was very happy with my stay and will be staying again.

title: Lovely hotel, poor customer service
text: Just left this hotel after staying for a week. Great hotel and location although the house keeping service was poor. There Were a few occasions when our room wasn’t cleaned. I complained about this and the receptionist offered to add me 10000 reward points. When I said I didn’t have a Marriott card she just changed the subject and sent me on my way. We were only left 3 towels when it was obvious there was more than 3 staying in the room. Upon leaving this morning. The man at reception asked if the stay had been good we were responded it weren’t the best and he gave us the bill!! Very rude indeed!! Dont think I’ll be staying again!!

title: I could not have asked for a better experience at this hotel!
text: I stayed at this hotel the night of August 12-13 for my mothers 60th birthday. I wanted to take her out and about in the city since she had never stayed over in NYC. My DP works for a Marriott in Philadelphia and he was able to reach out to this hotel to let them know that i was coming. I never, ever expected the service to be so incredible. Lynn at the front desk was phenomenal. She was always really kind and friendly, told my mother happy birthday (she couldnt stop talking about how nice that was) and even recommended some places within and around our hotel. Once checked into our room i noticed that those from the reception staff decorated our room for her, left a cupcake and even signed a card for her birthday. She was SO happy and I cannot begin to explain how thankful that I was/am. Thank you to everyone at A.C. Marriott but a special thank you to Lynn, Sharon, David, "A", Abraham, Nylia G, and Rodica. Also, thank you to the Manager on duty at Castell (the rooftop bar/restaurant) who came to check on us and to our waitress (I believe her name was Maggie but forgive me if i am wrong).. She brought my mom and I the best ice cream with candles for her birthday. Thank you SO much everyone. I cannot recommend this hotel and this staff enough.

title: BIEN SITUE
text:
Hôtel bien situé pour visiter Manhattan (en face du New York Time) 
A 100 mètres du Subway (métro, bus, port Authority). 
Chambre spacieuse et moderne, nous étions au 8ème côté rue. La clim est bruyante lorsque vous n'entendez moins le bruit des voitures, mais nous sommes à New York la ville qui ne dort jamais ... Nous avions une chambre avec 2 grands lits, mais avec une literie bien trop molle,  convient à une seule personne, sinon vous dormez dans une cuvette. 
Le service de nettoyage de notre chambre n'était pas à la hauteur d'un 4 étoiles.
Chambre non faite à deux reprises durant notre séjour. La première fois ils nous ont juste déposé 2 serviettes propres sur 2 serviettes déjà utilisées et posées sur le lavabo !!! La deuxième fois la chambre à été faite vers 18 H 00.
Pour votre petit déjeuner ou repas il y a le restaurant accolé à l'hôtel (LA BOQUERIA) 
Si vous souhaitez prendre votre petit déjeuner (comme nous) il vous compte un breakfast à 35 $ par personne,  même pour un café et 2 viennoiseries. Un peu cher le petit déjeuner. Donc prendre la formule petit déjeuner inclus. Ou juste accolé à gauche de l'hôtel il y a des petits restos qui font petit déjeuner pour bien plus raisonnable 2.60 $ le café et 3.25 $ la viennoiserie !!!

title: Fabulous new hotel and central location
text: Fantastic central location, large modern rooms particularly by NY standards, friendly and helpful hotel staff, sensational new rooftop bar overlooking times square.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay here again

title: Clean & Modern in Times square
text: This relatively new addition to the Marriott stable has a convenient location to the Theatre District but avoids the insanity of Times Square. Clean, sleek, and modern with all of the usual amenities. Great that it offers a pet free, nonsmoking alternative to those of us who favor that approach. Check-in was quick and our room was even ready before the official 3PM check-in time. Parking is, as usual, overpriced at the hotel so search for nearby options that can save you money. Would definitely return there on subsequent trips to NYC.

title: Nice Hotel!
text:
Very clean. Check in was early than 3pm and we were glad to just left our luggages and explore the city! 
Clean comfy beds. Slept very good.
Check out was easy and they offered to storage our bags which was a big help!

title: Muy, muy decepcionado
text:
Nos sentimos muy decepcionados con este hotel. Llegamos ayer y la habitación para cuatro personas que teníamos contratada al final resultó ser una habitación para dos personas con camas de matrimonio. Es claramente una habitación para dos pero que engañan a incautos como nosotros para sacar más rendimiento al hotel. Dos juegos de toallas, amenities para dos, etc. Ni se han molestado en poner toallas para los cuatro. Para no hablar del tamaño de la habitación en la que no tenemos ni sitio para dejar las maletas.
Mi opinión es que se están aprovechando vendiendo habitaciones de dos como de cuatro y así sacar mayor beneficio. La consideración que tenía de la cadena AC Marriott se ha venido abajo

title: Beautiful hotel
text: This hotel is modern and clean. All the staff are very professional and helpful. The best  part is the location for the value your paying this place is a gem. I will stay here again when I go back to NYC.

title: スタイリッシュなホテルで、交通の便もよい
text: Port Authority Bus Terminalから歩いてすぐです。地下鉄駅の入り口からも30秒ほどでしょうか。ホテルの名前の通りTimes Squareにも近く便利なロケーションです。ホテルは今年オープンしたばかりできれいで快適です。落ち着いたトーンの客室で気持ちよく過ごせました。夜は意外と落ち着いていて、外の騒音は聞こえず、すっきり眠ることができました。

title: Good place to stay in NYC
text: Its a good place to stay in NYC, just right to Times Square, with a metro stop right around the corner. The hotel is new and the staff is very kind and helpful. I booked online roon+breakfast. Breakfast was a bit disappointing, there weren't many options, specially when you are travelling with a kid. One day the ran out of cereals and did replace it. The room is quite nice, new, with a nice view. The cleaning could be improved. In any case, I would repeat if I go to NYC sometime soon.

title: Perfect Location
text: They really nailed the location of this property. Quick access to 1,2,3 and A,C,E lines as well as 7, allowing you to reach nearly anywhere you'd want to go very easily. Quick walk to theatres as well as Times Square, if that's your thing. The hotel iteself is very new and modern. There is a restaurant/bar attached to the hotel that is a lively night spot and a cool rooftop bar with amazing views. The only downside is the noise from the room's air conditioner and fan blowing right on your face all night, along with street noise starting early (to be expected given location). Staff is super friendly and helpful.

title: Children Free Evening
text: My fiancé and I visited NY while my parents watched our twin girls, over due and much needed. We wanted to see the sights in the city. At check in the young man(didn't catch his name) was so helpful at telling us what to see and not do. He invited to a mixer on the 21st floor with complimentary cocktails. The room was so beautiful and the bed was luxurious. We went to the rooftop restaurant which was a pleasant surprise. It's an oasis tucked away from the hussle and bussle of the busy city. The food was amazing, the service was impeccable. There was another server that was also very friendly. We honestly were ready to hang there for another hour with more drinks then call it a night but we needed to take advantage of our baby free night. Please visit the restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

title: Valeu a pena
text: Nessa minha terceira viagem a NY fiquei nesse hotel por 7 noites. Consegui uma boa tarifa em relação a hoteis do mesmo nível e na mesma boa localização do AC. O hotel é recém inaugurado e acho que em alguns meses as tarifas vão subir bastante . Reservei um quarto com 2 camas pois éramos 3. O quarto tem bom tamanho com espaço pra malas, frigobar com garrafa de água cortesia que era reposta diariamente e piso sem carpete . O ar condicionado muito barulhento o que atrapalhou pra dormir e mesmo sendo pleno verão preferi desligar. Fiquei feliz que me deram o 7 andar. Não ouvi barulho da rua e as janelas do chão ao teto davam pra rua 40. O banheiro espaçoso  com box de vidro, chuveiro fraco. A limpeza foi feita diariamente . Fiz o check in a meia noite e foi bem rápido, caso queira informações e dicas tem que perguntar. Na primeira noite que circulamos nas redondezas deu um pouco de receio pois havia pedintes, homeless e bebados mas inofensivos. Acho que como em toda cidade grande deve se ter atenção . Muitas linhas de metrô perto, farmácias e fast food também. Times Square muito perto pra ir a pé . Esse hotel vale muito a pena principalmente se a tarifa for semelhante a hoteis nessa localização pois se trata de um hotel novo com quarto e banheiro com bom espaço numa cidade em que a regra são quartos pequenos.

title: Who needs 5 star when you have this GEM!!
text:
I confess, I wasn't expecting much from this hotel.
I was visiting NY with my adult niece and wanted somewhere clean, safe and close to Times Square.
The Marriott AC Hotel was amazing.

From walking into reception which was spacious and bright, we were able to check in immediately without delay. The room was modern, clean and had a great shower.

There was a little fridge which was unexpected so ended up being great for juice, fruit etc as it was damn hot when we visited.

title: A Moderately-priced Clean/Modern Hotel in a Decent Location with Bad Service
text:
I recently completed a 5-night stay at the AC [Adequate Comfort] Times Square and my lasting impression is:  It's a moderately-priced clean/modern hotel in a decent location with bad service.

Having chosen this hotel due to its central Midtown Manhattan location and positive experiences at AC's, I looked forward my stay here.  The property itself is fairly new and is modernly aesthetic in true AC style.   My room was small (perhaps normal for NYC) which featured a "great view" of garment sweatshop in an adjacent building.

The gym had enough equipment and free weights for a decent workout.  Thumbs up to the filtration machine there where I could fill up my shaker bottle with fresh water (I don't trust the stuff that's been sitting around in a tank).  Another positive here was the rooftop lounge "Castell" which I found to be a classy place to cap off the night, taking in the skyline with a Smokey Manhattan.

Unfortunately, they have unbelievably slow internet and to make matters worse, the "high-speed/enhanced" internet was down.

Desk staff I spoke to could do better with their customer service skills.  They were apathetic when I raised issues with the enhanced internet and a billing mistake.  Additionally, they charged me for a market item I was told was free due to my Marriott Platinum status.

Overall, it's a decent hotel in a good location.  Whether you're a Marriott/SPG member or not there are probably better hotels for the same price range.  I rate this place an "Average" at 3 of 5 pillows.

title: Could have been great
text:
Delighted with the location and newness of the hotel. Ironic that the TV message video interviews the designer of the AC Marriott and talks about how inspiring it is. Granted that the design is forward thinking with greeting smells sights and music etc as you enter the building but they have missed the essential practical elements such as good customer service, noisy and poor located air con, drilling in near by room over night, noise from the room above due to the laminate flooring. 
I called mariott a few days before departure asking for an upper floor as it was a special occasion we were celebrating. They confirmed this would be ok but they couldn’t get me a corner room. On arrival they allocated us level 2 and advised all other upper floors were taken. After a bit of discussion a higher floor was offered but only the next day and it would be at the back of the hotel. We didn’t unpack and after further discussion the next day (we were offered a much lower floor again) we  decided to stay in the same room. Forget about inspiring senses, unfortunately Mariott over promise and under deliver.

title: First stay and first NYC holiday
text: On first day was greeted by very friendly staff.Every day since so far,here for over a week stay in total.All Staff couldn’t be more friendly and helpful.Hotel very clean and beds are very comfortable.Staying on 11th floor.Would recommend to anyone staying in New York.Also reccomend BBQ and The beautiful helpful waitress Lis was very friendly.Shows not all New Yorkers are arrogant And ignorant.The Empire State Building was excellent view but very overrated.Would stay at Ac Hotel Times Square again.

title: Great!
text: Would definitely stay here again. VERY clean and great beds and pillows. Staff liked to harass me about being a Met fan, but well deserved considering the season they’re having. No pool and no free breakfast (like most hotels around Time Square). Only 3 blocks away from TS, 10 min walk to Bryant Park, and 15 min walk to Rockefeller Center. There was a little eatery called Teleon right next door. Great coffee and food looked good, but never ate there. East Uber/Lyft pickups here as well. If you don’t want the lights of Time Square but want to be close, this newer hotel is for you!

title: It's the AC
text:
Isn't it ironic that it's the A/C that lets this hotel down (a bit)? Yes, it is very noisy. And if you switch yours off, you will still hear the neighbour's.

All else is good. But it does keep me from giving this hotel five stars.

title: Novinho em folha
text: Chegamos 1 semana depois da inauguração e o hotel cheirava novo. Tudo funcionando perfeitamente, Wi-Fi voando e cortesia e todos bem solícitos a tudo. O restaurante, que por ser AC é espanhol, serve um presunto delicioso (assim como as tapas). Muito bem localizado.

title: Good Location
text: We have more Marriott points than the Marriot family.  We had our choice of Marriott hotels in the city, as well as other hotels since we also have Hilton Honors, hotels.com, IGH points,etc.  This hotel is in a great location, brand new and very modern.  We had tickets for several shows so we wanted to be near the theatre district.  That said, I will never stay in the theater district again unless I have tickets.  It is a zoo.  The AC is so new and modern that the amenities that are missing are truly notable.  The elevator system is not key operated.  Anyone can go up and down.  Glaring oversight in my opinion.  Check-in was smooth and very welcoming.  The lobby area is large and moderately comfortable.  It is clear they don't want you hanging here for long.  The revolving door should have censors for smooth and easy movement.  The automatic doors worked about 50% of the time.  There is a very small lobby shop, but with a Walgreens, CVS and Duane Reade (also now Walgreens) on every street corner, there is no need to overspend here.  Our room was very pretty. 1712 overlooks a number of office buildings and hotels.  The floor to ceiling slanted window allowed great light and we could see the Empire State Building Spire change colors at night.  It would be great if you put a cushioned built in bench along part of that window so your guests can just stare out at the world while sipping coffee or wine!  Speaking of coffee, Marriott could have spent a few extra dollars and put a Nespresso machine in the room instead of a cheap knock-off. Minimal storage is available in the room, though the room is a nice size.  There is a fridge.  There are tons of outlets and USB plugs so bring your electronics!  Forgettting a wall charger is no problem. It isn't a room that is set up for a work situation, but there is a small desk.  How about a comfortable chair to sit in?  How about 2? The desk chair is a cheap joke and the other chair is also cheap and small.  The bed was comfortable and there were real pillows!  The floor is laminate wood.  Good-bye gross carpet. The black out curtain and opaque shade are electronically controlled.  There are no cords for kids to get tangled in.  The bathroom is a nice size with lots of counter space.  There is no tub, a plus as far as I am concered.  Why they chose to go with the little bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc. is a mystery.  They hold very little product and how many are recycled, refilled, etc.?  I would much prefer the large shower wall installed pump style product dispensers as you can get as much as you need and the waste is minimized.  That said, the hotel uses Korres products which is very nice.  The AC is powerful, but it blow straight across the room from two vents at ceiling height. The room was always cool, but having the air pour on you isn't pleasant. There is a lovely rooftop bar and lounge with very few wine and beer choices and even fewer bar food choices.  Bring your own up.  The restaurant Bouqeteria is accessible from the hotel.  It is an excellent restaurant.  We actually ate at the one in Flatiron.  I wouldn't stay here again, but ony because I like something a little more upscale.

title: Excellent week in NYC
text: We stayed here for 8 nights while my daughter did a musical theatre workshop on 8th between 36/37th. The location was perfect for walking to the studio and Broadway theatres. It’s an easy walk to Bryant Park, Times Square and Herald Square as well. Of all the staff we encountered in 9 days - only one was rude which is impressive. The rooftop bar was beautiful and the gym downstairs had nice equipment. We had zero issues with noise from other rooms until last night/this morning. The staff was quick to answer questions and assist us when needed. This hotel location was a bit “grittier” than our regular place in Midtown East but we couldn’t beat it for our current needs. Great Duane Reed on the corner, yummy pizza and Grey’s Papaya on the corner. Mini fridge was a bonus so we could eat a little breakfast before class.

title: Hotel bien ubicado
text:
Muy buena ubicación para viajar en subte. Muy moderno, lindo, limpio, luminoso. Habitaciones justas, con frigobar y cafetera. No tiene lavadero de ropa. El personal es amable pero el servicio no es muy bueno, pedís algo y no siempre te lo llevan.
Hermosa terraza para tomar algo, excelente vista de la ciudad.

title: En el corazón de Manhattan
text: Expectativas cumplidas, atención inmejorable, personal educado y servicial, para repetir y recomendar. Ubicación perfecta precio bueno en cuanto a calidad y un roof lounge espectacular. Repito genial y junto a una bar de tapas con nombre de mercado barcelonés de altura

title: So clean! Really loved it
text: We loved our stay! We were facing the city and the windows were floor to ceiling it was so cool! The staff were so helpful and sweet and showed us two rooms we could pick from. The rooms were super clean and the bed was really comfy! Super close to the tube so we didn't get lost finding it either! I would stay here again for sure!

title: Époustouflant
text:
Cet hôtel est non seulement bien placé mais est une institution !
En direct sur Times Square....
D’abord prenez l’ascenseur arrivez au lobby puis reprenez votre voyage enfin arrive à votre chambre ouvrez votre rideau et .... savourez ! 
Amazing ! 
Bon côté DECO c’est pas ça mais en même temps on s’en fiche un peu on est quand même à Times Square ! 
La chambre est confortable

title: Nice spot in the city, could use a little more "Welcome"
text:
Recently stayed at this newer Marriott property on 40th street in NYC. GREAT location, walking distance to theatre, restaurants, and Penn Station. Lobby is spacious, not super well laid out, and very bland. This is where my only complaint about the property is, at no time, other than the very nice bellman, the whole check in / check out process was not very welcoming as compared to many other Marriott properties. 

The room: The room was quite nice! Our room had floor to ceiling windows, nice beds and pillows, nice size TV (mounted to wall, nice touch), and a very nice bathroom. The shower was a stand up glass door shower with shower head on the ceiling (also a nice touch). However the square toilets were a little strange, but no complaints.

Engineering: Our deadbolt was very loose on the door. A screw was stripped at some point by a previous customer. Engineering was up to our room and replaced the deadbolt within 15 minutes. Well done by the staff.

Overall, not my #1 Marriott in the city, but definitely Top 3!

title: Very nice new hotel with some of the nicest staff I've experienced. Still some rough edges, though.
text:
This hotel (less than a year old) was the nicest one I've ever stayed in near Time Square. The room with two double beds didn't feel cramped even though it was occupied by four people. We had a room with floor-to-ceiling windows that made it seem like even more space. With the blackout shade down, you couldn't notice any light from the outside. The bathroom was a nice size as well. The hotel was sold out several of the nights we were there (we stayed for 8) but we only experienced a line at the elevator one time. The staff was some of the nicest I have ever experienced in NYC. From the moment we stepped out of our ride until we walked out at the end of our stay, they made us feel welcomed, responding to most of our requests or concerns quickly and competently. 

I would have given this hotel an excellent rating if it hadn't been for one major issue. I reserved a high floor room (as I usually do when in NYC), paying extra for the room. In a hotel with 17 floors of rooms (floors 2 through 19), I was placed on the 6th floor. In my stays in NYC, I have never been placed on so low of a floor. When I questioned an evening staff member what is considered a high floor when a guest requests one, I was informed it was 14 and above. That didn't seem correct to me, so the next morning I asked again at the desk. A very helpful person said that 10th and above were considered high floors. He said he would have the manager contact me to see about changing my price since I wasn't on a high floor. The operations manager attempted to call me in the room but we couldn't see that we had a message (you have to be standing above the phone to see it's flashing). When I finally spoke with her via my cell, she informed me that at this hotel high floors are 6th and above. She would not agree to adjust my bill but did offer to move us to another room (after we've been in the room for 6 nights and only two nights remaining). The 6th floor of a 17 floor hotel is a high floor? That means that only 4 floors are not considered high floors. Or - to put it another way - 3/4 of the floors are high floors. 

If you're wondering why I didn't say something when we picked up our keys (I checked in via the app), I thought I had made a mistake and not requested a high floor. It was when I had to request towels via the app (4 people in the room and there were only 3 towels) that I saw I had requested a high floor. If this is truly the policy for this hotel, I'm disappointed in Marriott. Even the DoubleTree down the street starts their high floors at the 8th floor.

title: New, modern, well staffed
text: The AC Hotel is modern and beautifully decorated.  The rooms are very comfortable by NYC standards - large bathrooms, floor to ceiling windows, new bedding.  The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating.  Angelo, for example, remembered my name after my first visit.  He is always positive and friendly, providing welcomed advice on the local area and restaurants.  He genuinely seems interested in guests and making sure they enjoy their stay.

title: Perfect Location
text:
We had a slight problem when checking in, as our second room wasn’t ready and it was 7pm! We took the only available King room that was on the same floor as our second room and it was tiny (but nice) and looked at a very old and somewhat abandoned building. The 2nd through 4th night we moved to a roomier King that faced the street and it was great. The front desk staff were all very friendly and helped us get what we needed by the second day. The block has numerous places to get coffee and food (including pizza). It’s on the southern end of Times Square so it’s away from the flurry of activity but close to everything you want to go to. 
Bathrooms are nice and roomy. Beds were comfortable. You have two types of shades on the window to choose if you want total darkness or some shade. I didn’t think I’d care much about the rooftop bar, but it was actually one of my favorite parts of the trip and the food was great there. Kids can go from 4-7. We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs one day. It was fine but not worth the cost. Better to just grab a bagel sandwich next door. Some decent food trucks parked across the street in front of The NY Times for smoothies and fresh fruit. I would absolutely stay there again.

title: Un vero peccato la poca cura nella pulizia giornaliera delle camere
text:
Vacanza di una settimana nella splendida NY. Hotel centralissimo inaugurato da pochi mesi. Arredi moderni di buon gusto. Punto di debolezza delle camere è costituito dall'armadio piccolissimo, che mi fa ritenere che l'hotel sia stato pensato più per una clientela business che leisure. Abbiamo avuto difficoltà anche a sistemare le valigie. Pessima la pulizia delle camere. Consiglio vivamente alla Direzione di curare maggiormente la manutenzione degli ambienti. Non è possibile che un albergo inaugurato solo da pochi mesi abbia la carta da parati nel corridoio dell'11 piano già lacerata in un punto. Colazione a 30 euro a persona al giorno di buona qualità ma molto ridotta nella scelta. Personale molto distaccato.
Non mi sento di consigliare questa struttura.
PugliaBari72

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here for a quick weekend visit with my 10 yr old.  The staff at this property made our whole experience (which was a little bumpy).  They are warm, welcoming and extremely accommodating.  We had an issue with the room (A/C) and the technician they sent up was AMAZING and so incredibly friendly, wish I had gotten her name.  In the end we had to move rooms, which was seamless - we went out for a bit, came back and all of our things were in our new room.

Pros - close to great activities for kids (5 mins to movies, Dave & Busters, Ripley's, etc), delicious restaurant on site, adult only rooftop lounge serving nibbles/wonderful cocktails and convenient for taxi/subway.

Cons - would have thought that sound proofing would be better given this hotel is new but if you are not on a high floor you can CLEARLY hear the street noises.  Also could hear people in hallways pretty clearly at all hours.

title: Compact, clean and modern
text: The room was narrow but very efficiently designed. No space was wasted. For example there is no door in front of the closet, but one is not necessary. The bathroom had a sliding door. The showed was a good size. I think the beds were two double, not queen beds. We were 3 in the room. It would have been too crowded with four. Service was great. Breakfast in the Boqueria restaurant downstairs was yummy.

title: Problemi al check-in
text:
Al nostro arrivo (a mezzanotte), dopo un lungo viaggio con due bimbi al seguito,  ci informano che la nostra quadrupla è stata venduta e ci vengono offerte due doppie (nonostante avessi avvisato del tardo arrivo per il check-in). Questo ci ha causato diversi disagi come si può immaginare. Dopo una lunga conversazione ci viene offerta la colazione gratis per il giorno successivo. Inizialmente ci volevano offrire solo la colazione per gli adulti sostenendo che i bambini non avrebbero mangiato nulla perché non si trattava di una colazione continentale (!!). A questo punto mi sono arrabbiata e ci hanno concesso almeno la colazione gratis per tutti, per un solo giorno. Servizio in camera piuttosto scarso: si sono dimenticati le salviette, bagno poco pulito, hanno dimenticato di mettere il bagnoschiuma. Una sera la TV non funzionava. Insomma... per un 3 stelle superior mi sarei aspettata maggiore serietà. 
Punti positivi: la posizione e la presenza di un Dean & De Luca di fronte all'hotel per la colazione.

title: Nice and New but
text:
We pretty much stick to any marriott branded hotel and we were excited to try this one. Nice and new near Times Square. Our favorite is the Marriott Marquis but last minute high pricing dissuaded us from staying there or other favs. This one is nice and new and greeted warmly by Lynn at checkin, Loved being able to check in early before 1PM. Rooms are quaint and clean. Nice touch with the two small cold waters in the room frig. Safe in room, small area to hang clothes with iron and board. Beds new and comfortable.  Didn't use the wifi. Great location as subway is within steps and saw lots of philly fans probably going on the 7 train to citifield. We walked to numerous dining favorites and the theatre.

Now the not so good. Very noisy. Room walls seem to be paper thin and hallway and other room noises will be heard. Trucks outside could be heard very early and we were on the 10th floor.

Most aggravating is the rooftop bar area. Very nice and one reason we picked this. Went after a show on Wednesday night and got there at 1053PM to be told they already had last call and bar was closed at 11. They were certainly in a hurry to close up. Would have been nice to have a drink on a beautiful night in there rooftop area. Came directly from our broadway show and this was/is a negative to not have access in NYC to at least midnight. We travelled over to the Refinery Hotel Rooftop. It was very nice, busy and maybe a consideration for next stay. Seems strange too as the AC hotel TV states their rooftop is open to 2am everyday. They should change that if only on weekends and consider what their losing in revenue on weekday nights in the summer. Come on , its NYC and midnight closing would work much better for those coming from broadway for one drink nightcap.

The shower, new-yes, pretty- yes, effective, not so much. It seems to drizzle out of the shower head. Not specifically a- this hotel-  issue, seems to be an industry wide issue now of saving water and most we've stayed in problem, but jeez, you can't find nozzles that give off some pressured spray. 

For what we payed think with all the competition we'll try another.

title: Small Gem in Time Square
text: I stayed with my kids at the AC this July.  I chose this hotel based on its proximity to Penn Station (we came from Boston via Amtrak) and to Times Square.  This was a very busy weeked in NYC and the streets were overly crowded, yet the AC is a few blocks away from the center and the location was simply perfect for us.  The personnel was welcoming and charming, and I was delighted with how nice they were to my kids (I have 3 teens) and their willingness to help us sort out places to visit or eat.  The room had two full beds, an was small, but considering the location and since we spent so little time in the room, they worked just fine.  The hallways were very plain (and rather ugly) but the rooms were nice, great linens, a small fridge and confortable shower (no tub in our room).  There was a big tv, and we enjoyed free hbo service and could connect to hulu or netflix.  The hotel has a small but confortable gym as well.  We chose a package with breakfast and every day we ate at Boqueria, a small spanish restaurant in rhe lobby.  Food was delicious, service was not great, but since we ate from the breakfast bar we didn't need much help. Overall, a great place to stay, I am certain I will be back.

title: Fabulous location
text: Modern new hotel in a really fabulous location, right next to the subway and within walking distance of Times square and other NY attractions. The room was modern, functional and clean but there was a lack of closet space and bathroom amenities. The rooftop bar is trendy snd beautifully designed. Staff were helpful and efficient. Breakfast service was erratic.

title: Yea.  Its a good one.
text:
My wife, 16yo daughter and I stayed for 6 nights in July.  The hotel has been open for 3 months (pretty sure its a new building no less).  This is a new "boutique" brand of Marriott.  It is not full service, nor are the rooms sized such, so don't expect a lot of amenities.  My second stay at an AC Marriott. Worth it though. I've stayed at Marriott properties well over 500 times in the last 5 years, along with other brands.  This hotel is VERY well located with many subway lines just a hundred feet away (give or take).  Times Square/Theater district just a couple of blocks away.  Expect some city noise but it was not as bad as it could have been (try to get a higher level floor for this reason).  Very clean hotel (which is not the case with the subways and city in general...but hey!  It's NYC).  Staff was very helpful with solicited and unsolicited recommends for food.  Hip Spanish tapas/Catalan restaurant/bar on the ground floor had a wonderful paella.  Roof top lounge (17F) was a great retreat at night.  Kung Fu Kitchen is around the corner for really seriously fantastic Shanghai foods (get the soup buns aka Xiaolongbao 小笼包).   Difficult to think of criticism...but here it goes.  Charged $120 for "extra person" but had to request additional hangers, and daily requested extra towels, water, shampoos etc.  Sink is a nice visually but too shallow for my ladies morning and evening rituals.  Not enough robe hooks in the bath (one).

We took advantage of their $75 flat rate car service to JFK after seeing Uber was estimating $65.  That was a good decision.

title: Lacking room amenities
text: Stayed overnight at this newly open hotel (Spring 2018). Location is great. Hotel is located across from NY Times and Muji. Hotel is within walking distances to Port Authority Bus Terminal, Times Square, Theater District and the NYC MTA (A, C, E, N, Q, R, W, 1, 2, 3, 7). Hotel is closest to the subway entrance and exit located on W 40th St & 8th Ave SE. Front desk agents are very courteous and helpful. My room (on 6/F) is available before 3 pm, which is great. Hotel does offer to store your belongings if your room is not ready and also after you checked out. King bed is comfortable. Comforter does not even has it own duvet, the hotel only place a flat sheet on top on the comforter. In-room AC is quiet and works really good. The room itself does not have enough lighting. After turning on all the lights, room still seem dim. The in-room fridge works nicely. Hotel gives guest 2 small bottles of water in the fridge. The bathroom is pretty spacious with a shower (no bathtub). Hotel offers the usual soap bar, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, shower cap and shoe sponge in the bathroom. Complimentary slippers, toothbrush and toothpaste is available upon request. Water pressure for the shower is very, very weak. Toilet is not good because does not flush well. If you dump too much toilet paper into the toilet or use it for anything more than number one (peeing), it will clog the toilet. It may take a while until a service engineer come to help you resolve this plumbing issue because they only have one service engineer in this hotel with 200+ room. If you have to use the toilet for number two, I suggest using the toilet located on the "C" floor next to the water fountain or dispenser. The automatic Toto toilets in those restroom works a lot better than the one in the guestroom.  Housekeeping did not do a good job in cleaning the room because I found cream and chocolate on the window trim or molding behind the curtain. Bed is almost right again window, so it is not easy to open and close the curtain.  Overall, my experience staying at the AC Hotel by Marriott New York Times Square is disappointing. I won't stay there again and do not recommend this hotel.

title: 100% Recomendable
text:
Visité el hotel con mi familia hace un par de semanas y la experiencia fue excelente.

El AC fue inaugurado hace pocos meses, con lo cual está literalmente nuevo. Todo impecable y el personal sumamente atento.

Las habitaciones están muy bien decoradas. Cuentan con pantallas planas de buen tamaño en las que, además de ver una variada lista de canales, uno puede conectarse a internet. Las camas son muy confortables y diariamente reponen agua, café y té de cortesía.  La insonorización es espectacular y hay wifi sin cargo en la habitación.

En la entrada siempre hay música suave (aún del lado de afuera) y el aroma en el lobby es realmente agradable. Dan ganas de entrar. El hotel cuenta con un completo gimnasio y con una terraza que tiene vistas muy bonitas.

En cuanto a la ubicación, a mi criterio es ideal. Está en una zona llena de teatros, cines y restaurantes, a menos de 500 mts de Times Square, Bryant Park y varias líneas de metro que permiten llegar a cualquier punto de la ciudad. 

Espero volver en mi próximo viaje a Nueva York!!!

title: Time Square
text: J'ai bien aimé cet hôtel, bel emplacement et près de Time Square.  Chambre rénovée avec belle douche. Nous avions une chambre deux lits doubles au 15e étage vu sur une vieille bâtisse.  L'hôtel ne dispose pas de belle vue sur NY en général.  L'air climatisé très mal placée face aux lits et très bruyante...Pas très plaisant je vous dirais.  Les lits doubles sont petits mais confortables.  Les draps sont propres ainsi que la chambre.  Par contre la douche avec le savon qui coule par terre devient très glissante....Il n'y a pas de frais hôtelier par nuit ce qui est une bonne chose mais par contre le stationnement, si vous y allez en voiture, est situé dans une autre bâtisse à deux coins de rue et le service laisse à désirer.  Il y a un mini réfrigérateur et un coffre fort gratuit.  Le Wifi est aussi gratuit ce qui est très bien.  Je vous conseille quand même cet hôtel car de toute façon on passe que très peu de temps dans la chambre mais en général c'est très bien.

title: Brand new but small room
text: The hotel is brand new, the location is perfect but (and I know it is NYC) the rooms are tiny. I booked a city view room and the view was horrible. The experience was OK but with all the choice available I won't go back to this hotel.

title: Gem in midtown
text: No complaints at all. Lovely, clean, friendly. Would highly recommend and would stay there again. The only downside is no breakfast on the permises, but a little place next door is fine. Rooms are a little smaller and fashioned in European style.

title: Magnífica elección!
text: Nos alojamos 9 noches en este hotel después de dudar sobre muchísimos alojamientos, la ubicación es inmejorable, el tamaño de la habitación a pesar de los comentarios que hemos visto es bastante razonable, sobre todo el del baño y la ducha, amplisima y cómoda, la limpieza buena, y además la habitación tiene una pantalla de TV grande, cafetera, secador de pelo de buena calidad, etc. En cuanto al personal, son encantadores, te atienden siempre con una sonrisa y te ayudan en todo lo que necesites. Una de las cuestiones que también tuvimos en cuenta es que no cobran facility fees adicionales al precio. En general muy recomendable.

title: Trendy new hotel in great location
text:
After much research we book this new Marriott property for our 2 night stay in Manhattan. We were not disappointed by the location! We walked to Times Square several times and there were good restaurants close by.  I liked that they had a door greeter who literally noticed us across the street dragging our luggage and directed us in and welcomed us. Very good first impression. Although we didn’t originally get the room we booked, it was remedied fairly quickly by front desk supervisor. The room was clean and modern, keeping with the AC’s simple uncluttered concept. We had a King bed room which was more than roomy enough for us. Loved the floor to ceiling windows although the “view” was only backs of buildings(I’m not sure if there would be any better since you’re surrounded by buildings and it’s not that high of a hotel really) 
Couple of negative drawbacks... main restaurant is way too overpriced for what you get. Skip it. We didn’t end up trying the rooftop restaurant as it had limited menu but it looked very nice. I also thought for the price you pay, Nespresso machine in lobby should be complementary. Would be a nice touch to have something included. Overall, a positive stay and would recommend.

title: Situation idéale
text: Hôtel tout neuf, à la décoration contemporaine. idéalement situé à deux pas de Time Square. En cours de finition mais le personnel est attentionné et les chambres très bien équipées. Propreté impeccable.

title: Great customer service at new hotel
text: I'll be back to this one. Great customer service, comfortable rooms, perfect location. A shout out to Shanice at the front desk who took good care of me at check in. I've stayed in a dozen or more different Marriott-branded hotels in NYC and this is one of my favorites.

title: Great value for a clean and roomy NYC stay
text: We discovered the AC brand in Barcelona. The NYC AC didn't disappoint. My wife, adult daughter and myself were comfortable for the 4 nights we stayed. The hotel was in walking distance to the 2 plays we saw. Shopping and theaters are all very close. The taxi stand on 8th and 40th allowed for quick transportation throughout our stay. After a long day, the rooftop lounge provided a tranquil place to relax. We have stayed at 7 other Marriott properties in Manhattan and this is one of our favorites. We will definitely stay at the AC again...

title: Very Disappointing - Great Location, But Poor Service and Cleanliness
text:
I was really looking forward to my stay at AC NY, but it fell short. We arrived early around noon and we tried to check-in. The room was not ready, which was fine, as we knew that check-in time was 3pm. I asked that we store our luggage. The man at the front desk said that they could text us when the room was ready, which I thought was great. I gave him my number and he said, oh no sorry, we don't call non-US numbers. Okay, fine. We came back at the hotel at 3.30pm, the room was still no ready. The lady at the front desk said it would take another 30 minutes. We did not want to wait as we had to be somewhere, so the lady said that they could text us once the room was ready. I said that her colleague mentioned that because I had a European number, they couldn't reach me. She replied that it wasn't a problem. Why did we lose time coming back to he hotel to be told that the room was still not ready if someone competent could have just texted us?! So, we left and it was a good thing we didn't wait at the hotel as the room became ready at 6pm!!!!! This is totally unacceptable, especially when you've had long travels and you just want to freshen up. 

Then, once in our room, we noticed that the room had been cleaned really quickly. You could see hair on the floor, the corners had not seen a vacuum in a while, the sink was already stained although it's a new hotel. The cherry on top was when I pulled down the duvet, the bed sheet covering it slipped and the duvet was clearly stained with makeup (foundation). That was absolutely gross as I am positive that the duvet had not been changed from the previous guest. They came to change it, but it was 10pm, we were tired and were looking forward to some down time. 

The other drawback was the fact that the room was not well soundproofed. Given the location, it's fine that you hear what is going on outside, but it's not acceptable to hear everything that is going on in the hallway. 

Highlights: 
- great location, walking distance to Times Square, Bryant Park, Macy's, etc.
- rooftop terrace is really nice 
- Boqueria is really good with great staff

I cannot recommend this hotel, there are so many great options in NYC, do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

title: Great Mid Town Hotel
text:
Located on 40th and 8th in Mid Town across the street from the NY Times, the AC hotel is perfect for the tourist seeking a central location with easy access to all of Manhattan and NYC.  We stayed here for 6 nights - great access to Broadway, Madison Square Garden, subways to access up town and lower Manhattan.  

Down the street from Broadway, there was sufficient distance from the main tourist attractions, thus less noise, but close enough to walk and get there easily.  

Amenities were great, good bar downstairs and a rooftop bar near or at the top.  I used the gym several times, and found the facilities more than sufficient.  

As a Gold/Platinum member, I should warn that there is NO concierge lounge, but there are "hydration stations" on each floor which was convenient.   There is a refrigerator in each room and 2 small water bottles are replenished daily.  The shower and bathroom were excellent.  The staff was super polite and helpful, and the location was excellent.  My room was cleaned each day.

Bottom line, I will stay at the AC again!

title: Clean, great location, friendly staff, fair city price!
text: Our family of four (2 adults & 2 children) stayed in a two double bed room.  The room was very clean upon arrival - no complaints and we are a very picky family!  While the room initially felt a bit tight, we learned how to use our space and it worked out just fine.  Surprisingly, we never heard street noise!  The staff at the hotel were always helpful and friendly.  Great location to Times Square and so many other treasured landmarks!

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
Wonderful hotel (opened two months ago). Great room, super staff, and perfect midtown location (two blocks off Times Square)!

Room tip: get a higher-floor, street-view room if it’s available.

Thanks, AC Hotel staff for a great 5-day visit!

title: New AC by Marriott in the Heart of Times Square
text:
As a regular guest at many AC properties in Spain (even before the chain was acquired by Marriott), I have been a fan of these hotels. My favorite hotels in Madrid are both AC. I was pleasantly surprised when I discovered that one had just recently opened in NYC, so I had to come and give it a try!
The room I was given was pretty spacious (for NYC) with a well-thought out, minimalistic design (the AC are known for it); loved the "subway" white-tiled bath space with both rain and hand-held showers, and tons of toiletries, from a toothbrush set to the shoe polisher, which I know from the Spain properties, and that I love! There is free Wi-Fi, a safe, and even a small refrigerator (another transplanted touch from the other A à). The king size bed was comfortable, and a request for foam (not feather) pillows was not initially fulfilled, put was promptly taken care of at check-in. The front desk service was friendly, pleasant and efficient.I highly recommend this centrally located property!

title: Friendly, clean, hotel in a great location
text: We loved the location of the hotel.  Across from The New York Times near Broadway theaters.  We walked most places in Manhattan from the hotel.  The staff was very welcoming, helpful, and friendly.  Although the room was quite small, it worked for us.  We enjoyed the floor to ceiling windows with a view of Manhattan.  The gym was well equipped.  The adjoining restaurant had great ambiance however it was overpriced.  We ate breakfast in many of the area restaurants.

title: Great new hotel with stylish restaurant and bar, clean bright and good size rooms
text: Was unsure about this due to its close proximity to the Port Authority, but we had a high room  (16th floor) facing downtown, and it was quiet with good light -  we didn't miss the city views looking uptown.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed with lots of plugs and USB outlets for your phones and devices.  The lobby is bright and clean.  The rooftop bar which just opened was a beautiful space.  Once they start serving in the daytime, it seems like it would be a great brunch place to hang out.  Bouqueria in the lobby is a great tapas restaurant.  They had a great Sunday brunch for a fixed price with a choice of four tapas, two entrees and dessert, plus bottomless sangria or mimosas for $38 a person, which was a great deal, particularly if you are going to imbibe.   The hotel staff is warm and friendly from reception down to housekeeping.   The hotel is really convenient to the theater district, but not as crowded as staying in Times Square.  Will definitely return, as it was a good value for what you get!  One criticism is that the ACs were probably the loudest units I've ever heard in a hotel.  Not sure what the deal is with that, but it was noticeably loud when they cranked on.

title: Good location, Great Service, Decent Price
text: Port authority subway station is practically at the front door and Times Square is around the corner. The hotel ambience is modern, new and nice. They staff are kind and helpful to a fault. We were able to check in early. They stored our luggage after check out for a few hours. There is a Dean and Deluca for coffee across the street and another coffee shop next to the hotel.  There is a tapas bar on the other side. The rooftop bar/tapas was open with a decent view. Good value.

title: Great location and great sleep!
text:
This was my first time to New York city. We choose the AC hotel as it was brand new opened and felt that it would therefore be very clean and comfortable!   I was not disappointed!

We booked a double room and 4 of us stayed there comfortably for 6 nights! Other reviewers have said that the rooms are small, but I have to say for New York I was plesantly surprised! We had 4 large suitcases and hand luggage and we made it work! The room itself was beautiful!  The decor is lovely, clean and fresh - with it most importantly being kept spotlessly clean! The beds and pillows where very comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping with the AC on. (However I always use ear plugs on holidays).  I would however agree with other guests that the AC is highly sensitive - 1degree of a change makes you either too warm or too cold. 

The location of the hotel was good, with hardly any noise from the street. (We stayed on the street side of the hotel on level 11.) Although there was no 'view' we where overlooking the adjacent New York Times building which was plesent enough. It is really close to Time Square, Maceys, Empire state, New York Public Library, Grand Central Station and had great transport links to the rest of Manhattan and beyond.  The only down side to the location is that the eating choices are all set up for tourists - so expect your usual chain restaurants within the local vicinity. 

The staff - What can i say about the staff?! From the moment we arrived the staff were amazing.   So very Friendly and could not do enough for you!   I had originally requested a higher floor on booking the hotel - being our first time in New York we wanted to experience being on a higher floor and hopefully having a better view.   We however where originally put on floor 2.   However the staff gave us the option to move the next morning when more rooms became available - which we did.   The staff moved all our belongings while we where out exploring the city! No hassle!
I need to give a shout out to my Bro Ricardo! (See photo). This guy is a legend - every morning having a bit of banter and just being a general really nice guy!  Thanks for making my stay a bit better by allowing me to make connections with people - as well as the place!

All in all I would stay in AC again.   It was a great price, a great location for our first time in New York, clean, modern, comfortable - and the hotels best asset is it's friendly staff.

Thanks for the memories guys!

Vanessa and the Tweed Family!

title: Great Potential for This New Hotel
text: In summary, it is very cool and modern, and overall a good choice. Hotel opened in April and is the newest in Marriott's AC Hotels, a Spanish chain Marriott acquired several years ago. First, the staff were terrific. You can see Marriott's Ritz Carlton customer service training really pays off. The hotel is clean and comfy. The rooms are average size with engineered wood floors and modern bathrooms. A few tubs, mostly big showers with both handheld and fixed rainforest heads. The platform beds were good. Some rooms have floor to ceiling windows with views. Most of the amenities you come to expect are included, such as free wi-fi, safe, coffeemaker, a few rooms with balconies, small refrigerator, big screen TV, plenty of USB and regular charging outlets. My list of nits are: no nightlight in bathroom, no glasses in bathroom, soap wrapped in plastic (not paper, and other less environmentally friendly options), low to the ground Euro toilets, hard sitting desk chair, cheap rough toilet paper, and loud elevator dings (can be heard in nearby rooms). They teamed with the popular Boqueria tapas chain for access to fresh breakfast, lunch and dinner choices. The just opened rooftop Castell Rooftop Lounge has great city views and its own restaurant with some great small dishes, like a chicken kabob and sliced steak. There is no room service, but you are steps away from dozens of food options, plus delivery. Location near Times Square and the Fashion District, bus terminal, is a big plus.  We'd go back.

title: Do Not Pay for A City View if You Need 2 Beds
text:
First stay at this location as I was looking for an upscale hotel near the Port Authority bus terminal.  The hotel itself was very clean and upscale however the front desk was rude and unwilling to resolve my issue.

I was traveling for work my coworker and I needed a room with 2 beds.  We had to pay a premium for the city view where our view was a brick building with broken windows, rusted out AC units, and lovely view into a sweatshop.  The fact they charged their guests a premium for this "city view" is disgusting and not what I would expect of a hotel associated with the Marriott brand.  I did not want to deal with switching rooms but upon my check out I requested we were reimbursed for the difference between a "city view high floor' and a "high floor" room and the front desk would not honor the request.  They advised that anything above the 17th floor (we stayed on the 17th floor) was considered "city" and that there was nothing further they could do for me.  They did not apologize for it either just defended it because we were on the 17th floor we had to pay a premium.  They said had we stayed in a king bed room we would have had a view of Manhattan but all doubles face the other direction.  I would have had no issues paying for what we purchases as a "high floor" but to have a category as "high floor city view' is unacceptable to charge a premium for what was outside of our window. 

In addition, I even had pictures showing the view (shown here) we paid for and no one cared nor did they have any interest in resolving these concerns.  Their exact response was that I was the first one to complain about this in addition to saying had I booked a king bed it would have been a non-issue.  I don't know who has trained their staff but this is an unacceptable response for a customer. 

I will not be back and will ensure no one from my company uses this hotel again when traveling to NYC.

title: Birthday Weekend Getaway
text:
Like many newer building in Manhattan, this hotel is butted-up against an older building on either side, You get used to this juxtaposition of old and new as you walk around downtown Manhattan. The hotel appears to be fairly new and possibly still under some construction, but nothing that impedes the normal flow of a great experience for the guests. 

The staff was absolutely amazing 24 hours a day. Always cheerful, responsive and helpful. The rooms are typically New York City small but comfortable and well appointed. The black-out curtains are mounted with side-rails so that when you put them down there is no light leakage at all: the room goes totally dark in a way that we had never experienced before, and we liked it. 

The location was perfect for anyone that wants to walk around the Times Square area, or jump on a train to go explore anywhere in New York City.

We absolutely recommend this location to anyone that is interested in staying in the midtown Manhattan area.

title: Sleek Contemporary Hotel in Times Square
text:
Although a loyal Marriott Rewards member, I hadn't previously stayed at one of their AC branded properties. 

First of all, the property is smack dab in the middle of the Times Square area of Manhattan. So if you like the hustle and bustle of Times Square or the convenience of being close to the theater district, the AC could not be better situated. Also, it was only a few steps from the nearest subway entrance. 

The style reminds me a bit of Starwood's W concept. Somewhat minimalist and very contemporary. The rooms are small, even by NYC standards. There is no separate enclosed closet but just a small hanging space for clothes.

The air conditioning unit was substandard in my opinion: noisy and a one degree change in setting made it either too warm or too cold in the room. We were constantly fiddling with the thermostat. 

The fitness center did exceed my expectations; spacious and well equipped. The staff was very friendly and tried to be helpful. However, there is no concierge staff and the front desk personnel were not that well versed on the surrounding area enough to make useful recommendations. 

In summary, the rooms are quite small and better suited for a single occupant. Also, you have to like being in Times Square.

title: Terrific new hotel I great location!
text:
